original: bdag bkag pa bzhin du srog dang gang zag dgag pa yang 'dra bar mthong nas /
analyzed: bdag bkag pa bzhin du srog dang gang zag dgag pa yang 'dra bar mthong nas /
translated: Just as the self is refuted, so the life force and the person are seen as being refuted in the same way.

original: lus dang dbang po'i tshogs rnams la //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po'i tshogs rnams la //
translated: The collection of bodies and faculties

original: de nyid du na bdag med 'dod //
analyzed: de nyid du na bdag med 'dod //
translated: is accepted as selfless in reality.

original: rgyu dang ldan phyir ka ba bzhin //üîΩyang na bsags phyir grog mkhar bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan phyir ka ba bzhin // yang na bsags phyir grog mkhar bzhin //
translated: Because it has a cause, like a pillar,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: or because it is accumulated, like an anthill.

original: bdag med ces bya ba ni de dag las bdag bral ba'i phyir bdag med do //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba ni de dag las bdag bral ba'i phyir bdag med do //
translated: Selfless means that the self is absent from them.

original: grog mkhar bzhin zhes bya ni grog ma'i brun bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: grog mkhar bzhin zhes bya ni grog ma'i brun bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Like an anthill means like an anthill.

original: mu stegs can dag na re ba dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mu stegs can dag na re ba dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas say: The self definitely exists,

original: dran pa dang ngo shes pa dang / shes pa skye ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis lus dang dbang po'i tshogs dag ni bdag dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang ngo shes pa dang / shes pa skye ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis lus dang dbang po'i tshogs dag ni bdag dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: because of reasons such as the arising of memory, recognition, and knowledge, the collection of bodies and faculties has a self.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bdag med pa dag la ni dran pa dang ngo shes pa skye ba ma mthong bas de'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa dag ni dag ni bdag gi chos yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bdag med pa dag la ni dran pa dang ngo shes pa skye ba ma mthong bas de'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa dag ni dag ni bdag gi chos yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But memory and recognition are not seen to arise in regard to such things as pots and cloth that are devoid of self. Therefore, memory and so on are the phenomena of a self.

original: des na bdag yod pa kho nar rjes su dpag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na bdag yod pa kho nar rjes su dpag go zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, it is said that the self alone is inferred.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:üîΩMemory, recognition,

original: dran pa dang ni ngo shes dang // shes skye la sogs gtan tshigs kyis ;
analyzed: dran pa dang ni ngo shes dang // shes skye la sogs gtan tshigs kyis ;
translated: and the arising of consciousness and so on,üîΩare not established as reasons

original: / bdag yod nyid du dam bca' ba //üîΩgtan tshigs rnams ni ma grub nyid //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: / bdag yod nyid du dam bca' ba // gtan tshigs rnams ni ma grub nyid // ces bya ba la /
translated: for the thesis that the self exists.

original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i yul dran pa ni dran pa'i chos so //
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i yul dran pa ni dran pa'i chos so //
translated: Here, memory is the phenomenon of memory in regard to an experienced object.

original: ngo shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos so //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos so //
translated: Recognition is the phenomenon of conditioning.

original: rtog ge'i yul la shes pa skye ba de dag ni bdag med kyang rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges @80a * //
analyzed: rtog ge'i yul la shes pa skye ba de dag ni bdag med kyang rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges @80a * //
translated: The arising of consciousness in regard to the object of sophistry, even though the self does not exist, is due to the individual ascertainment of causes and conditions.

original: sa tshogs pa'i dbang las sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam grangs kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par de dag 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sa tshogs pa'i dbang las sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam grangs kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par de dag 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: The various states of mind and mental factors arise from the power of the coming together of the elements.

original: de'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs rnams ni sangs rgyas pa dag las gzhan du ma grub pa nyid dang / phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyang yin no //üîΩgzhan yang // gal te dbang bcas lus la ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs rnams ni sangs rgyas pa dag las gzhan du ma grub pa nyid dang / phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyang yin no // gzhan yang // gal te dbang bcas lus la ni //
translated: Therefore, the reasonings of the opponent are not established for the Buddhist, and because there is no self other than the aggregates, the reasonings are also not established with regard to the basis.üîΩMoreover:üîΩIf you prove the existence of a self

original: bdag yod nyid du sgrub byed na //
analyzed: bdag yod nyid du sgrub byed na //
translated: in the body together with the faculties,

original: gtan tshigs thun mong nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thun mong nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: the reason is not common

original: rjes su 'gro ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med phyir ro //
translated: because there is no concomitance.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la dran pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir bdag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa ni ci dang 'dra zhes bya ba'i chos mthun pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la dran pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir bdag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa ni ci dang 'dra zhes bya ba'i chos mthun pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro
translated: If you prove the existence of a self in the body together with the faculties because you observe memory and so on in the body, then the reason is not common because there is no example that is similar to the predicate.

original: // dran pa la sogs pa bdag med pa dag la yang dran pa dang ngo shes pa dang / shes pa skye ba dag mthong ba'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: // dran pa la sogs pa bdag med pa dag la yang dran pa dang ngo shes pa dang / shes pa skye ba dag mthong ba'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: And because memory, recognition, and knowledge arise even in regard to things that are without self, the reason of memory is contradictory.

original: gal te 'di snyam du bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni kha cig la nye bar gdags su rung ba'i phyir don ji lta ba bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni kha cig la nye bar gdags su rung ba'i phyir don ji lta ba bzhin nyid de /
translated: If you think that the word ‚Äúself‚Äù is used in the sense of something that can be designated in some way, then the reason of memory is inconclusive.

original: dper na bram ze'i khye'u seng ge zhes bya ba yang bram ze'i khye'u de la g-yer bag dang / gtum bag dang / mthu rtsal la sogs pa dag snang bas de la seng ge zhes bya ba'i tha snyad nye bar gdags su yod pa las na /
analyzed: dper na bram ze'i khye'u seng ge zhes bya ba yang bram ze'i khye'u de la g-yer bag dang / gtum bag dang / mthu rtsal la sogs pa dag snang bas de la seng ge zhes bya ba'i tha snyad nye bar gdags su yod pa las na /
translated: For example, the expression ‚Äúlion cub‚Äù is used in regard to a brahman youth who is proud, fierce, and powerful.

original: log shig na seng ge zhes bya ba ral ba spungs pa la sogs pa'i khyad pa dang ldan pa'i ri dvags kyi rgyal po dngos yod par shes pa de bzhin du lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs skad cig ma la dran pa dang ngo shes pa dang
analyzed: log shig na seng ge zhes bya ba ral ba spungs pa la sogs pa'i khyad pa dang ldan pa'i ri dvags kyi rgyal po dngos yod par shes pa de bzhin du lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs skad cig ma la dran pa dang ngo shes pa dang
translated: Just as the lion, the king of beasts, who has the distinctive mane and so on, is known to exist, in the same way, since memory, recognition,üîΩand the designation of consciousness arising and so on appear in the collection of bodies, faculties, and minds, the self, which is the basis of these, definitely exists.

original: / shes pa skye ba la sogs pa nye bar gdags pa snang ba las na bdag ces bya ba dngos po gang la de dag yod pa'i bdag de yod pa kho na yin no snyam du pha rol po dag dran pa la sogs pa'i nye bar gdags pa yodüîΩpa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: / shes pa skye ba la sogs pa nye bar gdags pa snang ba las na bdag ces bya ba dngos po gang la de dag yod pa'i bdag de yod pa kho na yin no snyam du pha rol po dag dran pa la sogs pa'i nye bar gdags pa yod pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Thus the opponent thinks that the self, which is the basis of the designation of memory and so on, exists.

original: lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs de las gzhan pa'i bdag yod de snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas 'dir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs de las gzhan pa'i bdag yod de snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas 'dir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
translated: Here the master responds to the doubt that the self exists apart from the collection of bodies, faculties, and minds.

original: gal te bdag sgra don bzhin te //
analyzed: gal te bdag sgra don bzhin te //
translated: If the self is like the word's meaning,

original: 'ga' la nye bar gdags pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'ga' la nye bar gdags pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is designated in dependence on someüîΩthing,

original: seng ge'i sgra dang 'dra zhe na //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra dang 'dra zhe na //
translated: you say it is like the word lion.

original: bdag ni grub pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag ni grub pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: I am not established.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang @80b gi phyir dpe med pa dang / grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang @80b gi phyir dpe med pa dang / grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no example and because it is an establishment of what is already established.

original: 'di ltar sgra gang kha cig la te bar gdags pa de ni 'dus pa'i tshogs la mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra gang kha cig la te bar gdags pa de ni 'dus pa'i tshogs la mthong ste /
translated: Thus, the word ‚ÄúI‚Äù is seen to be applied to a collection of aggregates,

original: seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //üîΩbdag ni 'dus pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dus pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa gang la yang nye bar gdags pa mi snang ba'i phyir dpe med do //
analyzed: seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no // bdag ni 'dus pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dus pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa gang la yang nye bar gdags pa mi snang ba'i phyir dpe med do //
translated: like the word ‚Äúlion‚Äù and so on.

original: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: But the self is not of the nature of a collection, and therefore there is no example. And because it is an establishment of what is already established.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag kyang tha snyad du rnam par shes pa la bdag gi sgra dngos su 'dogs te //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag kyang tha snyad du rnam par shes pa la bdag gi sgra dngos su 'dogs te //
translated: For we also conventionally apply the word ‚Äúself‚Äù directly to consciousness.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni yang srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag yin no zhes lus dang dbang po'i tshogs dag la nye bar 'dogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni yang srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag yin no zhes lus dang dbang po'i tshogs dag la nye bar 'dogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: For we say that consciousness is the self because it is the appropriator of rebirth, and we apply the word ‚Äúself‚Äù to the collection of body and sense faculties.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dper na yan lag tshogs pa la //
analyzed: dper na yan lag tshogs pa la //
translated: For example, it is like the recollection

original: shing rta zhes ni dran pa ltar //
analyzed: shing rta zhes ni dran pa ltar //
translated: of a chariot in the collection of parts.

original: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas //
translated: In the same way, in dependence on the aggregates,

original: kun rdzob tu ni sems can brjod //üîΩces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sems can brjod // ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: conventionally a sentient being is expressed.

original: ci ste rnam shes yul la ni //
analyzed: ci ste rnam shes yul la ni //
translated: If you say that consciousness is establishedüîΩin an object as other,

original: don bzhin gzhan la sgrub ce na //
analyzed: don bzhin gzhan la sgrub ce na //
translated: it would be contradictory,

original: rtag dang kun 'gro sogs bral phyir //üîΩ'gal ba nyid du 'gyur pa yin //
analyzed: rtag dang kun 'gro sogs bral phyir // 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur pa yin //
translated: because it would be free from permanence, omnipresence, and so on.üîΩIf you say that in the same way that the BuddhistüîΩproponents of consciousness are established in consciousness,üîΩwe are established in a self that is other than consciousness,üîΩwe reply:

original: zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po dag sangs rgyas pa la rnam par shes pa la don ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag dngos yin par tha snyad gdags pa grub pa de kho bo cag bdag dam pa gzhan la don ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po dag sangs rgyas pa la rnam par shes pa la don ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag dngos yin par tha snyad gdags pa grub pa de kho bo cag bdag dam pa gzhan la don ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag
translated: If you say that consciousness is established in an object as other,

original: dngos yin par tha snyad gdags su rung bar sgrub po zhe na /
analyzed: dngos yin par tha snyad gdags su rung bar sgrub po zhe na /
translated: it would be contradictory, because it would be free from permanence, omnipresence, and so on.üîΩIf you say that in the same way that the Buddhist proponents of consciousness are established in consciousness, we are established in a self that is other than consciousness, we reply:

original: de ltar na bdag dam pa de rnam par shes pa kho na bzhin du rtag pa dang kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa dang bral bas de'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin du rjes su dpog pas mi rtag pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag dam pa chos can de'i rang gi ngo bo gsal ba'i phyir 'gal ba nyid 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir gang la'ang don dam du //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag dam pa de rnam par shes pa kho na bzhin du rtag pa dang kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa dang bral bas de'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin du rjes su dpog pas mi rtag pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag dam pa chos can de'i rang gi ngo bo gsal ba'i phyir 'gal ba nyid 'gyur ro // de'i phyir gang la'ang don dam du //
translated: Thus, the self would be impermanent and not omnipresent, like consciousness, because it is devoid of permanence and omnipresence, just like consciousness. Therefore, it would be contradictory for the self to be the nature of that which is characterized by impermanence and non-omnipresence, because it is clearly manifest.üîΩTherefore, it is said:üîΩNo one is ultimately bound,

original: bcings dang thar pa yong mi 'dod //
analyzed: bcings dang thar pa yong mi 'dod //
translated: nor is anyone liberated.

original: ces bya ba ni ming dang gzugs sam /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ming dang gzugs sam /
translated: This means that the self is not tenable as either name-and-form,

original: gan gzag gam /
analyzed: gan gzag gam /
translated: or as a support,

original: bdag gang la yang brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩsong dang ma song bgom pa yi //üîΩde bzhin sems la lhag ma bshad //
analyzed: bdag gang la yang brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // song dang ma song bgom pa yi // de bzhin sems la lhag ma bshad //
translated: because it cannot withstand analysis.üîΩThe remainder of the mind should be explained in the same way as the gone, not-gone, and that being gone over.

original: ces bya ba ni ji ltar song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba mi 'thad pa de bzhin du sems kyang bcings pa'am ma bcings pa'am /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ji ltar song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba mi 'thad pa de bzhin du sems kyang bcings pa'am ma bcings pa'am /
translated: Just as going is untenable on that being gone over, the gone, and the not-gone, in the same way, the mind is not bound, not unbound,

original: 'ching ba bzhin pa zhig 'ching grang //üîΩgrol ba yang @81a * //
analyzed: 'ching ba bzhin pa zhig 'ching grang // grol ba yang @81a * //
translated: Is that which is being bound bound?üîΩOr is that which is liberated liberated?

original: grol ba'am ma grol ba'am grol bzhin pa zhig 'grol grang na /
analyzed: grol ba'am ma grol ba'am grol bzhin pa zhig 'grol grang na /
translated: Or is that which is being liberated liberated?

original: de la re zhig bcings pa la ni yang 'ching ba don med do //
analyzed: de la re zhig bcings pa la ni yang 'ching ba don med do //
translated: First, it is pointless for that which is bound to be bound again.

original: ma bcings pa la yang 'ching ba med pa'i phyir grol ba bzhin du 'ching ba med do //
analyzed: ma bcings pa la yang 'ching ba med pa'i phyir grol ba bzhin du 'ching ba med do //
translated: And that which is not bound is not bound, like that which is liberated, because it is not bound.

original: 'ching bzhin pa la yang gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'ching bzhin pa la yang gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ro ;
translated: And for that which is being bound, both errors would apply.

original: / grol ba la yang 'grol ba med de /
analyzed: / grol ba la yang 'grol ba med de /
translated: And that which is liberated is not liberated,

original: bcings pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcings pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not bound.

original: ma grol ba la yang 'grol ba med de /
analyzed: ma grol ba la yang 'grol ba med de /
translated: And that which is not liberated is not liberated,

original: dper na nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gis bcings pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gis bcings pa bzhin no //
translated: like that which is completely bound by all the afflictions.

original: ci ste grol bzhin pa la 'grol ba yod de /
analyzed: ci ste grol bzhin pa la 'grol ba yod de /
translated: But if that which is being liberated is liberated,

original: mtshan nyid las /
analyzed: mtshan nyid las /
translated: because it is said in the treatise:

original: mi slob sems ni skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: mi slob sems ni skye bzhin pa //
translated: The mind of one beyond training,

original: sgrib pa las ni rnam par 'grol //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib pa las ni rnam par 'grol // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: is liberated from the obscurations as it arises.

original: 'grol bzhin pa de yang gang yin /
analyzed: 'grol bzhin pa de yang gang yin /
translated: What is that which is being liberated?

original: gal te bcings pa yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te bcings pa yin na ni //
translated: If it is bound,

original: bcings pa dang 'grol ba gnyis dus gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcings pa dang 'grol ba gnyis dus gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The error of bondage and liberation occurring at the same time would follow.

original: gal te ma bcings pa yin na ni de gang las grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te ma bcings pa yin na ni de gang las grol bar 'gyur /
translated: If it were not bound, then from what would it be liberated?

original: gal te gnyis ka'i bdag nyid gcig na ni mi mthun te gal te bcings pa yin na ni grol ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te gnyis ka'i bdag nyid gcig na ni mi mthun te gal te bcings pa yin na ni grol ba ma yin la /
translated: If it were both, it would be contradictory: if it were bound, it would not be liberated;

original: 'on te grol ba yin na ni bcings pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te grol ba yin na ni bcings pa ma yin no //
translated: but if it were liberated, it would not be bound.

original: gal te brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig na ni ngo bo nyid nyams so //
analyzed: gal te brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig na ni ngo bo nyid nyams so //
translated: If it were indescribable, its nature would be lost.

original: slob pa'i sems sems snga ma'i skad cig ma la ltos nas rnam par grol par rtog pa la ni tha snyad yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyams so //
analyzed: slob pa'i sems sems snga ma'i skad cig ma la ltos nas rnam par grol par rtog pa la ni tha snyad yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyams so //
translated: If you imagine that the mind of a learner is liberated in dependence on the prior moment of the mind, then your assertion is lost, because it is a convention.

original: de'i phyir sems la yang don dam par ni bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems la yang don dam par ni bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, in reality, bondage and liberation are untenable even in the mind.

original: de'i phyir lung las rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'khor ba sel bar mi mdzad la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung las rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'khor ba sel bar mi mdzad la /
translated: Therefore, a scripture says, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, the TathƒÅgata does not eliminate sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par yang mi mdzad de //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par yang mi mdzad de //
translated: nor does he establish nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar mnyam pa nyid la 'khor bar 'gyur ba yang med /
analyzed: 'di ltar mnyam pa nyid la 'khor bar 'gyur ba yang med /
translated: Because in suchness there is no cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'das bar 'gyur ba yang med /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das bar 'gyur ba yang med /
translated: no nirvana,

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba yang med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba yang med /
translated: no affliction,

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: and no purification.

original: gal te de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If affliction and purification do not exist,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: why did the BhagavƒÅn teach

original: chags pas chos rnams mi shes shing //
analyzed: chags pas chos rnams mi shes shing //
translated: that due to attachment one does not know phenomena

original: chags pas chos rnams mi mthong ste //
analyzed: chags pas chos rnams mi mthong ste //
translated: and due to attachment one does not see phenomena?

original: mi gang @81b 'dod chags bsten byed pa //
analyzed: mi gang @81b 'dod chags bsten byed pa //
translated: The person who relies on desire

original: de tshe mun pas mun nag 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe mun pas mun nag 'gyur //
translated: will be plunged from darkness into darkness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa mdzad cing //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa mdzad cing //
translated: Thus he taught the faults of affliction,

original: gang dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis ngoms pa de dag ni ngoms pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i yon tan bsngags par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gang dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis ngoms pa de dag ni ngoms pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i yon tan bsngags par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why did he praise the qualities of purification, saying, ‚ÄúThose who are satisfied with the wisdom of the ƒÅryas are satisfied‚Äù?üîΩThe explanation is this: The assembly of attachment-like formations is like the attachment of a gandharva to a beautiful woman in a city of gandharvas.

original: bshad pa / chags pa sgyu ma lta bu'i 'du byed kyi tshogs 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'jug pa shas che ba dri za'i grong khyer gyi bud med bzang mo la chags pa lta bu dang / de'i nyes dmigs mthong ba la brten nas kun rdzob pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / chags pa sgyu ma lta bu'i 'du byed kyi tshogs 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'jug pa shas che ba dri za'i grong khyer gyi bud med bzang mo la chags pa lta bu dang / de'i nyes dmigs mthong ba la brten nas kun rdzob pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since the faults of attachment are seen, those conventional attachments and so on do exist.

original: don dam par ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni /
translated: But ultimately,

original: gang che sems ni 'gag pa la //
analyzed: gang che sems ni 'gag pa la //
translated: when the great mind is stopped,

original: mngon du phyogs shing skyes pa'i tshe //üîΩgang la gang gis chags par 'dod //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs shing skyes pa'i tshe // gang la gang gis chags par 'dod //
translated: at the time of its arising,üîΩto what and by what is attachment asserted?

original: chags pa 'ga' la'ang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: chags pa 'ga' la'ang mi 'dod do //
translated: Attachment is not asserted for anyone at all.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'dod chags dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems la chags pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa yin na de yang gang gi tshe 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs bzhin kho nar skyes pa de'i tshe na sems 'gag pa'i chos can de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'dod chags dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems la chags pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa yin na de yang gang gi tshe 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs bzhin kho nar skyes pa de'i tshe na sems 'gag pa'i chos can de la /
translated: If it is said that attachment is concomitant with the mind, then when the mind is about to cease and is born, at that time the mind has the attribute of cessation.

original: gang la 'dod chags gang gis chags par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang la 'dod chags gang gis chags par 'gyur //
translated: What attachment would it be attached to?

original: gzhan yang 'dod chags pa gang yin pa de yang 'gags shing nyams pa na chags pa la yang 'dod chags skye bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags pa gang yin pa de yang 'gags shing nyams pa na chags pa la yang 'dod chags skye bar mi 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, when the one who is attached ceases and is destroyed, attachment is not asserted to arise in the one who is attached.

original: 'dod chags skye ba don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags skye ba don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be pointless for attachment to arise.

original: chags pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma la yang 'dod chags yod par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: chags pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma la yang 'dod chags yod par mi 'dod de /
translated: Attachment is also not asserted to exist in the mind that is not attached.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin no //üîΩgal te skye bzhin chags she na //üîΩde cig gal te skye mngon phyogs //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin no // gal te skye bzhin chags she na // de cig gal te skye mngon phyogs //
translated: Because it would be free from attachment.üîΩIf it is said that attachment arises in the one who is attached,

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te sems skye bzhin pa chags par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te sems skye bzhin pa chags par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that attachment arises in the one who is attached,

original: skye bzhin de ci skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig yin /
analyzed: skye bzhin de ci skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig yin /
translated: Is that now arising arisen or non-arisen?

original: gal te skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa yin te /
translated: If it is that which is directed toward arising,

original: de ni skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not arisen

original: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not fully established.

original: ma skyes pa yang ma yin te bya ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang ma yin te bya ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Nor is it non-arisen because the action of arising is engaged.

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: ma skyes pa la de mi 'dod //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la de mi 'dod //
translated: it is not asserted to be non-arisen.

original: gzhi med bya ba mi ldan phyir //üîΩzhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi med bya ba mi ldan phyir // zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because an action is not related to a non-basis.

original: 'di ltar bya ba ni byed pa po la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba ni byed pa po la brten pa yin te /
translated: Thus an action is related to an agent,

original: dper na lha sbyin za bar byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu yin na /üîΩskye bzhin @82a * //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin za bar byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu yin na / skye bzhin @82a * //
translated: for example, like Devadatta is the one who performs eating.

original: pa ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma grub pas ma skyes pa yin pas de ci ltar skye ba'i bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: pa ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma grub pas ma skyes pa yin pas de ci ltar skye ba'i bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: Since that now arising is not arisen because its own nature is not fully established, how could it be related to the action of arising?

original: gal te skye bzhin pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye bzhin pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that now arising is not to be expressed,

original: de lta na de skyes pa nyid dang ma skyes pa nyid du brjod par mi nus pas /
analyzed: de lta na de skyes pa nyid dang ma skyes pa nyid du brjod par mi nus pas /
translated: then it cannot be said to be either arisen or non-arisen.

original: skye bzhin skyes dang ma skyes par //
analyzed: skye bzhin skyes dang ma skyes par //
translated: Nor is it said that the one who is being born is born or is not born.

original: brjod pa min la'ang chags pa med //
analyzed: brjod pa min la'ang chags pa med //
translated: Nor is there attachment to what is not expressed.

original: brjod med sems kyang chags min te //
analyzed: brjod med sems kyang chags min te //
translated: Nor is there attachment to the inexpressible mind.

original: brjod pa med phyir 'dod chags bzhin //
analyzed: brjod pa med phyir 'dod chags bzhin //
translated: Because it is not expressed, like attachment.

original: zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is what it says.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags kyang chags pa nyid dam chags pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags kyang chags pa nyid dam chags pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: Because attachment is not to be expressed as being attached or as not being attached,

original: ji ltar 'dod chags las chags pa med pa bzhin du sems kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags las chags pa med pa bzhin du sems kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: just as there is no attachment apart from attachment, so it is with the mind. This is the meaning.

original: gal te sems ni chags pa yi //
analyzed: gal te sems ni chags pa yi //
translated: If the mind is attached,

original: rnam par skyes pa chags 'dod de //
analyzed: rnam par skyes pa chags 'dod de //
translated: the one who is born in the aspect of attachment is asserted to be attached.

original: shes la tshon chags blo bzhin na //
analyzed: shes la tshon chags blo bzhin na //
translated: Like a mind attached to a color,

original: de'i blo ji ltar chags nyid yin //
analyzed: de'i blo ji ltar chags nyid yin //
translated: how is that mind attached?

original: zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang / lhag par chags pa dang 'dod chags zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang / lhag par chags pa dang 'dod chags zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs te /
translated: Attachment, excessive attachment, and desire are synonyms.

original: sems de dag gi rnam par yongs su gyur pa chags par 'dod de /
analyzed: sems de dag gi rnam par yongs su gyur pa chags par 'dod de /
translated: The transformation of those minds into attachment is asserted.

original: shel la tshon gyis chags pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: shel la tshon gyis chags pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: It is like the idea of color in a crystal.

original: zhes pha rol po'i bsam pa nye bar bzhag pa'i dpe de la bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: zhes pha rol po'i bsam pa nye bar bzhag pa'i dpe de la bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid du ston te /
translated: In this example, which presents the opponent‚Äôs opinion, the author shows that the object to be established is empty.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten na nor bu shel la kha bsgyur ba'i rkyen nye bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten na nor bu shel la kha bsgyur ba'i rkyen nye bar gyur pa na /
translated: In the world, when a crystal is affected by the condition of a color,

original: de'i bdag nyid du yongs su gyur pa chags pa zhes nye bar 'dogs pas de'i blo yang chags pa nyid du nye bar btags pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du yongs su gyur pa chags pa zhes nye bar 'dogs pas de'i blo yang chags pa nyid du nye bar btags pa kho nar zad do //
translated: it is said that it is ‚Äúaffected‚Äù by the transformation into that nature. The idea of it is also merely designated as ‚Äúaffected.‚Äù

original: rigs pa'i sgo nas ni re zhig nor bu shel de nyid kyang chags pa ma yin na de'i blo lta chags pa nyid dug la 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs pa'i sgo nas ni re zhig nor bu shel de nyid kyang chags pa ma yin na de'i blo lta chags pa nyid dug la 'gyur /
translated: From the point of view of reasoning, the crystal itself is not affected, so how could the idea of it be affected?

original: de bzhin du sems kyi skad cig ma yang dang po yul dang phrad pa na chags pa'i rnam par yongs su gyur pa la chags pa zhes nye bar gdags par zad kyi de chags nyid ni ma yin te //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyi skad cig ma yang dang po yul dang phrad pa na chags pa'i rnam par yongs su gyur pa la chags pa zhes nye bar gdags par zad kyi de chags nyid ni ma yin te //
translated: In the same way, the moment of mind that first encounters the object is merely designated as ‚Äúaffected‚Äù by the transformation into the aspect of attachment; it is not attachment itself.

original: rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the discursive thought of conceptualization and the discursive thought of memory.

original: des mngon par bsgrubs pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa'i blo skye ba de la ni re zhig yul nye bar gnas pa med do //
analyzed: des mngon par bsgrubs pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa'i blo skye ba de la ni re zhig yul nye bar gnas pa med do //
translated: The cognition that arises in the second moment, which is produced by that, does not have an object that is present, because the object of the first moment of cognition is not present in the second moment.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma dang po'i rjes su myongs ba yang tha snyad gdags su rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir de la yang yul yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma dang po'i rjes su myongs ba yang tha snyad gdags su rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir de la yang yul yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it have an object that is past, because the experience of the first moment of cognition is not suitable to be designated as a convention.

original: de ltar chags @82b pa med pa'i phyir //üîΩ'dod chags rtog pa kun rdzob yin //
analyzed: de ltar chags @82b pa med pa'i phyir // 'dod chags rtog pa kun rdzob yin //
translated: Thus, because it is free from attachment,üîΩattachment is a conceptual thought that is a superficial reality.

original: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnam kun //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnam kun //
translated: All phenomena are like attachment.

original: ci rigs par ni shes par bya //
analyzed: ci rigs par ni shes par bya //
translated: They should be understood in the appropriate way.

original: dngos po rdzas la brten rigs na //
analyzed: dngos po rdzas la brten rigs na //
translated: If a substance that is a thing were a type of entity,

original: de yang de las dbyer yod min //
analyzed: de yang de las dbyer yod min //
translated: it would not be possible to separate it from that.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di na chags par byed pa'i dngos po ni 'dod chags so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di na chags par byed pa'i dngos po ni 'dod chags so ;
translated: Here, attachment is a thing that causes attachment.

original: / dngos po de yang rdzas la brten te dper na snam bu'i tshon dang / 'bras chan gyi chos pa zhes bya ba lta bur rigs grang na /
analyzed: / dngos po de yang rdzas la brten te dper na snam bu'i tshon dang / 'bras chan gyi chos pa zhes bya ba lta bur rigs grang na /
translated: And if that entity is based on a substance, it is like the color of a cloth or the heat of rice-gruel.

original: dngos po de yang rdzas de las tha dad par dbye zhing bstan par mi nus te //
analyzed: dngos po de yang rdzas de las tha dad par dbye zhing bstan par mi nus te //
translated: But that entity cannot be separated from that substance and shown to be different from it.

original: dper na snam bu las logs shog na tshon yod pa ma yin pa dang // 'bras chan las logs shig na chos pa yod pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snam bu las logs shog na tshon yod pa ma yin pa dang // 'bras chan las logs shig na chos pa yod pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if cloth is removed, the color is not there; and if rice-gruel is removed, the heat is not there.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags 'dis sems 'di chags so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di sgrub par dka' pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rtog pa ni kun rdzob pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags 'dis sems 'di chags so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di sgrub par dka' pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rtog pa ni kun rdzob pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is difficult to establish the convention ‚ÄúThis mind is attached by this attachment,‚Äù the idea of attachment is superficial.

original: de phyir 'dod chags ji bzhin du //
analyzed: de phyir 'dod chags ji bzhin du //
translated: Therefore, just like attachment,

original: sems la'ang chags pa 'thad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sems la'ang chags pa 'thad mi 'gyur //
translated: It is not tenable that the mind is attached.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis dbyer med pas rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis dbyer med pas rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: This is because attachment and the one who is attached are inseparable, and it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: de gnyis dbyer med pa ni tshad ma 'dis sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de gnyis dbyer med pa ni tshad ma 'dis sgrub par byed de /
translated: This is established by this valid cognition.

original: 'dod chags 'chags las gzhan mi rigs //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'chags las gzhan mi rigs //
translated: It is not logical that attachment is different from one who is attached,

original: chags pa mang zung gzung med phyir //
analyzed: chags pa mang zung gzung med phyir //
translated: because there is no attachment without one who is attached.

original: chags pa nyid bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags ni chags pa las logs shig na yod pa ma yin la //
analyzed: chags pa nyid bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags ni chags pa las logs shig na yod pa ma yin la //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like one who is attached‚Äù means that attachment does not exist separately from one who is attached,

original: chags pa yang 'dod chags las logs shig na yod pa ma yin pas dper na chags pa nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: chags pa yang 'dod chags las logs shig na yod pa ma yin pas dper na chags pa nyid bzhin te /
translated: and one who is attached does not exist separately from attachment. For example, just like one who is attached,

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because attachment and one who is attached are not different.

original: tha dad na'ang /
analyzed: tha dad na'ang /
translated: If they were different,

original: des ni mi chags gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: des ni mi chags gzhan bzhin no //
translated: then one who is not attached would be attached.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang dag 'dod chags ni chags pa las tha dad pa yin te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dag 'dod chags ni chags pa las tha dad pa yin te //
translated: This is because those who say that attachment is different from one who is attachedüîΩsay that attachment is like a dye that stains one who is attached,

original: dper na leb rgan rtsi dang gur gum la sogs pa gos pa chags pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na leb rgan rtsi dang gur gum la sogs pa gos pa chags pa bzhin du /
translated: like saffron and so on.

original: kha dog yid 'phrog pa dang / sgra snyan pa dang / dri zhim pa dang / ro mngar ba dang / reg bya 'jam pa la sogs pa dag la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi sems chags par 'gyur bar 'dod pa de la yang tha dad pa nyid yin par 'dra bzhin du gzugs la sogs pas ni sems chags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: kha dog yid 'phrog pa dang / sgra snyan pa dang / dri zhim pa dang / ro mngar ba dang / reg bya 'jam pa la sogs pa dag la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi sems chags par 'gyur bar 'dod pa de la yang tha dad pa nyid yin par 'dra bzhin du gzugs la sogs pas ni sems chags par 'gyur la /
translated: The mind is attached to the desire for the objects of attachment, such as attractive colors, pleasant sounds, sweet smells, sweet tastes, and soft tactile objects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag @83a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag @83a * //
translated: But the mind is not attached to the objects of attachment themselves,

original: nyid ni gcig la gcig chags par mi 'gyur ba dang / yul yid du mi 'ong ba dag gis kyang chags par mi 'gyur ba 'di la gtan tshigs kyi khyad par yang dag par brjod dgos so //
analyzed: nyid ni gcig la gcig chags par mi 'gyur ba dang / yul yid du mi 'ong ba dag gis kyang chags par mi 'gyur ba 'di la gtan tshigs kyi khyad par yang dag par brjod dgos so //
translated: and it is not attached to unpleasant objects. You must state the specific reason for this.

original: gzhan yang gal te sems las logs shig na 'dod chags zhes bya ba dmigs su yod cing des chags pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sems las logs shig na 'dod chags zhes bya ba dmigs su yod cing des chags pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if attachment is something that exists apart from the mind and is observed, then it would be the cause of attachment.üîΩTherefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / dngos po rnam par rig pa'i sems //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po rnam par rig pa'i sems //
translated: The mind that is aware of things

original: 'dod chags las gzhan yod min te //
analyzed: 'dod chags las gzhan yod min te //
translated: is not different from attachment.

original: dmigs pa la sogs mtshungs phyir dang // tha dad rgyu gzhan med phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la sogs mtshungs phyir dang // tha dad rgyu gzhan med phyir ro // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the object, etc. are the same, and because there is no other cause for difference.

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa yin no //
translated: The definition of consciousness is the individual perception of things such as form.

original: dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i rnam par shes pa las logs shig na 'dod chags kyi myong ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i rnam par shes pa las logs shig na 'dod chags kyi myong ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Apart from consciousness, the individual perception of things, there is no feeling of attachment at all,

original: gzugs la sogs pa las logs shig na yul gzhan 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gang gis tha dad par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde phyir 'dus pa gcig rang nyid //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las logs shig na yul gzhan 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gang gis tha dad par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro // de phyir 'dus pa gcig rang nyid //
translated: because there is no other object apart from form, etc., and because there is no other cause for difference.

original: skyes la ltos nas 'dus pa can //
analyzed: skyes la ltos nas 'dus pa can //
translated: Therefore, the collection itself is the cause of the feeling of attachment.üîΩBut, in dependence on the arising of the collection, there is the conventional expression ‚Äúpossessor of the collection.‚Äù

original: tha snyad bstan pa nyid 'dod de /
analyzed: tha snyad bstan pa nyid 'dod de /
translated: We accept this teaching of convention

original: me tog rgyas pas shing bzhin no //
analyzed: me tog rgyas pas shing bzhin no //
translated: just as we accept the expression ‚Äúflowering tree.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi lugs ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dus pa'i yan lag gcig rang gi bdag nyid thob pa la ltos nas sems dang sems snga las byung ba 'dus pa can dag la
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi lugs ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dus pa'i yan lag gcig rang gi bdag nyid thob pa la ltos nas sems dang sems snga las byung ba 'dus pa can dag la
translated: In our system, attachment and so on are imputed to be one part of the collection of primary minds and mental factors that arise from the mind and are concomitant with it, in dependence on the attainment of their own nature by the method of the reality of correct conventionalities.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes bya bar tha snyad du bstan pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes bya bar tha snyad du bstan pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: We assert that they are taught to be called attachment and so on.

original: dper na rtsa ba dang / myu gu dang lcug ma dang / sbal mig dang / lo ma dang me tog dang / 'bras bu la sogs 'dus pa yan lag can gyi shing la me tog gam 'bras bu'i yan lag gang yang rung ba cig shas cher gyur pa mthong ba la ltos nas shing me tog rgyas so zhe'am /üîΩljon pa 'bras bu chags so zhes tha snyad gdags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtsa ba dang / myu gu dang lcug ma dang / sbal mig dang / lo ma dang me tog dang / 'bras bu la sogs 'dus pa yan lag can gyi shing la me tog gam 'bras bu'i yan lag gang yang rung ba cig shas cher gyur pa mthong ba la ltos nas shing me tog rgyas so zhe'am /üîΩljon pa 'bras bu chags so zhes tha snyad gdags pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, in dependence on seeing that any one of the parts of a tree, such as a root, sprout, stem, bud, leaf, flower, or fruit, is predominant, the convention ‚ÄúThe tree has flowers‚Äù or ‚ÄúThe tree has fruit‚Äù is designated.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa de nyid la gnas skabs bzhin gyi bye brag gis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tha snyad du gdags par zad de //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa de nyid la gnas skabs bzhin gyi bye brag gis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tha snyad du gdags par zad de //
translated: Therefore, it is merely the consciousness itself that is designated as attachment and so on, according to its specific states.

original: de yang 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ma yin pas 'dod chags yod pa ma yin pa'i @83b phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ma yin pas 'dod chags yod pa ma yin pa'i @83b phyir /
translated: Moreover, since it is a composite, it is not ultimate. Therefore attachment does not exist.

original: chags pa yang ga la yod la kun nas nyon mongs pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chags pa yang ga la yod la kun nas nyon mongs pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: How could one who is attached exist? Affliction does not exist.

original: de'i phyir lung las /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung las /
translated: Therefore, this is stated in scripture:

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni 'dod chags kyi chos can ma yin /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni 'dod chags kyi chos can ma yin /
translated: SuvikrƒÅntavikrƒÅmin, form is not a phenomenon possessing attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos can ma yin /
translated: It is not a phenomenon devoid of attachment.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can ma yin /
translated: It is not a phenomenon possessing affliction.üîΩIt is not a phenomenon possessing purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag nye bar gzhag pa yin no /üîΩ// / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /üîΩbam po drug pa /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag nye bar gzhag pa yin no / // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba / bam po drug pa /
translated: This is stated in the s≈´tras.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: 'dod chags ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Attachment surely exists,

original: de spang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its abandonment is taught.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThe exhaustion of craving that arises together with the attachment of pleasure, the freedom from attachment, and the cessation is nirvana.‚ÄùüîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩBecause attachment does not exist,

original: bshad pa / ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa / ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: as it was explained,

original: de spangs phyir ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: de spangs phyir ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: its abandonment is nirvana.

original: mi rigs de nyid mi 'thad phyir //
analyzed: mi rigs de nyid mi 'thad phyir //
translated: That is illogical, because that is untenable.

original: mya ngan 'das pa don dam du //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa don dam du //
translated: In ultimate reality,

original: dngos dang dngos med mtshan nyid min /
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med mtshan nyid min /
translated: nirvana is not characterized as a thing or a nonthing.

original: // / zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pas don dam par dpyad pa mi bzod pa'i phyir de nyid mi rogs so //
analyzed: // / zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pas don dam par dpyad pa mi bzod pa'i phyir de nyid mi rogs so //
translated: Because nirvana cannot withstand analysis in ultimate reality, that is illogical.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la bye brag tu smra ba dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod pa dang / rtag pa dang rtag pa'i dngos po bdag nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di la bye brag tu smra ba dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod pa dang / rtag pa dang rtag pa'i dngos po bdag nyid du 'dod do //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that nirvana is a thing, a permanent real entity.üîΩThe SautrƒÅntikas and the TƒÅmra≈õƒÅ·π≠ƒ´yas say that it is the mere absence of the aggregates.

original: mdo sde pa dang gos dmar sde pa dag ni phung po med pa tsam ste /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dang gos dmar sde pa dag ni phung po med pa tsam ste /
translated: The S≈´tra says,

original: mar me shi bar gyur pa ltar //
analyzed: mar me shi bar gyur pa ltar //
translated: Like a lamp that is extinguished,

original: de yi sems ni rnam par thar //üîΩzhes brjod do /
analyzed: de yi sems ni rnam par thar // zhes brjod do /
translated: his mind is liberated.

original: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas say that nirvana is both a thing and a nonthing.

original: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni lung dang dbang po dang / blo med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni lung dang dbang po dang / blo med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yin la /
translated: Nirvana is a nonthing because it is not mentioned in any scripture, it is not an object of the sense faculties, and it is not an object of the mental faculty.

original: gtan gyi bde ba bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gtan gyi bde ba bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Nirvana is a thing because it is endowed with the highest, eternal bliss.

original: de'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pas gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyang bkag pa byas par 'gyur bas de'i phyir ro zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pas gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyang bkag pa byas par 'gyur bas de'i phyir ro zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid dgag par bya ste /
translated: Since the nature of both is refuted by the refutation of its entity and nonentity, therefore, the nature of both entity and nonentity is refuted.

original: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
translated: If nirvana were an entity,üîΩit would be a conditioned thing,

original: dngos po yin phyir de 'dus byas //üîΩ@84a * // zhes bya ba la dngos po zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po ste /
analyzed: dngos po yin phyir de 'dus byas // @84a * // zhes bya ba la dngos po zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po ste /
translated: because it would be an entity,üîΩbecause it would arise.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it would be an entity, it would be a conditioned thing, because it would arise, because it would be produced by causes and conditions.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por rjes su dpag pas 'dus byas nyid kyis 'dus ma byas nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo nyid nyams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por rjes su dpag pas 'dus byas nyid kyis 'dus ma byas nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo nyid nyams so //
translated: Therefore, since nirvana is inferred to be an entity, its nature as a phenomenon is undermined, because conditionedness is refuted by unconditionedness.

original: gzhan yang mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus byas kyi gnyen po yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus byas kyi gnyen po yin par 'dod na /
translated: Moreover, if nirvana were a conditioned thing,üîΩit would not be the antidote to conditioned things,

original: gal te 'dus byas yin na /üîΩgnyen po ma yin 'dus byas phyir //
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas yin na /üîΩgnyen po ma yin 'dus byas phyir //
translated: because it would be a conditioned thing.

original: dper na 'dus byas 'gag pa bzhin //
analyzed: dper na 'dus byas 'gag pa bzhin //
translated: Just like the cessation of conditioned things.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, it would be like a conditioned thing that has ceased.

original: gal te dngos med gzhan rten 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te dngos med gzhan rten 'gyur //

analyzed: dngos po med phyir zhig pa bzhin //
translated: it would be like a thing, because it does not exist.

original: de ni gnyen por mi 'dod de //
analyzed: de ni gnyen por mi 'dod de //
translated: It is not asserted to be an antidote,

original: gzhan la rten phyir zhig bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan la rten phyir zhig bzhin no //
translated: because it is like a thing that is dependent on another.

original: zhes bya ba la dngos po med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dag ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dngos po med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dag ni rnam grangs te /
translated: Non-thing and insubstantial are synonyms.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa nyid yin na bde ba nyid la sogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa nyid yin na bde ba nyid la sogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir //
translated: If nirvana were a non-thing, it would be untenable as bliss, and so on,

original: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas ngo bo nyid nyams so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas ngo bo nyid nyams so //
translated: because it would be like a sky flower, and its nature would be impaired.

original: de gzhan la brten pa yin par yang 'gyur te //
analyzed: de gzhan la brten pa yin par yang 'gyur te //

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir zhig pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir zhig pa bzhin te /

original: dper na kong bu dang 'bru mar dang snying po la sogs pa 'dus pa las mar me zhes bya bar 'jig rten la grags pha phyis dngos po med par gyur pa ni dngos po gzhan la brten pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa phung po'i rgyun gyi
analyzed: dper na kong bu dang 'bru mar dang snying po la sogs pa 'dus pa las mar me zhes bya bar 'jig rten la grags pha phyis dngos po med par gyur pa ni dngos po gzhan la brten pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa phung po'i rgyun gyi
translated: Just as the nonexistence of a thing is dependent on another thing, so too nirvana is the exhaustion of craving in the continuum of the aggregates, and the nonexistence of appropriation is dependent on appropriation.

original: sred pa zad pa las len pa med pa dang / dngos po med pa zhes bya ba yang mar me zhig pa bzhin du dngos po la brten pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa zad pa las len pa med pa dang / dngos po med pa zhes bya ba yang mar me zhig pa bzhin du dngos po la brten pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the extinction of a lamp is dependent on a thing, so too nirvana is dependent on the aggregates.

original: khyed cag mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi 'jig pa dang rtag par khas len na de gzhan la brten pa dang / zhig pa lta bu yin na 'khor ba'i gnyen po nyid yin par yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: khyed cag mya ngan las 'das pa ni mi 'jig pa dang rtag par khas len na de gzhan la brten pa dang / zhig pa lta bu yin na 'khor ba'i gnyen po nyid yin par yang mi 'thad do //
translated: If you accept that nirvana is imperishable and permanent, and it is dependent on another and is like an extinction, then it is untenable that it is the antidote to samsara.

original: 'on lung las /
analyzed: 'on lung las /
translated: In a sutra it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, nirvana is the exhaustion of all fabrications.‚Äù

original: dge slong dag mya ngan las 'das pa de ni ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / 'dus ma byas pa nyid du yod do zhes gsungs pas 'dus ma byas pa'i bdag nyid kyi myang ngan las 'das pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag mya ngan las 'das pa de ni ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / 'dus ma byas pa nyid du yod do zhes gsungs pas 'dus ma byas pa'i bdag nyid kyi myang ngan las 'das pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, nirvana exists as non-arisen, non-ceased, and unconditioned.‚ÄùüîΩBut isn‚Äôt nirvana the unconditioned reality?

original: bshad pa / de ni 'dus ma byas mi rigs //
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni 'dus ma byas mi rigs //

original: dgag pa gong du bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dgag pa gong du bstan pa'i phyir //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni @84b gal te de rdzas su yod pa yin na dngos po yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir de 'dus byas nyid du 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma yin te skyon gong du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not unconditioned because the error was presented above.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod pa dang tha snyad gdags su rung ba nyid dang ma skyes pa dang rtag tu gnas pa nyid du brtag grang na /üîΩgrangs can dag gis rab brtags pa'i //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod pa dang tha snyad gdags su rung ba nyid dang ma skyes pa dang rtag tu gnas pa nyid du brtag grang na / grangs can dag gis rab brtags pa'i //
translated: If you imagine that nirvana exists as a substance, is suitable to be designated, is non-arisen, and endures permanently,üîΩthen what is the difference between it and

original: grol ba'i sems las khyad ci yod //
analyzed: grol ba'i sems las khyad ci yod //
translated: the liberated mind imagined by the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas?

original: ces bya ba ni grangs can dag kyang shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba ma skyes pa mi 'jigs pa bya ba dang / byed pa mthar thug pa ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes grol ba'i bdag nyid yod par 'dod pas gang dag gis gzung ba dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni grangs can dag kyang shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba ma skyes pa mi 'jigs pa bya ba dang / byed pa mthar thug pa ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes grol ba'i bdag nyid yod par 'dod pas gang dag gis gzung ba dang /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that consciousness exists, that which is unborn is fearless, and that the culmination of action is the nature of puru·π£a.üîΩSince they are free from the two conceptual thoughts of apprehended and apprehender, they definitely analyze all objects to be internal and not external.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir don thams cad nang du bsdu ba dang / phyi rol du spyod pa med par nges par brtags pa de dag kyang grangs can gyi grub pa'i mtha' dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir don thams cad nang du bsdu ba dang / phyi rol du spyod pa med par nges par brtags pa de dag kyang grangs can gyi grub pa'i mtha' dang mtshungs so //
translated: But they are similar to the tenets of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zad pa nyid yin par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zad pa nyid yin par yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical that nirvƒÅ·πáa is mere exhaustion.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩIt is as follows:

original: nyon mongs rnam rtog gtsub shing las //
analyzed: nyon mongs rnam rtog gtsub shing las //
translated: Arising from the kindling of afflictive conceptuality,

original: byung ba rang gi ngang zad pa //
analyzed: byung ba rang gi ngang zad pa //
translated: it arises and is exhausted in its own state.

original: de la bsags pa yod min pas //üîΩgang zag khyod thar mi zad 'gyur //
analyzed: de la bsags pa yod min pas // gang zag khyod thar mi zad 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: you, the person, do not exhaust liberation.

original: nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas kun nas bslang ba chu'i khams kyi rnyog pa dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi sprin la sogs pa lta bu'i sgrib pa khong khro ba la sogs pa dag gis sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed cing de dag kyang yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes pas rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsags pa med pas rang
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas kun nas bslang ba chu'i khams kyi rnyog pa dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi sprin la sogs pa lta bu'i sgrib pa khong khro ba la sogs pa dag gis sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed cing de dag kyang yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes pas rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsags pa med pas rang
translated: Afflictions are motivated by incorrect conception. They are like the turbidity of the water element and the obscurations of the space element, such as clouds. They afflict the mind. Since they are not accumulated because they are free of conceptuality when correct knowledge arises, they

original: gi rang nyid kyis zad par 'gyur bas de dag la dang po nyid nas kun tu sbyor ba med na zad pa ga la yod /
analyzed: gi rang nyid kyis zad par 'gyur bas de dag la dang po nyid nas kun tu sbyor ba med na zad pa ga la yod /
translated: are exhausted by themselves. If you do not initially engage in them, how can they be exhausted?

analyzed: zad pa med pa'i phyir gang thar par 'gyur /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsags pa med do //
translated: Since they do not exist, there is no accumulation.

original: bsags pa med na gang gis bcings shing gang las thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsags pa med na gang gis bcings shing gang las thar par 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no accumulation, then what is bound and what is liberated?üîΩTherefore,
