analyzed: de'i phyir / skye ba med @85a * //
translated: There is no liberation for one who is bound.üîΩSince there is no liberation for one who is bound, and since there is no liberation for one who is not bound, liberation is not tenable.üîΩSince there is no liberation,

original: la rtog pa yang //
analyzed: la rtog pa yang //
translated: How can there be a liberated person?üîΩSince there is no liberation, how can there be a liberated person?

original: de bzhin med phyir tshul gnyis mtshungs //üîΩzhes bya ba smras so //üîΩzad pa can nam zad med na //
analyzed: de bzhin med phyir tshul gnyis mtshungs // zhes bya ba smras so // zad pa can nam zad med na //
translated: Since there is no liberated person,üîΩHow can there be a teaching of liberation?üîΩIf there is no liberation, then how can there be a teaching of liberation?

original: gang gis zad pas thar pa smros //üîΩzhes bya ba ni re zhig rang gi ngang gis zad pa can mar me bzhin du zad pa la ni thar pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gis zad pas thar pa smros // zhes bya ba ni re zhig rang gi ngang gis zad pa can mar me bzhin du zad pa la ni thar pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Since there is no teaching of liberation,üîΩHow can there be a teaching of the path to liberation?üîΩIf there is no teaching of liberation, then how can there be a teaching of the path to liberation?

original: zad pa can ma yin pa la yang zad pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bu la thar pa med do //
analyzed: zad pa can ma yin pa la yang zad pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bu la thar pa med do //
translated: Since there is no teaching of the path to liberation,üîΩHow can there be a teacher of the path to liberation?

original: ci thar pa med pa kho na yin nam zhe na /üîΩkun rdzob tu yod de /
analyzed: ci thar pa med pa kho na yin nam zhe na / kun rdzob tu yod de /
translated: If there is no teaching of the path to liberation, then how can there be a teacher of the path to liberation?üîΩSince there is no teacher of the path to liberation,üîΩHow can there be a teaching of the path to liberation?üîΩIf there is no teacher of the path to liberation, then how can there be a teaching of the path to liberation?

original: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no // gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Since there is no teaching of the path to liberation,üîΩHow can there be a teacher of the path to liberation?üîΩIf there is no teaching of the path to liberation, then how can there be a teacher of the path to liberation?

original: rang bzhin stong nyid rtogs pa'i phyir //üîΩde yi blo yang ldog gyur pas //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong nyid rtogs pa'i phyir //üîΩde yi blo yang ldog gyur pas //
translated: Since there is no teacher of the path to liberation,üîΩHow can there be a teaching of the path to liberation?üîΩIf there is no teacher of the path to liberation, then how can there be a teaching of the path to liberation?

original: zad med mi zad chos nyid 'thob //
analyzed: zad med mi zad chos nyid 'thob //
translated: One attains the inexhaustible, non-exhaustible reality.

original: thob pa med pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: thob pa med pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In the manner of non-attainment.

original: zhes bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is said:üîΩWhen one realizes that the afflictions and mind are empty of inherent nature,

original: gang gi tshe des nyon mongs pa rnams dang sems rang bzhin stong pa nyid du legs par rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe des nyon mongs pa rnams dang sems rang bzhin stong pa nyid du legs par rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe na /
translated: at that time,

original: des chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir thar pa'i blo yang ldog pas /
analyzed: des chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir thar pa'i blo yang ldog pas /
translated: because one does not observe the essence of any phenomena, the mind of liberation also ceases.

original: nyon mongs pa bsags pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pas zad pa med pa'i chos nyid 'thob ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bsags pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pas zad pa med pa'i chos nyid 'thob ste /
translated: Because there is no accumulation of afflictions, one attains the non-exhaustible reality, which is inexhaustible.

original: thob pa med pa nyid thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa med pa nyid thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because non-attainment itself is attainment.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:üîΩI arose from the seat of enlightenment only because there was nothing to attain.

original: nga ni thob pa med pa kho nar byang chub kyi snying po las langs so zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: nga ni thob pa med pa kho nar byang chub kyi snying po las langs so zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu thob pa yang yod //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu thob pa yang yod //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, there is attainment,

original: mngon par rtogs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa yang yod de /
translated: and there is realization,

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis gnyis su brjod par zad kyi don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis gnyis su brjod par zad kyi don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is merely said to be two by worldly convention, but ultimately it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir lo bo cag ni pho rol po dag 'dod pa la mi brten pas /üîΩyang dag ji bzhin yongs rtog pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir lo bo cag ni pho rol po dag 'dod pa la mi brten pas / yang dag ji bzhin yongs rtog pa //
translated: Therefore, we do not rely on the words of others.

original: bdag la phan par 'dod pa dag / lta ngan nad dri ngan bsgos pa'i //
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'dod pa dag / lta ngan nad dri ngan bsgos pa'i //
translated: Those who desire their own welfare

original: sgregs pa'i tshig la rten mi byed //
analyzed: sgregs pa'i tshig la rten mi byed //
translated: should not rely on the words ofüîΩthose who are polluted by the stench of bad views.

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: We say:

original: khyed cag gi rang dags nye bar sbyar ba'i tshig gang dag yin pa de dag la ni mkhas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rtog pa bdag la phan par 'dod pa dag rten par mi byed do //
analyzed: khyed cag gi rang dags nye bar sbyar ba'i tshig gang dag yin pa de dag la ni mkhas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rtog pa bdag la phan par 'dod pa dag rten par mi byed do //
translated: Those who desire their own welfare should not rely on the words of the wise who investigate things as they are in reality, on the words that you have applied to yourself.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar khyod kyi tshig de dag ni lta ba ngan pa'i nad dring bas bsgos pa'i sgregs pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyi tshig de dag ni lta ba ngan pa'i nad dring bas bsgos pa'i sgregs pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because your words are the words of belching polluted by the stench of bad views.

original: lta ba ngan pa nyid nad yin pa de nyid dri ngan pa yin te /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa nyid nad yin pa de nyid dri ngan pa yin te /
translated: Bad views are the disease, and the stench is the stench of the flatulence of that disease.

original: des bsgos pa'i sgregs pa'i @85b tshig gang dag la khyad par ji skad bstan pa de lta bu dag yod pa de dag ni lta ba ngan pa de'i nad dring bas bsgos pa'i sgregs pa'i tshig dag yin te /
analyzed: des bsgos pa'i sgregs pa'i @85b tshig gang dag la khyad par ji skad bstan pa de lta bu dag yod pa de dag ni lta ba ngan pa de'i nad dring bas bsgos pa'i sgregs pa'i tshig dag yin te /
translated: Those who have the flatulence of the stench of that disease, which is the stench of the disease of bad views,

original: de la rten par mi byed do zhes bya bar spyar ro //
analyzed: de la rten par mi byed do zhes bya bar spyar ro //
translated: do not rely on them.

original: de dag la brten na ci nyes she na //üîΩlta ba log pa'i rnam par smin pa gang dag yin pa dga' thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag la brten na ci nyes she na // lta ba log pa'i rnam par smin pa gang dag yin pa dga' thob par 'gyur te /
translated: What is the problem with relying on them?

original: de ni sems can dmyal ba'am dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam gshin rje'i 'jig rten dag yin te /
analyzed: de ni sems can dmyal ba'am dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam gshin rje'i 'jig rten dag yin te /
translated: The ripening of bad views is rebirth in the hells, as an animal, or in the realm of Yama.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dad pa can ni nyes bzung bas //
analyzed: dad pa can ni nyes bzung bas //
translated: The faithful are burned by bad views.

original: khros pa gzhan ni zhe sdang gis //
analyzed: khros pa gzhan ni zhe sdang gis //
translated: The angry are burned by hatred.

original: dad pa can yang bsregs bstan na //üîΩzhe sdang can dag bsam ci dgos //
analyzed: dad pa can yang bsregs bstan na // zhe sdang can dag bsam ci dgos //
translated: If the faithful are burned,

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: what need is there to speak of the angry?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: 'dod chags ni yang dag par yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni yang dag par yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Attachment exists in reality.

original: phyin ci log yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because error exists.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa dag la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa dag la /
translated: Thus, in regard to impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, and the unattractive,

original: rtag pa dang bde ba dang / dngos po dang / bdag dang sdug par phyin ci log pa dag ni yod do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bde ba dang / dngos po dang / bdag dang sdug par phyin ci log pa dag ni yod do //
translated: the errors of permanence, pleasure, a thing, a self, and beauty exist.

original: de dag la brten nas /
analyzed: de dag la brten nas /
translated: And in dependence on them,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: attachment and so on arise.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba yin la /üîΩma rig pa'i rtsa ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba yin la / ma rig pa'i rtsa ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin /
translated: Ignorance is the root of the afflictions.üîΩThe root of ignorance is incorrect mental activity.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rtsa ba ni 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩbshad pa / phyin ci log dag yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rtsa ba ni 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na / bshad pa / phyin ci log dag yod pa'i phyir //
translated: The root of incorrect mental activity is the error of discrimination.

original: 'dod chags yod par mi rigs te //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod par mi rigs te //
translated: But attachment does not exist because error exists.

original: 'dod chags bzhin du brtags pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du brtags pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is like desire that is imagined.

original: rtogs pa de yang kun rdzob pa //
analyzed: rtogs pa de yang kun rdzob pa //
translated: And that understanding is also conventional.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log kyang 'dod chags bzhin du brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log kyang 'dod chags bzhin du brtag par bya ste /
translated: The error is like desire that is imagined.üîΩIs that error in error,

original: phyin ci log de phyin ci log tu gyur ba'am /üîΩphyin ci log tu gyur pa'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log de phyin ci log tu gyur ba'am / phyin ci log tu gyur pa'am /
translated: or is it not in error?

original: phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin pa'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin pa'am /
translated: Or is it in the process of becoming error?

original: phyin ci log las phyin ci log tu gyur pa tha dad dam /
analyzed: phyin ci log las phyin ci log tu gyur pa tha dad dam /
translated: Or is error different from that which is in error?

original: 'on te tha mi dad ce de ;
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad ce de ;
translated: Or is it not different?

original: phyin cing log rnam pa thams cad yang dag par na 'dod chags kho na bzhin du mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: phyin cing log rnam pa thams cad yang dag par na 'dod chags kho na bzhin du mi 'thad pas /
translated: In every way, error is like desire itself, and is not tenable in reality.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log tu rtog pa yang kun rdzob pa yin no //üîΩgzhan yang / sems dang sems las byung ba yi //üîΩngo bo nyid phyir sngar bkag phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log tu rtog pa yang kun rdzob pa yin no // gzhan yang / sems dang sems las byung ba yi // ngo bo nyid phyir sngar bkag phyir //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of error is also conventional.üîΩMoreover:üîΩBecause of the nature of mind and mental factors,

original: gang gis des ni chags 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: gang gis des ni chags 'gyur ba'i //
translated: and because they were refuted earlier,

original: @86a * // 'dod chags chags pa'i dngos nyid med //
analyzed: @86a * // 'dod chags chags pa'i dngos nyid med //
translated: By that, desire is not the reality of attachment.

original: ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe sngar rab tu byed pa 'di nyid kyi skabs su sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi ngo bo nyid spyir dgag pa byas pa de'i tshe 'dod chags zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid las yod pa de gang yin /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe sngar rab tu byed pa 'di nyid kyi skabs su sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi ngo bo nyid spyir dgag pa byas pa de'i tshe 'dod chags zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid las yod pa de gang yin /
translated: This is the refutation of the essential existence of desire and the desirous one. When, in the context of this very chapter, the nature of the mind and mental episodes was refuted in general, then what is this so-called desire that exists through its own nature?

original: gang 'dod chags des chags par 'gyur ba'i sems de yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gang 'dod chags des chags par 'gyur ba'i sems de yang gang zhig yin /
translated: And what is that mind that is desirous through that desire?üîΩThe same should be applied

original: des ni sdang dang rmongs la sogs //üîΩso sor bshad pa byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni sdang dang rmongs la sogs // so sor bshad pa byas par 'gyur //
translated: to hatred, ignorance, and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang chags pa bkag pa'i tshul des zhe sdang ba dang gti mug dang rmongs pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'dra bar bkag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang chags pa bkag pa'i tshul des zhe sdang ba dang gti mug dang rmongs pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'dra bar bkag par shes par bya'o //
translated: Through the method of the refutation of desire and the desirous one, one should understand that hatred, ignorance, delusion, and so forth are also refuted in the same way.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang tshe sems ni 'gag pa la //
analyzed: gang tshe sems ni 'gag pa la //
translated: When the mind is ceasing

original: mngon du phyogs shing skyes pa'i tshe //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs shing skyes pa'i tshe //
translated: And is about to arise,üîΩWith respect to what and through what

original: gang la gang gis sdang bar 'dod //
analyzed: gang la gang gis sdang bar 'dod //
translated: Would one be angry?

original: sdang ba 'gag la'ang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: sdang ba 'gag la'ang mi 'dod do //
translated: One cannot say that one is angry with that which is ceasing.

original: gal te skye bzhin sdang zhe na //
analyzed: gal te skye bzhin sdang zhe na //
translated: If one says that one is angry with that which is arising,

original: de ci gal te skye mngon phyogs //
analyzed: de ci gal te skye mngon phyogs //
translated: If you say that it is the arising of that which is not yet arisen,

original: ma skyes pa la de mi 'dod ;
analyzed: ma skyes pa la de mi 'dod ;
translated: Then it is not tenable that it is not yet arisen.

original: / gzhi med bya ba mi ldan phyir //
analyzed: / gzhi med bya ba mi ldan phyir //
translated: Because an action is not related to a non-existent basis.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, all of these should be applied in the same way.

original: de ltar bcings thar ma grub phyir //
analyzed: de ltar bcings thar ma grub phyir //
translated: Thus, because bondage and freedom are not established,

original: ngo bo nyid med g-yo ba med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med g-yo ba med //
translated: There is no intrinsic reality and no movement.

original: ces bya ba ni pha rol po dag gis sngar dngos po rnams ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni pha rol po dag gis sngar dngos po rnams ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here, the opponents previously said, ‚ÄúThings definitely have intrinsic reality ultimately,

original: bcings pa dang thar pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because bondage and freedom exist.‚Äù The meaning of their reason is not established, and it is contradictory.

original: bcings pa dang thar pa dag kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar pa dag kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because bondage and freedom are conventional.

original: grangs can dag na re /
analyzed: grangs can dag na re /
translated: The Enumerators say:

original: sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba'i sa la sogs pa ni rdzas yin te /
analyzed: sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba'i sa la sogs pa ni rdzas yin te /
translated: Earth and so on, which are devoid of the distinctions of solidity and so on, are substances.

original: de ni chu la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i dngos por snang ba'i blo'i rgyu yin pas rdzas las don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni chu la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i dngos por snang ba'i blo'i rgyu yin pas rdzas las don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Because it is the cause of the cognition that appears as a thing that excludes water, etc., it is not a different object from substance.

original: sra ba nyid la sogs pas mtshon pa'i sa la sogs pa de dag ni rdzas las don gzhan yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sra ba nyid la sogs pas mtshon pa'i sa la sogs pa de dag ni rdzas las don gzhan yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Earth, etc., which are indicated by solidity, etc., are different objects from substance.

original: gzegs zan pa dag na re /
analyzed: gzegs zan pa dag na re /
translated: The KaÃÑraÃÑka·πáikas say:

original: dngos po las ma gtogs pa'i yon tan gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po la yang gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha snyad gdags te /
analyzed: dngos po las ma gtogs pa'i yon tan gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po la yang gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha snyad gdags te /
translated: Because it is endowed with the otherness and non-otherness called ‚Äúotherness from substance‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-otherness from substance,‚Äù the convention ‚Äúotherness‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-otherness‚Äù is designated in substance.

original: de la sa la ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa nyid yod la /
analyzed: de la sa la ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa nyid yod la /
translated: In this regard, earth has non-otherness from its own nature.

original: chu la sogs pa @86b la ni sa'i gzhan nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa @86b la ni sa'i gzhan nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Water, etc., have otherness from earth.

original: de gnyi ga'i gzhan ma yin pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa //üîΩsa ni don dam nyid du na //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gzhan ma yin pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa // sa ni don dam nyid du na //
translated: In order to refute both of these, it is said:üîΩEarth is not accepted as

original: sa las gzhan min nyid mi 'dod //
analyzed: sa las gzhan min nyid mi 'dod //
translated: ultimately other than earth.

original: rgyu dang ldan phyir rlung bzhin dang // dngos po yin phyir shes pa bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan phyir rlung bzhin dang // dngos po yin phyir shes pa bzhin //
translated: Because it has causes, like the wind; because it is a thing, like consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni sra ba nyid ma gtogs par sa zhes bya ba ci yang med la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sra ba nyid ma gtogs par sa zhes bya ba ci yang med la /
translated: There is nothing called ‚Äúearth‚Äù apart from solidity.

original: sa ma gtogs par yang gang gis gzhan ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i gzhan nyid med do zhes bya bar tshad ma rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa ma gtogs par yang gang gis gzhan ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i gzhan nyid med do zhes bya bar tshad ma rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: And apart from earth, there is no otherness that would make it not-earth.

original: dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the way the argument is formulated, because all things are of one taste in emptiness.

original: shes pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩsa las don dam nyid du na //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // sa las don dam nyid du na //
translated: ‚ÄúLike consciousness‚Äù means like a person.üîΩWater is not to be regarded as different from earth,

original: chu ni gzhan par mi gzung ste //üîΩskye dang ldan pa'i rdzas las ni //
analyzed: chu ni gzhan par mi gzung ste // skye dang ldan pa'i rdzas las ni //
translated: ultimately.

original: sa gzhan min pa ji bzhin no //
analyzed: sa gzhan min pa ji bzhin no //
translated: Just as earth is not different from the substance that possesses origination.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni dper na rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid las sa'i tha snyad gzhan yin yang dngos po gzhan nyid du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni dper na rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid las sa'i tha snyad gzhan yin yang dngos po gzhan nyid du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du ;
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows: For example, although the convention ‚Äúearth‚Äù is different from the substance that is its essence, it is not regarded as a different thing.

original: chu yang gang gis gzhan nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chu yang gang gis gzhan nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat else would water become?‚Äù

original: ci ste 'di snyam du rdzas kyi bdag nyid dang sa'i bdag nyid gzhan ma yin pa nyid ni rung ste /
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du rdzas kyi bdag nyid dang sa'i bdag nyid gzhan ma yin pa nyid ni rung ste /
translated: But if you think that it is not the case that the nature of earth is different from the nature of water,

original: 'di ltar de la sgra dang blo yang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la sgra dang blo yang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sound and cognition are not different in earth,

original: sa dang chu la sogs pa ni gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: sa dang chu la sogs pa ni gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: then earth, water, and so on are different,

original: sgra dang blo tha dad pa yang yod la /
analyzed: sgra dang blo tha dad pa yang yod la /
translated: because sound and cognition are different,

original: las dang mtshan nyid kyang tha dad pas de'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag ni gzhan nyid yin no snyam na bshad pa /
analyzed: las dang mtshan nyid kyang tha dad pas de'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag ni gzhan nyid yin no snyam na bshad pa /
translated: and because their actions and characteristics are different. Therefore, earth and so on are different.üîΩEarth, water, and so on are not accepted as different

original: sa la sogs pas sgra blo dang // las dang mtshan nyid tha dad pas //üîΩde dag gzhan nyid mi 'dod de //üîΩbsgrub bya'i chos dang mi ldan phyir //
analyzed: sa la sogs pas sgra blo dang // las dang mtshan nyid tha dad pas // de dag gzhan nyid mi 'dod de // bsgrub bya'i chos dang mi ldan phyir //
translated: because of the difference of sound, cognition, action, and characteristics.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dir bsgrub par bya ba ni gzhan nyid de do nyid chos yin pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dir bsgrub par bya ba ni gzhan nyid de do nyid chos yin pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: Here, difference is the property to be proven, because it is the property of the thesis.

original: de dang mi ldan pa ni ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa ni ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not possess it does not possess it.

original: 'di ltar chu la sogs pa ni sa la sogs pa dag las logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes sdar bstan zin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar chu la sogs pa ni sa la sogs pa dag las logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes sdar bstan zin pas /
translated: Thus, water, etc. do not exist separately from earth, etc.

original: de'i phyir gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan no //
translated: Therefore, since otherness is not established, the example does not possess the probandum.

original: tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ni ma nges pa yang yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ni ma nges pa yang yin te /
translated: The reason, ‚Äúbecause they are different,‚Äù is also indefinite.üîΩHow so?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid min gzhan yang //
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid min gzhan yang //
translated: Because the expression ‚Äúform itself‚Äù exists,

original: tha snyad yod phyir ma nges 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ste gzugs kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba dang / mchi gu'i @87a * //
analyzed: tha snyad yod phyir ma nges 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste gzugs kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba dang / mchi gu'i @87a * //
translated: there is no certainty.

original: lus zhes bya ba dag gzhan nyid ma yin yang gzugs kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra tha dad pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba dag gzhan nyid ma yin yang gzugs kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra tha dad pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir //
translated: The expression ‚Äúform itself‚Äù and the expression ‚Äúthe body of the lump‚Äù are not different, but because the expression ‚Äúform itself‚Äù exists, there is no certainty.

original: des na re zhig ji ltar gzugs kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba la sgra tha dad pa'i tha snyad yod kyang gzugs dang / gzugs kyi bdag nyid gzhan nyid ma yin pa bzhin dus dang chu la sogs pa dag la yang sgra tha dad pa yod kyang dngos gzhan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: des na re zhig ji ltar gzugs kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba la sgra tha dad pa'i tha snyad yod kyang gzugs dang / gzugs kyi bdag nyid gzhan nyid ma yin pa bzhin dus dang chu la sogs pa dag la yang sgra tha dad pa yod kyang dngos gzhan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, first, just as the expression ‚Äúthe nature of form‚Äù has a different sound but form and the nature of form are not different, in the same way, time, water, and so on have different sounds but are not different things.

original: 'on te ji ltar lha sbyin gyi la bzhes bya ba la sgra tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar lha sbyin gyi la bzhes bya ba la sgra tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, just as the expression ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs cow‚Äù has a different sound,

original: dngos kyang gzhan nyid yin pa bzhin du sa dang chu la sogs pa dag la yang sgra tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir dngos kyang tha dad par 'gyur ba la the tshom yod cing ma nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyongs su brtags pa ma grub phyir //
analyzed: dngos kyang gzhan nyid yin pa bzhin du sa dang chu la sogs pa dag la yang sgra tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir dngos kyang tha dad par 'gyur ba la the tshom yod cing ma nges pa'i phyir ro // yongs su brtags pa ma grub phyir //
translated: and they are different things, in the same way, since time, water, and so on have different sounds, they are different things.üîΩSince this is not established,

original: de don ma grub nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: de don ma grub nyid du 'gyur //
translated: the meaning is not established.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra dang blo tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes yongs su brtags pa de'i don ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra dang blo tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes yongs su brtags pa de'i don ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
translated: This is because the meaning of that reason is not established, since the meaning of that which is imagined is not established, because of the difference between sound and cognition.

original: pha rol pos yongs su brtags pa'i don ni don dam pa pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol pos yongs su brtags pa'i don ni don dam pa pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning imagined by the opponent is not ultimate.

original: sgra sogs bye brag tha dad kyang //
analyzed: sgra sogs bye brag tha dad kyang //
translated: Sound, etc., are different in their particulars,

original: de phyir de dag 'khrul par 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir de dag 'khrul par 'gyur //
translated: therefore they are mistaken.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan nyid ston pa'i gtan tshigs dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan nyid ston pa'i gtan tshigs dag go //
translated: This is a reason that teaches another difference.

original: khyad par brjod par gyur kyang ni //
analyzed: khyad par brjod par gyur kyang ni //
translated: Even though a difference is expressed,

original: 'gal bas nges par bzlog par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gal bas nges par bzlog par 'gyur //
translated: it is definitely refuted because of contradiction.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid dgag pa sgrub pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid dgag pa sgrub pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is a statement that proves the negation of being different or not different.

original: gcer bu pa dag ni dngos po thams cad gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: gcer bu pa dag ni dngos po thams cad gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod de /
translated: The Nirgranthas believe that all things are both,

original: sa las chu la sogs pa dag gzhan nyid de mtshan nyid dang las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa las chu la sogs pa dag gzhan nyid de mtshan nyid dang las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because water, etc., are different from earth, because of the difference in characteristics and function.

original: gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te //
translated: They are not different,üîΩbecause of the non-difference of the atoms.

original: sra ba nyid la sogs pa yod pas 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sra ba nyid la sogs pa yod pas 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have solidity, etc.

original: zhe na / de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: zhe na / de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste //
translated: To them it should be said:

original: gnyig nyid kyang mi rung ste //
analyzed: gnyig nyid kyang mi rung ste //
translated: Neither is it tenable that they are both.

original: 'gal phyir me la grang dro bzhin //
analyzed: 'gal phyir me la grang dro bzhin //
translated: Because of contradiction, like heat and cold in fire.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te sa las chu la sogs pa dag gzhan yin na ni ji ltar gzhan ma yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te sa las chu la sogs pa dag gzhan yin na ni ji ltar gzhan ma yin par 'gyur //
translated: If earth, water, etc. are different from each other, how can they not be different?

original: ci ste gzhan ma yin na ni 'on de lta na gzhan zhes bya ba dang 'gal te /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan ma yin na ni 'on de lta na gzhan zhes bya ba dang 'gal te /
translated: But if they are not different, then it contradicts the statement that they are different.

original: dper na gal te me tsha ba yin na ni ji ltar grang ba yin /
analyzed: dper na gal te me tsha ba yin na ni ji ltar grang ba yin /
translated: For example, if fire is heat, how can it be cold?

original: ci ste grang ba yin na ni 'on de ltar na ji ltar tsha bar 'gyur zhes bya ba @87b bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ste grang ba yin na ni 'on de ltar na ji ltar tsha bar 'gyur zhes bya ba @87b bzhin no //
translated: But if it is cold, then how can it be heat?üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / gzhan dang gzhan min phyogs dgag pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzhan dang gzhan min phyogs dgag pa //
translated: The refutation of the positions of difference and non-difference

original: bstan phyir de yang bzang po min //
analyzed: bstan phyir de yang bzang po min //
translated: is also not good, because it is taught.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyogs dgag pa bstan zin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyogs dgag pa bstan zin pa'i phyir //
translated: Here, the refutation of the positions of difference and non-difference is taught.

original: de gnyis las ma gtogs pa gang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba gzhan yang yod de de'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis las ma gtogs pa gang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba gzhan yang yod de de'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Apart from those two, there is no other entity that is the nature of both, and therefore that nature of both is also not tenable.

original: ce ste gnyi gar smra ba dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: ce ste gnyi gar smra ba dag 'di skad ces /
translated: If the proponents of both say,

original: me yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: me yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFire is the nature of both,

original: btso ba la sogs pa dag la ni tsha ba yin la bden pa'i gsang sngags la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa dag la ni grang ba yin pas /
analyzed: btso ba la sogs pa dag la ni tsha ba yin la bden pa'i gsang sngags la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa dag la ni grang ba yin pas /
translated: because it is hot with respect to cooking and so on, and it is cold when consecrated by true words and so on,

original: de'i phyir me yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir me yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe med do zhe na /
translated: therefore, because fire is the nature of both, your example does not exist.‚Äù

original: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: To respond to them, it is said:

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid nyid yin yang //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid nyid yin yang //
translated: Even though it is the nature of both,

original: kun la grags pa'i cha dper bstan //
analyzed: kun la grags pa'i cha dper bstan //
translated: the part that is renowned to all is presented as the example.

original: des na gzhan la dpe med pa //
analyzed: des na gzhan la dpe med pa //
translated: Therefore, the example does not exist for others.

original: rab tu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not arise at all.

original: zhes bya ba ni me la gnyi ga'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig yod du zin kyang de la gang 'jig rten kun la grags pa'i cha de dpe nyid du bstan pas de'i phyir gnyi gar smra ba dag la kho bo cag gis dpe med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni me la gnyi ga'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig yod du zin kyang de la gang 'jig rten kun la grags pa'i cha de dpe nyid du bstan pas de'i phyir gnyi gar smra ba dag la kho bo cag gis dpe med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In response to this, Aryadeva says: Even if fire had the nature of both, the aspect of fire that is commonly recognized in the world is presented as the example. Therefore, we do not lack an example in our argument with the proponents of non-Buddhist schools.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de yang don dam pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de yang don dam pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, that nature of both is not ultimate.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni ltos nas 'grub pa ste //
analyzed: de ni ltos nas 'grub pa ste //
translated: It is established in dependence.

original: gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig / sngar ma grub na mi 'grub phyir //
analyzed: gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig / sngar ma grub na mi 'grub phyir //
translated: If either of the two is not established, the other is not established.

original: yid kyis rnam par brtags par zad //
analyzed: yid kyis rnam par brtags par zad //
translated: It is just a mental construct.

original: ces bya ba'i phyir te /üîΩ'di na kha ba la sogs pa grang ba dag la ltos nas me la sogs pa tsha ba nyid du 'grub la /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i phyir te / 'di na kha ba la sogs pa grang ba dag la ltos nas me la sogs pa tsha ba nyid du 'grub la /
translated: Why is that?üîΩHere, heat is established in relation to cold things such as snow and ice.

original: me la sogs pa tsha ba nyid la ltos nas kha ba la sogs pa dag grang ba nyid du brtag ste /
analyzed: me la sogs pa tsha ba nyid la ltos nas kha ba la sogs pa dag grang ba nyid du brtag ste /
translated: Cold is imagined in relation to heat.

original: de ltar rnam par dpyad na grang ba dang tsha ba de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig snga na ma grub pa'i tshe na phyi ma yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir gang la ltos na cig shos 'grub par bya ba gang yin pa ma grub pa'i tshe na
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dpyad na grang ba dang tsha ba de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig snga na ma grub pa'i tshe na phyi ma yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir gang la ltos na cig shos 'grub par bya ba gang yin pa ma grub pa'i tshe na
translated: When that which is to be established by relying on one of the two is not established,

original: / de la ltos nas 'grub par 'gyur pa gang yin pa yang mi 'grub pas /
analyzed: / de la ltos nas 'grub par 'gyur pa gang yin pa yang mi 'grub pas /
translated: that which is to be established in reliance on it is also not established.

original: de dag ni yid la bsams pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ces pa bde yang kun rdzob pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni yid la bsams pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ces pa bde yang kun rdzob pa yin no //
translated: Since they are mere mental fabrications, the so-called nature of both is also a conventional truth.

original: de dag ni ring po dang thung dur rtog pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ring po dang thung dur rtog pa bzhin te /
translated: They are like the conceptions of long and short.

original: dper na ring po yod na thung du yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na ring po yod na thung du yod par 'gyur la /
translated: For example, if long exists, short exists.

original: thung du yod @88a * //
analyzed: thung du yod @88a * //
translated: If short exists,

original: na ring po yod par 'gyur ba de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig med na mi 'grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: na ring po yod par 'gyur ba de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig med na mi 'grub pa bzhin no //
translated: long exists. If either of those two does not exist, it is not established.

original: bdag yod pa yang yin la bdag med pa yang yin pa dang / rtag pa yang yin la mi rtag pa yang yin pa dang / dngos po yang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa /üîΩgnyi gar smra ba thams cad la //
analyzed: bdag yod pa yang yin la bdag med pa yang yin pa dang / rtag pa yang yin la mi rtag pa yang yin pa dang / dngos po yang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa / gnyi gar smra ba thams cad la //
translated: The assertion that the self is both existent and nonexistent, both permanent and impermanent, both a thing and a nonthing, and so on,üîΩis the position of the non-Buddhist philosophers.üîΩThe method of refuting them

original: dgag pa'i tshul yang de nyid do //üîΩzhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgag pa'i tshul yang de nyid do // zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: is the same as that explained above.

original: 'di ltar 'di skad bsgrub bstan pas //üîΩngo bo nyid yod nyid ma grub //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di skad bsgrub bstan pas // ngo bo nyid yod nyid ma grub //
translated: Thus, as this has been taught,

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: the inherent existence of things is not established.üîΩThe phrase

original: dngos po thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: all things is supplied.

original: yongs su brtags pa'i tshig gi don gyi mjug bsdu ba byed pa ni //
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa'i tshig gi don gyi mjug bsdu ba byed pa ni //
translated: The summary of the meaning of the terms of the analysis is

original: de ltar 'dus byas chos de dag //üîΩbsdu bas rnam par brtags pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar 'dus byas chos de dag // bsdu bas rnam par brtags pa yin //
translated: Thus, those conditioned things

original: zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩ'dir smras pa /üîΩ'dus byas kyi dngos po ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no // 'dir smras pa / 'dus byas kyi dngos po ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: are analyzed by means of their inclusion.

original: de'i gnyen po 'dus ma byas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po 'dus ma byas yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, someone might say that conditioned things exist because their opposite, the unconditioned, exists.

original: de'i phyir 'dir 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po'i dbang du byas nas dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po'i dbang du byas nas dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, in this context, the example of an uncompounded thing is like the form emanated by a magician.

original: 'dus byas la ni gnyen po 'dus ma byas yod pas de'i phyir na 'dus byas ni yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas la ni gnyen po 'dus ma byas yod pas de'i phyir na 'dus byas ni yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that compounded things exist because uncompounded things exist as their antidote,

original: de'i phyir 'dir 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: then in this context, the example of a compounded thing is like the form emanated by a magician.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung gis bshad pa //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung gis bshad pa //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika scriptures explain:üîΩUncompounded states are the two cessations,

original: 'dus ma byas ni 'gog gnyis dang // nam mkha' dang ni de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni 'gog gnyis dang // nam mkha' dang ni de bzhin nyid //
translated: space and reality.üîΩUncompounded states are analytical cessation, nonanalytical cessation and space.

original: cis bya ba la 'dus ma byas ni so sor brtags te 'gog pa dang / so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa dang / nam mkha' dang de bzhin nyid do //üîΩde la so sor rtog pa ni shes rab ste /üîΩdes nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa rnams brtags te /üîΩ'gog pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags te /
analyzed: cis bya ba la 'dus ma byas ni so sor brtags te 'gog pa dang / so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa dang / nam mkha' dang de bzhin nyid do // de la so sor rtog pa ni shes rab ste / des nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa rnams brtags te / 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags te /
translated: Analytical cessation is the cessation of afflictions.

original: 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa ste /
translated: Analytical cessation is the cessation of afflictions that is achieved through the power of the wisdom that analyzes the four truths.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is called ‚ÄúnirvƒÅ·πáa.‚Äù

original: so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa ni 'ga' zhig gis dngos po rnams 'gog pa la mi 'bral ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa ni 'ga' zhig gis dngos po rnams 'gog pa la mi 'bral ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Nonanalytical cessation is the non-separation of things from a certain person.

original: nam mkha' ni go skabs 'byed par byed pa dang mi sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni go skabs 'byed par byed pa dang mi sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Space is the characteristic of non-obstruction, the providing of room.

original: de bzhin nyid ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dang / gcig la gcig med pa dang / gtan med @88b pa dag gis mtshon pa dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dang / gcig la gcig med pa dang / gtan med @88b pa dag gis mtshon pa dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: Reality is the non-entityness of things as imagined, as indicated by the non-existence of what is prior, the non-existence of what is subsequent, the non-existence of one another, and the absolute non-existence.

original: de dag ni rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni rtag pa yin te /
translated: These are permanent,

original: mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bzhi'o //
translated: because they are unchanging in nature.üîΩAmong them, first,

original: de la re zhig / so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni //üîΩdon dam du na dngos po yin //
analyzed: de la re zhig / so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni // don dam du na dngos po yin //
translated: analytical cessation is ultimate,

original: rtag dang rang bzhin mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: rtag dang rang bzhin mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: because it is permanent and does not change by nature,

original: mo gsham bu yi gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham bu yi gzugs bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po zhes bya ba de ni rtag pa dang rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid du mi 'thad de //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po zhes bya ba de ni rtag pa dang rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid du mi 'thad de //
translated: ‚ÄúThing‚Äù is not tenable as a thing because of arising and because of unchanging essential nature.

original: mo gsham bu'i lus bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham bu'i lus bzhin no //
translated: Like the body of a barren woman‚Äôs son.

original: de nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the distinctive reason for that, he says:

original: ma skyes phyir dang rgyu med phyir //
analyzed: ma skyes phyir dang rgyu med phyir //
translated: Because it is not arisen, because it is not a cause,

original: de bzhin las kyang med phyir dang // 'dus byas ma bsdus phyir dang ni //
analyzed: de bzhin las kyang med phyir dang // 'dus byas ma bsdus phyir dang ni //
translated: Because it is not an action, because it is not compounded,

original: 'gag pa med pa'i phyir yang ngo //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'i phyir yang ngo // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And because it does not cease.

original: so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni don dam par dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni don dam par dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Cessation is not a thing ultimately.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid ni skye ba dang rgyu dang / las dang / 'dus byas dang / 'gag pa dag gis mtshon par bya ba yin na de ni ma skyes pa dang / rgyu med pa dang / las med pa dang / 'dus byas ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid ni skye ba dang rgyu dang / las dang / 'dus byas dang / 'gag pa dag gis mtshon par bya ba yin na de ni ma skyes pa dang / rgyu med pa dang / las med pa dang / 'dus byas ma yin pa dang /
translated: The nature of a thing is characterized by arising, cause, action, being compounded, and cessation. But that is not arisen, not a cause, not an action, not compounded, and

original: 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos po nyid yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos po nyid yin par 'gyur /
translated: Because it is not stopped, how could it be a thing?

original: skye ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir 'gag pa yang med de /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir 'gag pa yang med de /
translated: Because arising and so on do not exist, stopping also does not exist.

original: 'di ltar skyes pa la 'gag pa 'thad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes pa la 'gag pa 'thad kyi /
translated: In this way, stopping is tenable for that which has arisen,

original: ma skyes pa la mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but it is not tenable for that which has not arisen.

original: gang gi 'bras bu gang 'dod pa //
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu gang 'dod pa //
translated: Whatever is asserted to be the effect of something

original: de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: is not its cause.

original: ma skyes la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: ma skyes la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: Because of the reason of nonarising and so on,

original: glang chen klad kyi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: glang chen klad kyi rva bzhin no //
translated: it is like the frontal lobe of an elephant.

original: zhes bya bas ni de rgyu ma yin par 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni de rgyu ma yin par 'gog par byed de /
translated: This verse refutes that unconditioned states are causes.

original: 'dus ma byas gang gi 'bras bu gang zhig yin par 'ga' zhig gis ji ltar brtags pa de la 'dus ma byas de ni 'bras bu de'i rgyu yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gang gi 'bras bu gang zhig yin par 'ga' zhig gis ji ltar brtags pa de la 'dus ma byas de ni 'bras bu de'i rgyu yin par mi rigs te /
translated: Whatever unconditioned state is imputed by someone to be the effect of something, that unconditioned state is not tenable as the cause of that effect.

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gong du bstan pa de dag gi phyir ;
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gong du bstan pa de dag gi phyir ;
translated: Because of the reasons of nonarising and so on that were explained above,

original: dper na glang po che'i klad la nyid med pa de de las gzhan pa'i seng ge'i khri la sogs pa dag gi rgyu mi 'gyur mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na glang po che'i klad la nyid med pa de de las gzhan pa'i seng ge'i khri la sogs pa dag gi rgyu mi 'gyur mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the absence of an elephant‚Äôs head is not the cause of a lion‚Äôs throne or anything else.

original: yang ni gzhan du brtags te /üîΩma skyes rgyu dang ldan pa yi //
analyzed: yang ni gzhan du brtags te / ma skyes rgyu dang ldan pa yi //
translated: Or else, it is imagined in another way:

original: 'bras bu mi 'dod shes par bya //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi 'dod shes par bya //
translated: The effect should be understood as not having a cause that has arisen,

original: 'bras bu yin phyir sbrang rtsi ni //üîΩmkha' min @89a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin phyir sbrang rtsi ni // mkha' min @89a * //
translated: because it is an effect.üîΩLike honey, etc.,üîΩspace, etc.,

original: sogs rgyu ldan min bzhin //
analyzed: sogs rgyu ldan min bzhin //
translated: do not have a cause.

original: zhes bya bas ni de rgyu ma skyes pa'i 'bras bu ma yin par 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni de rgyu ma skyes pa'i 'bras bu ma yin par 'gog par byed de /
translated: This verse refutes the effect as not having a cause that has arisen.

original: 'bras bu gang la rgyu ma skyes pa yod pa de ni ma skyes pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang la rgyu ma skyes pa yod pa de ni ma skyes pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
translated: That effect which has a cause that has arisen is called ‚Äúthe effect that has a cause that has arisen.‚Äù

original: so sor brtags te 'gog pa de rgyu ma skyes pa dang / ldan pa'i 'bras bu yin par pha rol po dag gis brtags pa de ltar mi 'dod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags te 'gog pa de rgyu ma skyes pa dang / ldan pa'i 'bras bu yin par pha rol po dag gis brtags pa de ltar mi 'dod par shes par bya'o //
translated: The opponent imagines that the effect of the cessation resulting from consideration has a cause that has arisen. But that should be understood as not accepted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni mi rigs te //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te //
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na sbrang rtsi ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dper na sbrang rtsi ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is an effect, like honey.

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'i rgyu ma skyes pa dang ldan pa'i rgyur mi 'dod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'i rgyu ma skyes pa dang ldan pa'i rgyur mi 'dod pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, one does not assert that the cause of a sky flower and so on is a cause that has arisen,

original: dper na sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: for example, because a bee's honey is an effect.

original: rgyu me tog ma la ti dang / padma dang / autpala la sogs pa skyes bu dag gis rgyu dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu me tog ma la ti dang / padma dang / autpala la sogs pa skyes bu dag gis rgyu dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Because it is an effect, it is a cause that has arisen, such as a malati flower, a lotus, an utpala flower and so on.

original: me tog de dag skyes pas sbrang rtsi de rgyu de dag dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu yin par 'dod kyi ;
analyzed: me tog de dag skyes pas sbrang rtsi de rgyu de dag dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu yin par 'dod kyi ;
translated: Because those flowers have arisen, that honey is an effect that possesses those causes.

original: / nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa dag ni ma skyes pa yin pas sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi de nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa de dag gi rgyu dang ldan par mi 'dod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: / nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa dag ni ma skyes pa yin pas sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi de nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa de dag gi rgyu dang ldan par mi 'dod pa bzhin du /
translated: But because sky flowers and so on have not arisen, one does not assert that that bee's honey possesses the causes of those sky flowers and so on.

original: so sor brtags te 'gog pa de yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyu ma skyes pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu yin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: so sor brtags te 'gog pa de yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyu ma skyes pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: Since the analytical cessation is a result, it is not asserted that a result can possess a cause that has not arisen.üîΩSpace and realityüîΩare like cessation.

original: des ni nam mkha' de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: des ni nam mkha' de bzhin nyid //
translated: The wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as direction, time,üîΩthe self, and so on.

original: phyogs dang dus dang bdag la sogs //
analyzed: phyogs dang dus dang bdag la sogs //
translated: This verse shows that space and reality are like cessation.üîΩThe wise should understand that all unconditioned things, as many as there are, are negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned things

original: 'dus ma byas pa ji snyed pa //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa ji snyed pa //
translated: are negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.

original: bkag par mkhas pas shes par bya //
analyzed: bkag par mkhas pas shes par bya //
translated: The wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned things

original: zhes bya ba ni dgag pa dang 'dra bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgag pa dang 'dra bar ston pa ste /
translated: are negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned things

original: so sor brtags te 'gog pa bkag pa dang 'dra bar 'dus ma byas ji snyed pa thams cad kyang rigs pa de nyid kyis bkag par blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis shes par bya'o zhes mdor bsdu'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags te 'gog pa bkag pa dang 'dra bar 'dus ma byas ji snyed pa thams cad kyang rigs pa de nyid kyis bkag par blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis shes par bya'o zhes mdor bsdu'o //
translated: are negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understand

original: gzhan yang / rdzas dang gtso bo srog la sogs //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rdzas dang gtso bo srog la sogs //
translated: that all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.

original: mu stegs btags pa'i shes bya dag / rigs dang lung la mkhas rnams kyis ;
analyzed: mu stegs btags pa'i shes bya dag / rigs dang lung la mkhas rnams kyis ;
translated: The wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned things

original: / ci rigs par ni dgag par bya //
analyzed: / ci rigs par ni dgag par bya //
translated: are negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.üîΩThe wise should understandüîΩthat all unconditioned thingsüîΩare negated in the same way as cessation is negated by the same reasoning.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can gzhan dag gis btags pa'i shes bya rdzas la sogs pa dang / gtso bo la sogs pa dang / srog la sogs pa ji snyed pa thams cad mkhas pa rigs pa dang // lung la mi 'jigs pa thob pa  @89b rnams kyis ci rigs par dgag par bya'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can gzhan dag gis btags pa'i shes bya rdzas la sogs pa dang / gtso bo la sogs pa dang / srog la sogs pa ji snyed pa thams cad mkhas pa rigs pa dang // lung la mi 'jigs pa thob pa  @89b rnams kyis ci rigs par dgag par bya'o /
translated: All objects of knowledge imputed by other tƒ´rthikas, such as substance, and so on, such as primal matter, and so on, such as life force, and so on, are all refuted by the wise who have attained fearlessness in reasoning and scripture.

original: de la rdzas la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i tshig gi don drug po dag ste /
analyzed: de la rdzas la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i tshig gi don drug po dag ste /
translated: Here substance and so on are the six categories of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang / 'du ba zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang / 'du ba zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: They are substance, quality, action, universality, particularity, and inherence.

original: de la rdzas ni dgu ste //
analyzed: de la rdzas ni dgu ste //
translated: Substance is of nine types.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / yid ces bya ba dag go //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / yid ces bya ba dag go //
translated: They are earth, water, fire, wind, space, time, direction, self, and mind.

original: yon tan ni nyi shu rtsa lnga ste /
analyzed: yon tan ni nyi shu rtsa lnga ste /
translated: Quality is of twenty-five types.

original: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa dang / grangs dang / bong tshod dang / so so ba dang / phrad pa dang / byed pa dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / blo lnga dang / bde ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa dang / grangs dang / bong tshod dang / so so ba dang / phrad pa dang / byed pa dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / blo lnga dang / bde ba dang /
translated: form, taste, smell, touch, number, dimension, separateness, conjunction, action, otherness, non-otherness, the five cognitions, pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / 'bad pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / shes pa dang / byas pa'i shugs zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / 'bad pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / shes pa dang / byas pa'i shugs zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: pain, desire, hatred, effort, dharma, nondharma, knowledge, and the force of what is done.

original: las ni lnga ste /
analyzed: las ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five actions:

original: 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: lifting, lowering, contracting, expanding, and moving.

original: spyi ni gnyis te /
analyzed: spyi ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two universals:

original: spyi chen po dang / nyi tshe ba'i spyi'o //
analyzed: spyi chen po dang / nyi tshe ba'i spyi'o //
translated: the universal of universals and the particular universal.

original: de la spyi chen po ni gang gi phyir rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dag la yod pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa ste /
analyzed: de la spyi chen po ni gang gi phyir rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dag la yod pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa ste /
translated: The universal of universals is that by virtue of which one designates the existence of substances, qualities, and actions.

original: de ni yod pa nyid de spyi chen po'o //
analyzed: de ni yod pa nyid de spyi chen po'o //
translated: That is existence itself, the universal of universals.

original: nyi tshe ba'i spyi ni ba lang nyid ces bya ba lta bu ste /üîΩde nyid rta la sogs pa dag las ldog pa nyi tshe ba'i spyi yin no //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i spyi ni ba lang nyid ces bya ba lta bu ste / de nyid rta la sogs pa dag las ldog pa nyi tshe ba'i spyi yin no //
translated: The universal of a limited extent is, for example, cowness.üîΩThat itself is the universal of a limited extent that is the opposite of horse, etc.

original: bye brag ni nyi tshe ba'i spyi de nyid de ba lang nyid ces bya ba de rta la sogs pa dag las ldog pa na bye brag yin no //
analyzed: bye brag ni nyi tshe ba'i spyi de nyid de ba lang nyid ces bya ba de rta la sogs pa dag las ldog pa na bye brag yin no //
translated: The particular is that very universal of a limited extent, cowness, when it is the opposite of horse, etc.

original: 'du ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phrad pa ste /
analyzed: 'du ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phrad pa ste /
translated: The conjunction is the contact of cause and effect.

original: de ltar de dag ni rdzas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni rdzas la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, these are substance, etc.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gis brtags pa'i de nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga ste /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gis brtags pa'i de nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga ste /
translated: The principal, etc., are the twenty-five principles imagined by the Samkhyas:

original: gtso bo dang / chen po dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / bdag dang / de tsam lnga dang / 'byung ba chen po lnga dang / skyes bu zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: gtso bo dang / chen po dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / bdag dang / de tsam lnga dang / 'byung ba chen po lnga dang / skyes bu zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: the principal, the great one, the I-maker, the five organs of knowledge, the five organs of action, the five subtle elements, the five gross elements, and the purusha.

original: de la gtso bo ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de la gtso bo ni rang bzhin te /
translated: Among them, the principal is the nature.

original: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa cha mnyam pa mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa cha mnyam pa mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The fourth is the unmanifest, which is the equilibrium of the three qualities of passion, darkness, and purity.

original: chen po ni blo'i rnam grangs so //üîΩngar 'dzin pa ni gang gis nga dang nga yi zhes mngon par rlom pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni blo'i rnam grangs so // ngar 'dzin pa ni gang gis nga dang nga yi zhes mngon par rlom pa'o //
translated: The great one is the enumeration of the intellect.

original: blo'i dbang @90a * //
analyzed: blo'i dbang @90a * //
translated: The sense of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is that by which one conceives ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: po lnga ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: po lnga ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The five sense faculties are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: las kyi dbang po lnga ni ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: las kyi dbang po lnga ni ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The five action faculties are speech, hands, feet, anus, and genitals.

original: yid ni blo dang las kyi dbang po zhes bya ba'i gnyi ga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yid ni blo dang las kyi dbang po zhes bya ba'i gnyi ga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The mind is both the sense faculty of the intellect and the action faculty.

original: de tsam lnga ni khyad par lnga zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de tsam lnga ni khyad par lnga zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The five subtle elements are also called the five special ones.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: They are form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: 'byung ba chen po lnga ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po lnga ni /
translated: The five great elements are

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' zhes bya ba dag go //

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o /

original: srin bu dang / dung dang / nya phyis dang / srin bu pad pa la sogs pa ni dbang po gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: srin bu dang / dung dang / nya phyis dang / srin bu pad pa la sogs pa ni dbang po gnyis pa ste /
translated: Worms, oysters, clams, and so on have two faculties,

original: reg pa dang / ro'i dbang po gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: reg pa dang / ro'i dbang po gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because they have the two faculties of touch and taste.

original: / grog ma dang / srin gyi me la sogs pa ni dbang po gsum pa ste /
analyzed: / grog ma dang / srin gyi me la sogs pa ni dbang po gsum pa ste /
translated: Ants, termites, and so on have three faculties,

original: reg pa dang / ro dang / sna'i dbang po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa dang / ro dang / sna'i dbang po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the three faculties of touch, taste, and smell.

original: bung ba dang / sbrang bu dang / sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa ni dbang po bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: bung ba dang / sbrang bu dang / sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa ni dbang po bzhi pa ste /
translated: Bees, flies, mosquitoes, and so on have four faculties,

original: reg pa dang / ro dang / sna dang / mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa dang / ro dang / sna dang / mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the four faculties of touch, taste, smell, and sight.

original: mi dang / rkang bzhi pa dang / bya la sogs pa ni dbang po lnga ste /
analyzed: mi dang / rkang bzhi pa dang / bya la sogs pa ni dbang po lnga ste /
translated: Humans, quadrupeds, birds, and so on have five faculties,

original: reg pa dang / ro dang / sna dang / mig dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: reg pa dang / ro dang / sna dang / mig dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they have the five faculties of touch, taste, smell, sight, and hearing.

original: de ltar de dag ni srog gi tshig gi don rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni srog gi tshig gi don rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Thus, these are the nine types of faculties that are the meaning of the term ‚Äúlife faculty.‚Äù

original: zag pa ni dge @90b ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams te zag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa ni dge @90b ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams te zag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Defilement is the wholesome and unwholesome actions, because they cause defilement.

original: sdom pa ni /
analyzed: sdom pa ni /
translated: Restraint is

original: zag pa 'gog pa nyid de las sar pa mi sog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa 'gog pa nyid de las sar pa mi sog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the cessation of defilement, because it does not accumulate new karma.

original: nges par dga' ba ni sdom pa de nyid dang zas mi za ba dang skom mi 'thung ba dang / bsam gtan dang sbyor ba la sogs pa dka' thub dang bcas pas sngon nye bar bsags pa'i las nges par rgas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nges par dga' ba ni sdom pa de nyid dang zas mi za ba dang skom mi 'thung ba dang / bsam gtan dang sbyor ba la sogs pa dka' thub dang bcas pas sngon nye bar bsags pa'i las nges par rgas par byed pa ste /
translated: Purification is the ripening of karma previously accumulated by that very restraint, by fasting, by not drinking alcohol, by the ascetic practices such as concentration, and so on.

original: zad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the exhaustion of karma.

original: 'ching ba ni nges par smra ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum po dag gis brtags pa'i log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba ni nges par smra ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum po dag gis brtags pa'i log par lta ba'o //
translated: Bondage is the wrong views imputed by the 363 determinative philosophical systems.

original: las ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: las ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Karma is of four types:

original: phyis myong bar 'gyur ba dang ; ming dang / rus dang / tshe zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: phyis myong bar 'gyur ba dang ; ming dang / rus dang / tshe zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: to be experienced in this life, to be experienced in the next life, to be experienced in subsequent lives, and to be experienced without certainty.

original: sdig pa ni chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa ni chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: Sin is non-Dharma.

original: bsod nams ni chos so //
analyzed: bsod nams ni chos so //
translated: Merit is Dharma.

original: thar pa ni las thams cad zas pas 'jig rten thams cad kyi steng na 'dug pa'i gnas 'jig rten 'dus pa zhes bya bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: thar pa ni las thams cad zas pas 'jig rten thams cad kyi steng na 'dug pa'i gnas 'jig rten 'dus pa zhes bya bar 'gro ba ste /
translated: Liberation is the state of being above all worlds because it consumes all karma. It is the state of being in the abode called the ‚Äúworld of the assembly of all worlds.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyal ba dam pas /
analyzed: rgyal ba dam pas /
translated: The Victorious One has said that liberationüîΩis like the color of snow, camphor, a jasmine flower,üîΩmilk, a pearl, or the color of the moon,

original: kha ba rgya spos me tog mdog / ba zho ba mo mu tig mdog / gdugs dkar bzung ba'i dbyibs 'dra ba //üîΩthar pa yin par rgyal bas bshad //üîΩces brjod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: kha ba rgya spos me tog mdog / ba zho ba mo mu tig mdog / gdugs dkar bzung ba'i dbyibs 'dra ba // thar pa yin par rgyal bas bshad // ces brjod pa lta bu ste /
translated: and is like the shape of a held white parasol.

original: de ltar de dag ni srog la sogs pa'o //üîΩde dag las gzhan pa gang dag mu stegs byed gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i shes bya 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni srog la sogs pa'o // de dag las gzhan pa gang dag mu stegs byed gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i shes bya 'dus byas sam /
translated: Thus, these are life and so on.

original: 'dus ma byas gang ci yang rung bdag kyang rigs pa dang lung las yongs su goms pa the tshom dang bral ba 'jigs pa med pa'i mkhas pa rnams kyis ci rigs bar dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gang ci yang rung bdag kyang rigs pa dang lung las yongs su goms pa the tshom dang bral ba 'jigs pa med pa'i mkhas pa rnams kyis ci rigs bar dgag par bya ste /
translated: Other than these, whatever else is imputed as an object of knowledge, whether compounded or uncompounded, by other tƒ´rthikas, all of that should be refuted by the wise, who are free from doubt and fearless through familiarity with reasoning and scripture.

original: de la 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas brtags pas mtshungs par dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas brtags pas mtshungs par dgag par bya'o //
translated: The compounded should be refuted by the examination of the compounded.

original: 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas brtags pas mtshungs pa dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas brtags pas mtshungs pa dgag par bya'o //
translated: The uncompounded should be refuted by the examination of the uncompounded.üîΩThus,

original: de ltar / rang dang gzhan gyis grub pa'i phyir //üîΩdngos po rnams la bdag brtags pa //
analyzed: de ltar / rang dang gzhan gyis grub pa'i phyir // dngos po rnams la bdag brtags pa //
translated: Since it is established by ourselves and others,

original: mkhas pas bdag med rtogs bya zhing //
analyzed: mkhas pas bdag med rtogs bya zhing //
translated: The wise should realize selflessness

original: de nyid shes pa'i bdud rtsi btung //üîΩzhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' dag tu dngos po rnams la bdag dang / ngo bo nyid yod par yongs su brtags pa dag rnal 'byor pa mkhas pas ji skad @91a * //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa'i bdud rtsi btung // zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' dag tu dngos po rnams la bdag dang / ngo bo nyid yod par yongs su brtags pa dag rnal 'byor pa mkhas pas ji skad @91a * //
translated: In things, and drink the nectar of reality-knowledge.

original: bstan pa'i tshul gyis bdag dang dngos po med pa nyid du rtogs par byas shing /
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshul gyis bdag dang dngos po med pa nyid du rtogs par byas shing /
translated: This is because in our own and other schools, the wise yogis should realize the non-existence of self and things in things, by the method taught above, through the thorough examination of the self and the existence of entities in things imputed by others.

original: don dam pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ngo bo nyid med pas shes pa med pa'i tshul du shes par bya ba de nyid shes pa'i bdud rtsi'i ro myang bar bya ba la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ngo bo nyid med pas shes pa med pa'i tshul du shes par bya ba de nyid shes pa'i bdud rtsi'i ro myang bar bya ba la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should strive to taste the flavor of the nectar of the knowledge of that very wisdom.

original: yang na rnam rtog dra ba yi //üîΩrgyun 'brel de dag la sogs pa //
analyzed: yang na rnam rtog dra ba yi // rgyun 'brel de dag la sogs pa //
translated: Or, the continuum of the net of conceptuality

original: dngos po skye bar 'dzin brten pas //
analyzed: dngos po skye bar 'dzin brten pas //
translated: Is the basis for the conception of the arising of things.

original: nan gyis byis pa 'khrul bar byed //üîΩgang tshe mkhas pa rig sgron gyis //
analyzed: nan gyis byis pa 'khrul bar byed // gang tshe mkhas pa rig sgron gyis //
translated: Thus, the childish are forced into error.üîΩWhen the wise fully understand

original: yang dag ji bzhin yongs rtog pa //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin yongs rtog pa //
translated: The way things really are with the lamp of knowledge,

original: de tshe skye bkag de zhi bas //
analyzed: de tshe skye bkag de zhi bas //
translated: Then the cessation of arising is pacified,

original: spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: And conceptual elaborations are completely stilled.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'bad par byed pa de ni gnas ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'bad par byed pa de ni gnas ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Or, the one who strives to demonstrate that things are essenceless is in error, because

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: why?
