original: rang dang gzhan dag gis yongs su btags pa rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba'i rgyun 'brel ba de dag la sogs pa ma lus pa ni dngos po rnams la skye ba yod par 'dzin pa la brten te /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan dag gis yongs su btags pa rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba'i rgyun 'brel ba de dag la sogs pa ma lus pa ni dngos po rnams la skye ba yod par 'dzin pa la brten te /
translated: All of these, which are imputed by ourselves and others, are related to the continuum of the net of conceptuality. They arise in dependence on the apprehension of the production of things.

original: byung ba yin pas de dag gis nan gyis byis pa ma rig pas blo gros kyi mi gzums  pa mi mkhas pa dag 'khrul par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung ba yin pas de dag gis nan gyis byis pa ma rig pas blo gros kyi mi gzums  pa mi mkhas pa dag 'khrul par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They force the childish, who are not skilled in the yoga of stainless wisdom, to be confused.üîΩTherefore, when the learned yogis, whose eyes of intelligence are well opened by the lamp of stainless wisdom,

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa mkhas pa rig pa dri ma med pa'i sgron mas blo gros kyi mig legs par bye ba dag phyogs su lhung ba'i blo na med pas dngos po rnams la skye ba med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta baüîΩbzhin yongs su rtog pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa mkhas pa rig pa dri ma med pa'i sgron mas blo gros kyi mig legs par bye ba dag phyogs su lhung ba'i blo na med pas dngos po rnams la skye ba med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su rtog pa de'i tshe /
translated: correctly and thoroughly investigate the nonproduction of things with a mind free of partiality,üîΩat that time they see that all things are like illusions, that they are not essentially produced.

original: dngos po thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med par mthong zhing skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med par mthong zhing skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because production is refuted,

original: skye bar rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma de zhi bas tshig gi brjod pa'i spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur bas cig car thabs de nyid la brtul bar bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: skye bar rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma de zhi bas tshig gi brjod pa'i spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur bas cig car thabs de nyid la brtul bar bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Since the stain of the conception of production is pacified, all elaborations of verbal expression are completely pacified. Therefore, it is reasonable to be diligent in that method alone.

original: dngos po de dag ma skyes par ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po de dag ma skyes par ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand that those things are unproduced?

original: 'di la kha cig ni dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar 'dod /üîΩkha cig ni gzhan las /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig ni dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar 'dod / kha cig ni gzhan las /
translated: In this regard, some assert that things are produced from themselves.üîΩSome assert that they are produced from others.

original: kha cig ni gnyi ga las /
analyzed: kha cig ni gnyi ga las /
translated: Some assert that they are produced from both.

original: kha cig ni rgyu med pa las /
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu med pa las /
translated: Some assert that they are produced without a cause.

original: kha cig ni dbang phyug dang / skyes bu dang / gtso bo dang / dus dang sred med kyi bu dag las skye bar 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni dbang phyug dang / skyes bu dang / gtso bo dang / dus dang sred med kyi bu dag las skye bar 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that they are produced from ƒ™≈õvara, Puru·π£a, PradhƒÅna, time, and NƒÅrƒÅya·πáa.

original: de la grangs can @91b dag ni bdag las skye bar smras pa /
analyzed: de la grangs can @91b dag ni bdag las skye bar smras pa /
translated: In this regard, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that things are produced from themselves.

original: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de la re zhig bdag skye ba //
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag skye ba //
translated: First, production from self

original: kun rdzob tu yang mi rigs te //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang mi rigs te //
translated: Is illogical even conventionally.

original: bdag nyid yod phyir dper bya na //
analyzed: bdag nyid yod phyir dper bya na //
translated: Because it would have a self,

original: zho ni bdag las mi skye bzhin //
analyzed: zho ni bdag las mi skye bzhin //
translated: Like curd is not produced from itself.

original: zhes bya ba bdag las zhes bya ba ni rang las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag las zhes bya ba ni rang las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom itself‚Äù means ‚Äúfrom itself.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar gyur na /
translated: If things were to arise from themselves,

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams med par yang skye ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams med par yang skye ba'i rigs na /
translated: it would follow that they would arise even without causes and conditions.

original: de lta bu ni 'jig rten na yang ma mthong na /
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'jig rten na yang ma mthong na /
translated: But since that is not seen in the world,

original: don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos //üîΩbdag nyid yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la bdag ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa ste //
analyzed: don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos // bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la bdag ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa ste //
translated: what need is there to mention the ultimate?üîΩ‚ÄúBecause of the existence of itself‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the existence of its own intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid yod pa'i don ni bdag go //
analyzed: bdag nyid yod pa'i don ni bdag go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúitself‚Äù is ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bdag nyid do //
translated: Its state is ‚Äúitself.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause of the existence of itself‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the existence of its own intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: gal te de skye ba na yod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te de skye ba na yod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it exists when it arises,

original: de la yang skye bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de la yang skye bas ci zhig bya /
translated: what use is there for it to arise again?

original: dper bya na 'jig rten na 'o ma las zho skye bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: dper bya na 'jig rten na 'o ma las zho skye bar 'dod kyi /
translated: For example, in the world, milk is held to be the cause of yogurt.

original: zho nyid zho'i rang gi bdag nyid las skye bar mi 'dod pa bzhin du dngos po bdag nyid yod pa yang bdag las mi skye ste /
analyzed: zho nyid zho'i rang gi bdag nyid las skye bar mi 'dod pa bzhin du dngos po bdag nyid yod pa yang bdag las mi skye ste /
translated: Just as you do not assert that curd is produced from the self-nature of curd, so too, an existent thing is not produced from itself,

original: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error of activity with respect to itself is contradictory.

original: yang na tshad ma'i lam gzhan yang yod de //
analyzed: yang na tshad ma'i lam gzhan yang yod de //
translated: Or, there is another path of reasoning:

original: dngos rnams bdag las ma skyes te //
analyzed: dngos rnams bdag las ma skyes te //
translated: Things are not produced from themselves,

original: dngos po yin phyir skyes bu bzhin //
analyzed: dngos po yin phyir skyes bu bzhin //
translated: because they are things, like, for example, a man.

original: zhes bya ba la skyes bu ni de dag gi gzhung las ma skyes par 'dod pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la skyes bu ni de dag gi gzhung las ma skyes par 'dod pas /
translated: In their system, a man is not produced.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa tsam zhig khas blangs nas dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dgag pa'i dper bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa tsam zhig khas blangs nas dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dgag pa'i dper bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú So too‚Äù means that having accepted mere non-production, one should take it as an example to refute the production of things.

original: ma skyes pa la bdag med de //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la bdag med de //
translated: That which is not produced does not exist by way of its own nature,

original: ma skyes phyir na mkha' min bzhin //
analyzed: ma skyes phyir na mkha' min bzhin //
translated: because it is not produced, like, for example, the son of a barren woman.

original: zhes bya ba la bdag ni ngo bo nyid yin na de ni skyes bu la sogs pa bdag las ma skyes pas bdag la med de ma skyes pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no /üîΩ// / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bdag ni ngo bo nyid yin na de ni skyes bu la sogs pa bdag las ma skyes pas bdag la med de ma skyes pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no / // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba //
translated: Here, if self were an essence, it would not exist in the person, since it does not arise from self. Because it does not arise, it is like a sky flower.

original: bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po bdun pa /
translated: The Blaze of Argument, a commentary on the Heart of the Middle Way,

original: 'dir grangs can dag / nam mkha'i me tog gi don rnam pa du mar rnam par brtags nas dpe med pa nyid du rgol bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag / nam mkha'i me tog gi don rnam pa du mar rnam par brtags nas dpe med pa nyid du rgol bar byed de /
translated: Here the Enumerators, having analyzed the meaning of sky flower in many ways, argue that it is not a nonexample.

original: ci nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba de'i don gal te nam mkha' la 'dug pa'i me @92a * //üîΩtog yin pas /
analyzed: ci nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba de'i don gal te nam mkha' la 'dug pa'i me @92a * // tog yin pas /
translated: They say, ‚ÄúThe meaning of sky flower is as follows. If it is a flower that exists in the sky,

original: nam mkha'i me tog ces bya na ni me tog ti la ka dang / autpala la sogs pa dag yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ces bya na ni me tog ti la ka dang / autpala la sogs pa dag yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that a tilaka flower, a blue lotus, and so on are sky flowers,

original: de dag kyang nam mkha' la 'dug pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang nam mkha' la 'dug pa yin te /
translated: because they exist in the sky.

original: nam mkha' ni go skabs 'byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: nam mkha' ni go skabs 'byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because space is the nature of providing an opportunity for the existence of all things.

original: /'on te nam mkha' las byung ba'i me tog yin pas nam mkha'i me tog ces bya na ni 'di la yang nam mkha' las zhes bya ba'i don rnam par brtags nas /
analyzed: /'on te nam mkha' las byung ba'i me tog yin pas nam mkha'i me tog ces bya na ni 'di la yang nam mkha' las zhes bya ba'i don rnam par brtags nas /
translated: If it is a sky flower because it is a flower that arises from the sky, then in this case, the meaning of ‚Äúfrom the sky‚Äù should be analyzed.

original: ci nam mkha' las gzhan pa'i me tog yin nam /
analyzed: ci nam mkha' las gzhan pa'i me tog yin nam /
translated: Is it a flower that is other than the sky?

original: 'on te nam mkha' las 'ongs pa'i me tog yin grol ;
analyzed: 'on te nam mkha' las 'ongs pa'i me tog yin grol ;
translated: Or is it a flower that has come from the sky?

original: gal te nam mkha' dang me tog la nam mkha'i me tog ces bya na ni de lta na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' dang me tog la nam mkha'i me tog ces bya na ni de lta na /
translated: If it is called a sky flower because it is a flower that is related to the sky, then in that case,

original: de gnyi ga yang yod pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba'i dpe de dngos po med par sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang yod pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba'i dpe de dngos po med par sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: since both of them exist, you cannot establish the example of a sky flower as nonexistent.

original: gal te khyed 'di skad ces nam mkha' dang 'brel ba'i me tog med pas /
analyzed: gal te khyed 'di skad ces nam mkha' dang 'brel ba'i me tog med pas /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúA flower that is related to the sky does not exist.

original: nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba ni nam mkha' la ni me tog yod pa ma yin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba ni nam mkha' la ni me tog yod pa ma yin pa la bya ste /
translated: Therefore, a sky flower is said to be a flower that does not exist in the sky.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog ces bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog ces bya'o zhe na /
translated: For that reason, it is called a sky flower,‚Äù

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: then in that case,

original: yang 'jig rten gsum po thams cad nam mkha'i me tog ma yin pa'i don dang mthun par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gsum po thams cad nam mkha'i me tog ma yin pa'i don dang mthun par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the entire triple world would not be similar in meaning to a sky flower.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nam mkha'i me tog kyang bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gis yod pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe med pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog kyang bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gis yod pa'i phyir khyed kyi dpe med pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because a sky flower exists in some way, your example is simply nonexistent.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i don //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i don //
translated: The meaning of the nonexistence of a sky flower

original: mkha' la sogs par khyod 'dod pa //
analyzed: mkha' la sogs par khyod 'dod pa //
translated: Is asserted by you as space and so on.

original: de dag nam mkha'i me tog min //
analyzed: de dag nam mkha'i me tog min //
translated: Those are not sky flowers.

original: de'i phyir kho bo'i phyogs med min //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo'i phyogs med min //
translated: Therefore our position is not nonexistent.

original: zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi dpe nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba de'i med pa'i don la nam mkha' la sogs pa zhes bya ba nam mkha' la dang / nam mkha' las dang / nam mkha' dang / me tog dang / nam mkha'i me tog ces rnam par dbye ba dag gis 'jig rten gsum po thams cad kyang yod par khyed 'dod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi dpe nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba de'i med pa'i don la nam mkha' la sogs pa zhes bya ba nam mkha' la dang / nam mkha' las dang / nam mkha' dang / me tog dang / nam mkha'i me tog ces rnam par dbye ba dag gis 'jig rten gsum po thams cad kyang yod par khyed 'dod pa de dag ni /
translated: The meaning of the nonexistence of our example, called a ‚Äúsky flower,‚Äù is asserted by you as space and so on, that is, as space, from space, space and so on, a flower, and a sky flower.

original: kho bo cag gi dpe nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi dpe nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba'i don ma yin te /
translated: Our example is not the so-called sky flower.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: kho bo cag ni dpe nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba de'i don ni khyod kyis mkha' la sogs par btags pa de @92b dag las gzhan yin la /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni dpe nam mkha'i me tog ces bya ba de'i don ni khyod kyis mkha' la sogs par btags pa de @92b dag las gzhan yin la /
translated: We say that the meaning of the example ‚Äúsky flower‚Äù is something other than what you impute to space and so on.

original: nam mkha'i me tog ces kho bo cag gi dper bzhag pa de bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gis yod par yang khyed kyis sgrub par mi nus pas //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ces kho bo cag gi dper bzhag pa de bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gis yod par yang khyed kyis sgrub par mi nus pas //
translated: We posit the example ‚Äúsky flower‚Äù as something that cannot be established as existent by anyone.

original: de'i phyir kho bo'i phyogs 'di la yang chos mthun pa'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo'i phyogs 'di la yang chos mthun pa'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in our position, the example of similarity does not fail to exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgang dag gi phyogs la 'bras bu'i rang gi bdag nyid kyi bdag las skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi phyogs la ni skyon de dag tu yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gang dag gi phyogs la 'bras bu'i rang gi bdag nyid kyi bdag las skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi phyogs la ni skyon de dag tu yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: Here, someone might say:üîΩThose who assert that effects arise from their own nature commit those errors.

original: kho bo ni rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid las skye bar 'dod pas kho bo'i phyogs la skyon de dag med de /
analyzed: kho bo ni rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid las skye bar 'dod pas kho bo'i phyogs la skyon de dag med de /
translated: But since I assert that things arise from the characteristics of their causes, those errors do not apply to my position.

original: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyid las skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyid las skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because all that is produced is produced from that which exists in the nature of a cause.

original: pha rol po de dag gis dogs pa bsu nas bstan bcos byed pas //
analyzed: pha rol po de dag gis dogs pa bsu nas bstan bcos byed pas //
translated: Since the author of the treatise anticipates this qualm, he says:

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras dag yod //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras dag yod //
translated: If cause and effect exist,

original: de las de ni skye snyam zhing //
analyzed: de las de ni skye snyam zhing //
translated: one thinks that arises from that.

original: bdag las skye ba nyid 'dod na //
analyzed: bdag las skye ba nyid 'dod na //
translated: If one asserts that it arises from itself,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says this.

original: de la skyon 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la skyon 'di yod de /
translated: Here is the error:

original: de las gzhan min bdag bzhin na //
analyzed: de las gzhan min bdag bzhin na //
translated: If it is not different from that, like the self,

original: rgyu ni rgyu min nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu ni rgyu min nyid du 'gyur //
translated: the cause would not be a cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid yin na 'di ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid yin na 'di ni rgyu'o //
translated: This is because

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad rnam par gzhag tu rung gi gzhan nyid ma yin pa la mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad rnam par gzhag tu rung gi gzhan nyid ma yin pa la mi rung ste /
translated: if cause and effect are different, it is possible to posit the convention ‚Äúthis is a cause‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is an effect,‚Äù but it is not possible if they are not different.

original: sa bon yang myu gu'i rgyu nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon yang myu gu'i rgyu nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The seed would not be the cause of the sprout.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from that, like the essence of the effect itself.

original: des na myu gu yang yang dag par na sa bon gyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: des na myu gu yang yang dag par na sa bon gyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a sprout is not the real effect of a seed,

original: de las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas /
analyzed: de las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas /
translated: because it is not different from that seed, like the intrinsic reality of the cause.

original: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the error of the absence of the reality of cause and effect would ensue.

original: gzhan yang ma skyes phyir ni rgyu min pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma skyes phyir ni rgyu min pa //
translated: Moreover, because it is not arisen, it is not a cause.

original: ci zhig yin zhing gang gi rgyu //
analyzed: ci zhig yin zhing gang gi rgyu //
translated: What is it? And the cause of what?

original: zhes bya ba ni gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa rang nyid ma skyas pa'i phyir snga phyi'i khyad par med par ni rgyu ma yin pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa rang nyid ma skyas pa'i phyir snga phyi'i khyad par med par ni rgyu ma yin pas /
translated: This is because the primal substance, puru·π£a, and so on, are not causes because they are not arisen, because they are not distinguished as prior and subsequent.

original: ci med  ma yin zhing gang gi rgyur yang mi 'gyur bas ji ltar gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: ci med  ma yin zhing gang gi rgyur yang mi 'gyur bas ji ltar gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Since they are not nonexistent, they are not the cause of anything. How could they be the cause of something else?

original: de bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa ma skyes pa dag gis ni myu gu la sogs pa mngon par sgrub par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa ma skyes pa dag gis ni myu gu la sogs pa mngon par sgrub par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, it is impossible for unarisen seeds and so on to establish sprouts and so on. This is the meaning.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du rgyu gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'bras bu ma yin @93a * //
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du rgyu gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'bras bu ma yin @93a * //
translated: But if you think that the cause itself is not the effect,

original: te ; 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: te ; 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i bdag nyid du yod pas /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i bdag nyid du yod pas /
translated: The effect exists in the nature of a potential within the cause.

original: de rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: de rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis gsal bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, causes and conditions manifest it.

original: nus pa dang / gsal ba de gnyis kyang bdag nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir de las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin par sems na de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: nus pa dang / gsal ba de gnyis kyang bdag nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir de las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin par sems na de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Since the potential and the manifest are not different in nature, arising from that is arising from itself.

original: 'bras bu bdag nyid nyid yod na //
analyzed: 'bras bu bdag nyid nyid yod na //
translated: If the effect existed in the cause,

original: rgyur brtag pa ni don med 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyur brtag pa ni don med 'gyur //
translated: Postulating a cause would be pointless.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu bskyed pa yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu bskyed pa yin par 'dod na /
translated: if you assert that a cause generates an effect,

original: gal te 'bras bu nyid yod pa nyid yin na rgyur brtag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu nyid yod pa nyid yin na rgyur brtag pas ci zhig bya /
translated: then if the effect itself existed, what would be the point of positing a cause?

original: skyon chen po gzhan 'di yang yod de /üîΩde nyid las ni de skye na //
analyzed: skyon chen po gzhan 'di yang yod de / de nyid las ni de skye na //
translated: There is another great error:üîΩIf it arises from itself,

original: skyed dang bskyed bya gcig tu 'gyur //
analyzed: skyed dang bskyed bya gcig tu 'gyur //
translated: The producer and the produced would be the same.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúcause and effect are two.‚Äù

original: gal te 'di snyam du bdag las skye ba kho na yang yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du bdag las skye ba kho na yang yin la /
translated: If you think that you can demonstrate that arising from self is indeed the case,

original: skyed pa dang bskyed par bya ba gnyis gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba kho bos ston par nus te /
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed par bya ba gnyis gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba kho bos ston par nus te /
translated: but that the producer and the produced are not identical,

original: dper na 'o ma zhes bya ba'i rdzas ji ltar gnas pa'i chos gzhan 'gag pa na zho zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan skye zhing de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa yang yod pa bzhin no snyam du sems na bshad pa /
analyzed: dper na 'o ma zhes bya ba'i rdzas ji ltar gnas pa'i chos gzhan 'gag pa na zho zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan skye zhing de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa yang yod pa bzhin no snyam du sems na bshad pa /
translated: then, just as the substance called ‚Äúmilk‚Äù ceases, and the other substance called ‚Äúcurds‚Äù arises, and the convention of cause and effect is posited in that context, in the same way, you can say that the self is the producer and the aggregates are the produced.

original: gal te 'o ma zho nyid du //
analyzed: gal te 'o ma zho nyid du //
translated: If you think that milk

original: gnas pas gnod pa med snyam na //üîΩpha ni bu nyid mi 'gyur bas //
analyzed: gnas pas gnod pa med snyam na // pha ni bu nyid mi 'gyur bas //
translated: is not harmed by its abiding in curd,üîΩthen the father is not not harmed

original: gnod pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: by becoming the son.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar phas pha'i dngos po nyid yongs su btang nas bu'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba ni sus kyang gang du ji ltar yang ma mthong bas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar phas pha'i dngos po nyid yongs su btang nas bu'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba ni sus kyang gang du ji ltar yang ma mthong bas /
translated: This is because no one has ever seen a father completely give up his own nature and become the son.

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis skyed pa dang bskyed par bya ba gnyis gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i skyon bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis skyed pa dang bskyed par bya ba gnyis gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i skyon bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult for you to avoid the error that the generator and the generated would be the same.

original: 'dir pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dag skye ba med pa'i gtan tshigs su bzhag pa dag ni skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba can dag sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dag skye ba med pa'i gtan tshigs su bzhag pa dag ni skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba can dag sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin gyi /
translated: Here, the opponents refute the Madhyamaka arguments, ‚Äúbecause of having an existent nature‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of being a thing,‚Äù which are posited as reasons for nonarising. They say that these are reasons that prove the opposite of the nonarising that is to be proven, that is, arising.

original: skye ba med pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo zhes phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: skye ba med pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo zhes phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: They say that these are not suitable as reasons that prove nonarising.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid yod pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po skyes pa dag la yod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid yod pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po skyes pa dag la yod kyi /
translated: In this way, ‚Äúexistence‚Äù and ‚Äúentity‚Äù exist for things such as pots that are produced.

original: ri bong gi rva la @93b sogs pa ma skyes pa dag la ni med pas de'i phyir bdag nyid yod pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid ces bya ba dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs de dag dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang la yang med la /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la @93b sogs pa ma skyes pa dag la ni med pas de'i phyir bdag nyid yod pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid ces bya ba dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs de dag dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang la yang med la /
translated: But they do not exist for nonproduced things such as the horns of a rabbit. Therefore, the reason ‚Äúexistence‚Äù and ‚Äúentity‚Äù are the nature of things does not exist for the discordant side, which is the nature of nonthings.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid kyis skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i chos can gyi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa skye ba yod pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid kyis skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i chos can gyi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa skye ba yod pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: And because it exists only for the discordant side, it is contradictory because it proves the opposite of the nature of the subject called ‚Äúnonproduction,‚Äù that is, the existence of production.

original: bshad pa / bdag nyid yod pa nyid dang dngos po nyid ces bya ba de dag ni kun rdzob pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / bdag nyid yod pa nyid dang dngos po nyid ces bya ba de dag ni kun rdzob pa yin te /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: ‚ÄúExistence‚Äù and ‚Äúentity‚Äù are conventional.

original: de dag la brten nas byung ba ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dag la brten nas byung ba ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
translated: That which arises in dependence on those is the ultimate lack of entityness,

original: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not arise in any way from self, other, both, or causelessly.

original: skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba med pas //üîΩmi mthun phyogs ni med pa'i phyir //üîΩgtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid mi 'dod ;
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skye ba med pas // mi mthun phyogs ni med pa'i phyir // gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid mi 'dod ;
translated: Since nonarising is the opposite of arising,üîΩthe ultimate is said to be nonarising.üîΩThe ultimate is not asserted to be a reason that is contradictory

original: / ces bya ba smras so //üîΩde ltar re zhig dngos po rnams //
analyzed: / ces bya ba smras so // de ltar re zhig dngos po rnams //
translated: because its opposite does not exist.

original: bdag las skye bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: bdag las skye bar mi rigs so //
translated: Thus things do not arise from themselves.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the words ‚ÄúThus things do not arise from themselves‚Äù is that they do not arise from themselves in the manner that has been explained.

original: mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis sa bon dang sa dang / chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa dag las myu gu la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams skye ba dang / ma rig pa dang /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis sa bon dang sa dang / chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa dag las myu gu la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams skye ba dang / ma rig pa dang /
translated: SautrƒÅntikas and VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that external things such as sprouts arise from seeds, earth, water, fire, wind, and so on that are transformed.

original: sred pa dang / las zhes bya ba gzhan du gyur pa dag las nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po skye bar 'dod de /
analyzed: sred pa dang / las zhes bya ba gzhan du gyur pa dag las nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po skye bar 'dod de /
translated: They assert that the entities of the internal sense bases arise from other, namely, craving and karma.

original: de bzhin du bye brag pa dag kyang sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab dag dang rdul phra rab gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la sogs pa'i rim pa gzhan du gyur pa dag las sa la sogs pa'i rdzas mngon par 'grub par 'dod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bye brag pa dag kyang sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab dag dang rdul phra rab gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la sogs pa'i rim pa gzhan du gyur pa dag las sa la sogs pa'i rdzas mngon par 'grub par 'dod do //
translated: Similarly, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas assert that the substances earth and so on are established from other, namely, the subtle particles of earth and so on, and from the other stages of the dyads and triads.

original: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste //
translated: To them it should be said:

original: ngo bo nyid ni med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni med pa'i phyir //
translated: Since they have no intrinsic reality,

original: gang zhig gang las gzhan du 'dod //üîΩgang du dang ni ri rtse las //üîΩrta ru gzhan du mi 'dod bzhin //
analyzed: gang zhig gang las gzhan du 'dod // gang du dang ni ri rtse las // rta ru gzhan du mi 'dod bzhin //
translated: How can they be asserted to be other?üîΩJust as a horse is not asserted to be other

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Than a cow, a camel, or the peak of a mountain.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi dngos po ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúintrinsic reality‚Äù means one‚Äôs own entity.

original: de yang ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis na dngos po rnams la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis na dngos po rnams la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That does not exist in things in the way that has been explained.

original: de med pa'i phyir rgyu'i bdag @94a * //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir rgyu'i bdag @94a * //
translated: Since that does not exist, the self of the cause

original: nyid kyi dngos po gang zhig 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po gang las gzhan du 'dod de /
analyzed: nyid kyi dngos po gang zhig 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po gang las gzhan du 'dod de /
translated: What thing of yours is different from the thing that is the nature of the effect?

original: dper na glang ru dang ri rtse ma skyes pa dag las rta'i rva gzhan du tha snyad gdags par mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na glang ru dang ri rtse ma skyes pa dag las rta'i rva gzhan du tha snyad gdags par mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just as you do not assert that the horn of a rabbit or the peak of Mt.üîΩMeru is different from the horn of a cow.üîΩMoreover,

original: yang na / mig la sogs pa rkyen gzhan rnams //üîΩdon dam du ni mig sogs kyi //
analyzed: yang na / mig la sogs pa rkyen gzhan rnams // don dam du ni mig sogs kyi //
translated: The conditions such as the eyeüîΩare not ultimately producers

original: rnam shes skyed par byed ma yin //
analyzed: rnam shes skyed par byed ma yin //
translated: of the eye consciousness, etc.,

original: gzhan phyir rtsi skyang la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan phyir rtsi skyang la sogs bzhin //
translated: because they are different, like sprouts, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan yin no cog la skyed pa'i mthu yod pa yin na gzhan yin pa 'dra ba bzhin pa las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan yin no cog la skyed pa'i mthu yod pa yin na gzhan yin pa 'dra ba bzhin pa las /
translated: If anything that is different has the power to produce something else, then just like things that are similar,

original: mig la sogs pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag nyi tshe skyed par byed la //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag nyi tshe skyed par byed la //
translated: the eye, etc., would produce the eye consciousness, etc.

original: sab ma dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa dang / rtsi skyang dang rgyu spun dang 'jim pa la sogs pas ni sab ma dang snam bu dang / bum pa la sogs pa nyi tshe dag mngon par sgrub par byed kyi /
analyzed: sab ma dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa dang / rtsi skyang dang rgyu spun dang 'jim pa la sogs pas ni sab ma dang snam bu dang / bum pa la sogs pa nyi tshe dag mngon par sgrub par byed kyi /
translated: It does not produce such things as a mat, a cloth, a pot, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag / skyed par mi byed par rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa de dag ci las gyur pa'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag / skyed par mi byed par rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa de dag ci las gyur pa'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: It is necessary to state the specific reason why the individual causes and conditions are definite in producing eye consciousness, etc., and not in producing a mat, etc.

original: sbyor ba gzhan yang /üîΩgzugs kyi blo la sogs pa dag //
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan yang / gzugs kyi blo la sogs pa dag //
translated: Another syllogism:üîΩThe eye consciousness, etc.,

original: brjod 'dod mig sogs rgyu can min ;
analyzed: brjod 'dod mig sogs rgyu can min ;
translated: are not caused by the desire to see, etc.,

original: / gzhan phyir snga na med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: / gzhan phyir snga na med pa'i phyir //
translated: because they are different and because they exist even when there is no prior desire.

original: dper na bum snam la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: dper na bum snam la sogs bzhin //
translated: They are like a pot, a cloth, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo la sogs pa dag ces bya ba rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag ni brjod par 'dod pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo la sogs pa dag ces bya ba rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag ni brjod par 'dod pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: The six collections of consciousness, such as eye consciousness, are not caused by the eye, etc., which are asserted to be their causes.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dang ; snga na med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dang ; snga na med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They are different from them and do not exist prior to them, like a pot, cloth, etc.

original: brjod 'dod ces bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa ste /üîΩmig la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: brjod 'dod ces bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa ste / mig la sogs pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúAssented to‚Äù means ‚Äúasserted.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúEye, etc.‚Äù refers to the eye, form, light, space, and attention.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa dag dang / rna ba la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa dag dang / rna ba la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o /
translated: ‚ÄúEye, etc.‚Äù also includes the other faculties such as the ear.

original: rgyu can min zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo la sogs pa gang dag la rgyu brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa dag yod par btags pa de dag de'i rgyu can ma yin par bkag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu can min zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo la sogs pa gang dag la rgyu brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa dag yod par btags pa de dag de'i rgyu can ma yin par bkag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot caused‚Äù means that the eye consciousness, etc., which are imputed to exist as caused by the eye, etc., which are asserted to be their causes, are refuted as not caused by them.

original: @94b gzhan yang dngos po skyes pa nyid yin na gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gdags su rung na 'bras bu de ni ma skyes pas 'bras bu de las rgyu gzhan nyid du rtog pa ni nye bar btags pa yin pas /
analyzed: @94b gzhan yang dngos po skyes pa nyid yin na gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gdags su rung na 'bras bu de ni ma skyes pas 'bras bu de las rgyu gzhan nyid du rtog pa ni nye bar btags pa yin pas /
translated: Moreover, if the effect were to arise, it would be suitable to designate it as ‚Äúother.‚Äù But since the effect has not arisen, the conception of the cause as ‚Äúother‚Äù than the effect is a mere imputation.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / ma skyes pa yi gzhan nyid ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma skyes pa yi gzhan nyid ni //
translated: Otherness of what has not arisen

original: kun rdzob yin pas don dam min ;
analyzed: kun rdzob yin pas don dam min ;
translated: is conventional, not ultimate.

original: / gzhan yang skye ba nyid kyang ni //
analyzed: / gzhan yang skye ba nyid kyang ni //
translated: Moreover, arising itself

original: rigs pa ma yin gzung bar bya //üîΩzhes bya ba smras so //üîΩgzhan yang skye bar smra ba dag las //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin gzung bar bya // zhes bya ba smras so // gzhan yang skye bar smra ba dag las //
translated: should not be grasped as tenable.

original: kha cig ni rgyu las 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu las 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: Moreover, some who advocate arising think that the effect exists in the cause,

original: de skyes pa nyid dam ma skyes pa nyid du ni tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin par sems so //
analyzed: de skyes pa nyid dam ma skyes pa nyid du ni tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin par sems so //
translated: but it is not to be designated as arisen or not arisen.

original: kha cig ni ma skyes pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mngon par sgrub par 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni ma skyes pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mngon par sgrub par 'dod do //
translated: Some think that what has not arisen is established by causes and conditions.

original: kha cig ni skyes bzhin pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can du 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni skyes bzhin pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can du 'dod do //
translated: Some think that what is in the process of arising has the nature of both.

original: kha cig ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: Some believe that it is not to be described.

original: 'di ltar de ni skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, it is not arisen,

original: bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has not acquired its own nature.

original: ma skyes pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it non-arisen,

original: bya ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bya ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because the activity of arising is engaged.

original: de la bshad pa re zhig / skyes pa brjod du med pa la //
analyzed: de la bshad pa re zhig / skyes pa brjod du med pa la //
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: skye ba don med nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba don med nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Arising is meaningless for what is arisen and not to be described.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: gal te rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin zhing tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin zhing tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: if the effect exists in the cause and is not to be described,

original: de ni skyes pa yin pas skyes ba de la yang skye ba don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur la //
analyzed: de ni skyes pa yin pas skyes ba de la yang skye ba don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur la //
translated: then it is arisen. But the arising of what is arisen is meaningless.

original: ma skyes pa na tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ni skyes na yang de 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du tha snyad gdags su mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa na tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ni skyes na yang de 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du tha snyad gdags su mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it is not to be described when it is non-arisen, then it is not suitable to describe it as the nature of an effect when it is arisen.

original: gang dag 'bras bu ma skyes pa de dag la yang //
analyzed: gang dag 'bras bu ma skyes pa de dag la yang //
translated: And for those effects that are not arisen,

original: ma skyes pa la skye med de //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la skye med de //
translated: Arising does not exist for what is non-arisen.

original: ma skyes phyir ni mkha' min bzhin //
analyzed: ma skyes phyir ni mkha' min bzhin //
translated: Because it is not produced, like space.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what he says.

original: skye bzhin skye bar 'dod pa la //
analyzed: skye bzhin skye bar 'dod pa la //
translated: If you maintain that that which is in the process of arising arises,

original: brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni skye bzhin pa la yang gang skyes pa'i cha de la ni yang skye ba don med la /
analyzed: brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni skye bzhin pa la yang gang skyes pa'i cha de la ni yang skye ba don med la /
translated: The same objection will apply.üîΩIf you maintain that that which is in the process of arising arises, the same objection will apply.

original: gang ma skyes pa'i cha de ni med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa'i cha de ni med pa'i phyir /
translated: That part of it which has arisen has no need to arise again.üîΩThat part of it which has not yet arisen does not exist, like the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba med do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not arise, like a sky-flower, etc.

original: brjod du med pa'ang de med de //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'ang de med de //
translated: That which is inexpressible does not exist,

original: brjod du med phyir gzhan bzhin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la 'dir gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sngo bsangs dang @95a * //
analyzed: brjod du med phyir gzhan bzhin no // zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sngo bsangs dang @95a * //
translated: Because it is inexpressible, like another.

original: dkar sham la sogs pa nyid du brjod du med pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: dkar sham la sogs pa nyid du brjod du med pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúanother‚Äù includes the son of a barren woman, etc., which are inexpressible as blue, yellow, etc.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdngos po rnams ni skye ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dngos po rnams ni skye ba kho na yin te /
translated: Here, someone says:üîΩThings are only produced,

original: brtags pa'i bdag nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i bdag nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are perceived as having the nature of a conceptual construction.

original: de'i phyir de dag la rnam par shes pas rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la rnam par shes pas rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they have a nature that is imagined by consciousness.

original: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: yang na mig la sogs pa dag / brtags pa'i bdag nyid nyid kyis stong //
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa dag / brtags pa'i bdag nyid nyid kyis stong //
translated: Or else, the eyes and so on are empty of the very nature that is imagined.

original: byas pa'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are created and because they disintegrate,

original: dper na sgyu ma'i 'o ma bzhin //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i 'o ma bzhin //
translated: they are like, for example, illusory milk.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dag ni don dam par na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la sngon po dang ser por brtags pa'i dngos por 'dod pa gang dang gang yin pa de dang de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dag ni don dam par na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la sngon po dang ser por brtags pa'i dngos por 'dod pa gang dang gang yin pa de dang de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: The eyes and so on are empty of the very nature that is imagined as the entities of blue, yellow, and so on in regard to the entities of form and so on that are asserted to be ultimate.

original: byas ba'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na tshig dag gis dper na sgyu ma'i bdag nyid kyi 'o ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byas ba'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir dper na tshig dag gis dper na sgyu ma'i bdag nyid kyi 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: Because they are created and because they disintegrate, they are like, for example, the nature of illusory milk.

original: gal te 'di snyam du ma brtags pa'i dngos po rnams kyi bdag nyid kyang yod de /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du ma brtags pa'i dngos po rnams kyi bdag nyid kyang yod de /
translated: If you think that the nature of things that are not imagined also exists,

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni bsags pa'i gnas la dmigs pa yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni bsags pa'i gnas la dmigs pa yin pas /
translated: The fivefold collection of consciousnesses focuses on the basis of accumulation.

original: gal te de dag gcig tu rnam par rtog par mi byed kyang de dag gi dmigs pa'i dngos po yod pas /
analyzed: gal te de dag gcig tu rnam par rtog par mi byed kyang de dag gi dmigs pa'i dngos po yod pas /
translated: If they do not conceptualize in one way, then the thing that is their object exists.

original: des na byas pa'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i 'o ma bzhin du rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po rnams stong par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: des na byas pa'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i 'o ma bzhin du rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po rnams stong par 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, because they are created and because they disintegrate, like illusory milk, imputed things are empty.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa'i dngos po rnams yod par 'gyur ba ma nges par sems na ;
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa'i dngos po rnams yod par 'gyur ba ma nges par sems na ;
translated: If you think that it is uncertain that things that are not imputed exist,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: then in response to that, it is said:

original: bsgrub dang mtshungs par bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsgrub dang mtshungs par bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of refuting them in the same way that they are established,

original: cig shos kyis ni the tshom med //
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni the tshom med //
translated: the other is without doubt.

original: ces bya ba la cig shos ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan pa ma brtags pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la cig shos ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan pa ma brtags pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: The other is things that are not imputed, which are different from things that are imputed.

original: des na ma nges pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ma nges pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not uncertain.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brtags pa'i bdag nyid dgag par sgrub pa dang / mtshungs par ma brtags pa'i dngos po yang bkag pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni ma brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis kyang stong ste /
analyzed: brtags pa'i bdag nyid dgag par sgrub pa dang / mtshungs par ma brtags pa'i dngos po yang bkag pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni ma brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis kyang stong ste /
translated: Since the refutation of the imagined nature is established, and since even things that are not imagined are refuted, the eyes, etc. are empty of the nature of things that are not imagined.

original: byas pa'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir sgyu ma kho na bzhin te /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir dang 'jig pa'i phyir sgyu ma kho na bzhin te /
translated: Because they are produced and because they perish, they are like illusions.

original: @95b gang gi phyir sgyu ma la yang brtags pa ma yin pa'i cha yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @95b gang gi phyir sgyu ma la yang brtags pa ma yin pa'i cha yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even in an illusion, there is a part that is not imagined.

original: 'o na de ltar sgyu ma'i cha rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa cig shos gang yin pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar sgyu ma'i cha rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa cig shos gang yin pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the part of an illusion that is not imagined is not empty, then the other part that is imagined is not empty.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To refute that, it is said:

original: sgyu ma'i bdag nyid ma brtags pa'ang //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i bdag nyid ma brtags pa'ang //
translated: The nature of an illusion is not imagined,

original: yang dag tu ni log par 'dod //
analyzed: yang dag tu ni log par 'dod //
translated: but is considered to be false in reality.

original: la la'i 'dod chags rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: la la'i 'dod chags rgyu yin phyir //
translated: Because it is the cause of attachment for some,

original: dper na brtags pa de nyid bzhin //
analyzed: dper na brtags pa de nyid bzhin //
translated: it is like that very thing that is imagined.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang mi mkhas pa la la'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang mi mkhas pa la la'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The form, etc., conjured up by a magician is a cause of the passion, etc., of some unskillful people.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i brtags pa'i bdag nyid log pa yin pa de bzhin du brtags pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang yang dag par na log pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i brtags pa'i bdag nyid log pa yin pa de bzhin du brtags pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang yang dag par na log pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as the imagined nature is false, so the non-imagined nature is also false in reality, because it is not imagined.

original: gal te de ltar na sgyu ma la brtags pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyang med pas khyod kyi dpe med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na sgyu ma la brtags pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyang med pas khyod kyi dpe med do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, since the non-imagined nature does not exist in a magical creation, your example does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa ;
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa ;
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: grags pa'i chas ni de grub phyir //
analyzed: grags pa'i chas ni de grub phyir //
translated: Since it is established by the part that is accepted,

original: kho bo'i dpe ni med ma yin //
analyzed: kho bo'i dpe ni med ma yin //
translated: my example is not non-existent.

original: zhes bya ba ni de la yang gang pha rol la yod pa nyid du grags pa'i cha de dpe nyid du byas pas de grub pa'i phyir kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de la yang gang pha rol la yod pa nyid du grags pa'i cha de dpe nyid du byas pas de grub pa'i phyir kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
translated: There, since the part that is accepted as existing in the other is made into the example itself, it is established. Therefore my example is not non-existent.

original: yang na brtags pa dang brtags pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid dpyad pa des ci bya ste /
analyzed: yang na brtags pa dang brtags pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid dpyad pa des ci bya ste /
translated: Or, what is the use of analyzing the imagined and non-imagined natures?

original: dngos po 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad du ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa kho nar tshad ma nye bar sbyar bar bya ste //
analyzed: dngos po 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad du ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa kho nar tshad ma nye bar sbyar bar bya ste //
translated: These things should be established as only not existing inherently by all valid cognitions.

original: yang na mig la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa ni //
translated: Or, the eye and so on

original: yang dag tu na dngos nyid stong //
analyzed: yang dag tu na dngos nyid stong //
translated: Are in reality empty of entityness.

original: byas pa nyid phyir 'jig nyid phyir //
analyzed: byas pa nyid phyir 'jig nyid phyir //
translated: Because they are produced and because they disintegrate,

original: bdud kyis sprul pa'i sangs rgyas bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdud kyis sprul pa'i sangs rgyas bzhin // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are like a magically created Buddha.

original: dper na bdud kyis khyim bdag dpa' bo'i khang par dgra bcom pa nye bar sbas pa kha drang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dper na bdud kyis khyim bdag dpa' bo'i khang par dgra bcom pa nye bar sbas pa kha drang ba'i phyir //
translated: For example, in order to deceive the arhat Upadhana,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku 'od zer gyi kha dog shin tu dbar ba lta bu /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku 'od zer gyi kha dog shin tu dbar ba lta bu /
translated: the demon created the body of a Buddha Bhagavan, with a very bright color like a flame,

original: spyan me tog autpala'i 'dab ma ltar yangs shing sngo ba /
analyzed: spyan me tog autpala'i 'dab ma ltar yangs shing sngo ba /
translated: eyes as expansive and blue as lotus petals,

original: dbu gtsug tor shin tu legs pas rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: dbu gtsug tor shin tu legs pas rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: a very beautiful and well-formed crown protrusion,

original: gsung dbyangs ka la ping ka ltar snyan pa /
analyzed: gsung dbyangs ka la ping ka ltar snyan pa /
translated: a voice as sweet as the kalapinka bird,

original: yan lag dang nyid lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa zhig mngon par sprul pa'i sku des /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa zhig mngon par sprul pa'i sku des /
translated: and very well-defined major and minor parts of the body.

original: yid dang / mig 'phrog pa dang / lha yul @96a * //üîΩpa rmad du byung ba ltar kun du snang du zin kyang byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir /üîΩngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yang rgyu dang rkyen las snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir snang yang ngo bo nyid med pas skye bo mi mkhas pa dag slu bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yid dang / mig 'phrog pa dang / lha yul @96a * // pa rmad du byung ba ltar kun du snang du zin kyang byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir / ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yang rgyu dang rkyen las snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir snang yang ngo bo nyid med pas skye bo mi mkhas pa dag slu bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and the mind, and the eyes, and the gods, and the world of the gods,üîΩeven though they appear to be marvelous, are still illusory because they are created and because they are subject to destruction.üîΩIn the same way, the eyes, etc., are also illusory because, although they appear, they are essenceless, since they are by nature perceived as dependent on causes and conditions, and thus they deceive the unwise.üîΩ

original: 'o na dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid sra ba dang gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang g-yo ba nyid la sogs pa dag snang bzhin pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩbshad pa de dag kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis gzhan sel ba'i ngo bo nyid tsam la brten nas yod par zad de //üîΩdon dam pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid sra ba dang gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang g-yo ba nyid la sogs pa dag snang bzhin pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩbshad pa de dag kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis gzhan sel ba'i ngo bo nyid tsam la brten nas yod par zad de //üîΩdon dam pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir zhe na //
translated: and the mind, and the eyes, and the gods, and the asuras, and the gandharvas, and the kinnaras, and the mahoragas, and the humans, and the animals, and the hungry ghosts, and the denizens of the hells, and the pretas, and the asuras, and the gods, and the humans, and the asuras, and the gandharvas, and the kinnaras, and the mahoragas, and the pretas, and the hungry ghosts, and the animals, and the denizens of the hells, and the humans, and the gods, and the asuras, and the gandharvas, and the kinnaras, and the mahoragas, and the pretas, and the hungry ghosts, and the animals, and the denizens of the hells, and the humans, and the gods, and the asuras, and the gandharvas, and the kinnaras, and the mahoragas, and the pretas, and the hungry ghosts, and the animals, and the denizens of the hells, and the humans, and the gods, and the asuras, and the gandharvas, and the kinnaras, and the mahoragas, and the pretas, and the hungry ghosts, and the animals, and the denizens of the hells, and the humans, and the gods, and the asuras, and the gandharvas, and the kinnaras, and the mahoragas, and the pretas, and the hungry ghosts, and the animals, and the denizens of the hells, and the humans, and the gods, and the asuras, and the gandharvas, and the kinnaras, and the mahoragas, and the pretas, and the hungry ghosts, and the animals, and the denizens of the hells, and the humans, and the gods, and the asuras, and the gandharvas, and the kinnaras, and the mahoragas, and the pretas, and the hungry ghosts, and the animals, and the denizens of the hells, and the humans, and the gods, and the asuras, and the gandharvas, and the kinnaras, and the mahoragas, and the pretas, and the hungry ghosts, and the animals, and the denizens of the hells, and the humans, and the gods, and the asuras,

original: dngos po rnams kyi dngos nyid gang //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi dngos nyid gang //
translated: Whatever is the intrinsic reality of things,

original: yang dag tu na dngos de med //
analyzed: yang dag tu na dngos de med //
translated: that does not exist in reality.

original: byas phyir dper na chu yi ni //
analyzed: byas phyir dper na chu yi ni //
translated: Because they are created, like

original: tsha ba nyid dang brtan nyid bzhin //
analyzed: tsha ba nyid dang brtan nyid bzhin //
translated: the heat and solidity of water.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis dngos po gang gi ngo bo nyid gang rnam par brtags pa de ni yang dag par na de'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis dngos po gang gi ngo bo nyid gang rnam par brtags pa de ni yang dag par na de'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever intrinsic reality of things is imagined by others, that does not exist in reality as its intrinsic reality.

original: byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Because it is created, likeüîΩthe heat and solidity of water.

original: chu la lan 'ga' tsha ba nyid dang / brtan pa nyid du tha snyad gdags pa yod kyang de rtag tu de'i ngo bo nyid yin par shes par mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chu la lan 'ga' tsha ba nyid dang / brtan pa nyid du tha snyad gdags pa yod kyang de rtag tu de'i ngo bo nyid yin par shes par mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: Although the convention of heat and solidity exists in water, it is not possible to know that it is always its intrinsic reality.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir de ltar /üîΩsgrub pa ji skad bstan pa'i mthus //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar / sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa'i mthus //
translated: in that case,üîΩbecause it is not tenable

original: dngos rnams rang gi bdag nyid du //üîΩskye bar 'thad pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: dngos rnams rang gi bdag nyid du // skye bar 'thad pa ma yin pas //
translated: that things arise from themselves,

original: gzhan gyi dngos por mi skye ste //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos por mi skye ste //
translated: they do not arise from others,

original: ba lang bong bur ma mthong bzhin //
analyzed: ba lang bong bur ma mthong bzhin //
translated: like a horse does not see a donkey.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na /
translated: For example,

original: lkog shal dang mjug ma dang no gam dang / rmig pa dang rva la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i ba lang thal khung na 'gre ba dang / du ba'i kha dog dang / sgra bo che dang / rmig pa gcig pa dang / rna ba ring ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bong bu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar ma mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lkog shal dang mjug ma dang no gam dang / rmig pa dang rva la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i ba lang thal khung na 'gre ba dang / du ba'i kha dog dang / sgra bo che dang / rmig pa gcig pa dang / rna ba ring ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bong bu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar ma mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: It is just as when one sees a cow in a pen, possessing the characteristics of a dewlap, a hump, a humped back, hooves, a tail, and so on, one does not see it as having the nature of an ass, possessing the characteristics of a color like smoke, a loud bray, one hoof, long ears, and so on.

original: 'dir rang gi sde pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi sde pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: Here, our own schools say:

original: khyod kyi dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba 'gog par byed pa ni khas blangs pa nyams te /
analyzed: khyod kyi dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba 'gog par byed pa ni khas blangs pa nyams te /
translated: You have undermined your own position by refuting the arising of things from other,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las /
translated: because the Lord Buddha himself has said in the sutras:

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / de ma thag @96b pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen zhes bya ba rkyen bzhi po dag bka' stsal te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / de ma thag @96b pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen zhes bya ba rkyen bzhi po dag bka' stsal te /
translated: ‚ÄúThere are four conditions: the causal condition, the objective condition, the immediately preceding condition, and the dominant condition.‚Äù

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga po dag go //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga po dag go //
translated: The causal condition is the five causes: the co-originating cause, the homogeneous cause, the concomitant cause, the pervasive cause, and the ripening cause.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The objective condition is all phenomena.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags ma thag pa rnams las dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags ma thag pa rnams las dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the mind and mental factors that have just ceased, except for the final mind of the arhat.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed pa'i rgyu ste //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed pa'i rgyu ste //
translated: The dominant condition is the active cause.üîΩThus, things arise from those four conditions that have transformed.‚Äù

original: de ltar rkyen bzhi po gzhan du gyur pa de dag las dngos po rnams skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rkyen bzhi po gzhan du gyur pa de dag las dngos po rnams skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩThings arise conventionally

original: bshad pa / rgyu la sogs pa rkyen gzhan las //üîΩskye ba kun rdzob tha snyad len //
analyzed: bshad pa / rgyu la sogs pa rkyen gzhan las // skye ba kun rdzob tha snyad len //
translated: From other conditions, such as causes.

original: de phyir khas blangs gnod pa med //
analyzed: de phyir khas blangs gnod pa med //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction with our position.

original: de dag yang dag nyid ma yin //
analyzed: de dag yang dag nyid ma yin //
translated: They are not real.

original: ji ltar na rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen de dag ni don dam pa pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen de dag ni don dam pa pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: How is it that those conditions such as cause are not ultimate?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: yod la rkyen rnams mi rigs te //
analyzed: yod la rkyen rnams mi rigs te //
translated: Conditions are not tenable in regard to an existent effect.

original: med la'ang mi rigs yod med phyir //
analyzed: med la'ang mi rigs yod med phyir //
translated: Nor are they tenable in regard to a nonexistent effect, because of existence and nonexistence.

original: de las gzhan bzhin rkyen ma skyes //
analyzed: de las gzhan bzhin rkyen ma skyes //
translated: Like something other, the effect is not produced from conditions.

original: rkyen rnams su ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rkyen rnams su ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could they be conditions?

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la rkyen de dag 'bras bu yod pa'am med pa'i rkyen du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la rkyen de dag 'bras bu yod pa'am med pa'i rkyen du 'gyur grang na /
translated: Here, are those conditions in regard to an existent effect or a nonexistent effect?

original: de la re zhig 'bras bu yod pa la ni rkyen rnams mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'bras bu yod pa la ni rkyen rnams mi rigs te /
translated: First, conditions are not tenable in regard to an existent effect,

original: yod pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bum pa la sogs pa yongs su grub pa la 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bum pa la sogs pa yongs su grub pa la 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it exists. It is just like the fact that conditions such as a lump of clay are not tenable in regard to something else that is fully established, such as a pot.

original: 'bras bu med pa la'ang rkyen rnams mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa la'ang rkyen rnams mi rigs te /
translated: Nor are conditions tenable in regard to a nonexistent effect,

original: med pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa la chu la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa la chu la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it does not exist. It is just like the fact that conditions such as water are not tenable in regard to something else that is nonexistent, such as a sky flower.

original: yang na bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las skye ba med par brtags zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las skye ba med par brtags zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, arising from self, from another, from both, and causelessly have already been refuted.

original: rkyen ma skyes pa rnams dngos po gzhan ma skyes pa gang gi rkyen rnams su ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rkyen ma skyes pa rnams dngos po gzhan ma skyes pa gang gi rkyen rnams su ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could unarisen conditions be the conditions of an unarisen other thing?

original: gzhan yang rgyu ni sgrub par byed na rgyu yin par 'dod na de ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu ni sgrub par byed na rgyu yin par 'dod na de ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Moreover, if a cause is asserted to be a producer, it is not tenable that it is a producer.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rgyu ni 'bras bur skyed ma yin //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bur skyed ma yin //
translated: The cause does not generate the effect.

original: de yis stong phyir de gzhan bzhin //üîΩskye bar @97a * //
analyzed: de yis stong phyir de gzhan bzhin // skye bar @97a * //
translated: Because it is empty of that, it is like another.

original: 'dod pa'ang des bskyed min //
analyzed: 'dod pa'ang des bskyed min //
translated: The effect is not generated by that.

original: snga na med phyir de gzhan bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gis stong pa de ni de bskyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snga na med phyir de gzhan bzhin // zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gis stong pa de ni de bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it does not exist previously, it is like another.üîΩThat which is empty of that does not generate that, just as a pot, etc.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa myu gu bskyed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa myu gu bskyed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: does not generate a sprout.üîΩIt is not tenable to assert that that which does not exist previously in that

original: gang zhig gang na snga na med pa de ni de las skye bar 'dod pa yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang na snga na med pa de ni de las skye bar 'dod pa yin par mi rigs te /
translated: is generated from that.

original: dper na / 'jim pa'i gong bu las snam bu skye bar mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / 'jim pa'i gong bu las snam bu skye bar mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is not reasonable for a cloth to arise from a lump of clay.

original: yang na ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: yang na ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Or, as it has been explained:üîΩIt does not cause the generation of that which has arisen,

original: des ni skyes dang ma skyes dang // skye bzhin skyed par mi byed de //
analyzed: des ni skyes dang ma skyes dang // skye bzhin skyed par mi byed de //
translated: that which has not arisen, or that which is in the process of arising.

original: nyes pa bstan phyir na skyes pa'i //
analyzed: nyes pa bstan phyir na skyes pa'i //
translated: Because the faults have been shown,

original: rgyu ni yang dag nyid ma yin //
analyzed: rgyu ni yang dag nyid ma yin //
translated: the cause of that which has arisen is not tenable.

original: de ltar re zhig rgyu'i rkyen mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rgyu'i rkyen mi 'thad do //
translated: In this way, first the causal condition is untenable.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to refute the objective condition, it is said:

original: skyes pa dmigs pa mi phrad de //
analyzed: skyes pa dmigs pa mi phrad de //
translated: That which has arisen does not contact the objective condition,

original: skyes la'ang skye ba don med phyir //
analyzed: skyes la'ang skye ba don med phyir //
translated: because it is pointless for that which has arisen to arise again.

original: ma skyes pa'ang ma skyes phyir //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'ang ma skyes phyir //
translated: That which has not arisen also does not arise,

original: dper na mi skye chos bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mi skye chos bzhin no //
translated: like a phenomenon that does not arise.

original: zhes bya ba la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de dmigs par bya ba yin pas dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de dmigs par bya ba yin pas dmigs pa ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúobjective condition‚Äù means that which is made into an object, that is, the object of observation.

original: gzung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with ‚Äúthat which is apprehended.‚Äù

original: de la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am /
translated: In this regard, does the eye consciousness, which is the agent that observes, arise or not arise?

original: skye bzhin pa zhig gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa dang phrad grang na /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa zhig gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa dang phrad grang na /
translated: If it is said that that now arising makes contact with the object such as form,

original: de la re zhig skyes pa ni dmigs pa dang mi phrad de /
analyzed: de la re zhig skyes pa ni dmigs pa dang mi phrad de /
translated: then first, that which has arisen does not make contact with the object,

original: skyes ba la'ang skye ba de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes ba la'ang skye ba de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which has arisen has no arising.

original: ma skyes pa yang dmigs pa dang mi phrad de /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang dmigs pa dang mi phrad de /
translated: That which has not arisen also does not make contact with the object,

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i chos dag dmigs pa dang mi phrad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i chos dag dmigs pa dang mi phrad pa bzhin no //
translated: because it has not arisen, just like the consciousness of the eye faculty and so on of the son of a barren woman, which do not make contact with the object.

original: skye bzhin pa yang //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang //
translated: That now arising

original: skye bzhin phrad par 'gyur snyam na //
analyzed: skye bzhin phrad par 'gyur snyam na //
translated: If you think that now arising makes contact,

original: de yang dmigs pa med par med //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa med par med //
translated: that also does not exist without an object.
