original: ces bya ba la ni skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang // ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: ces bya ba la ni skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang // ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gnyi ga'i bdag nyid de //
translated: That now arising is the nature of both that which has arisen and that which has not arisen,

original: de yang dmigs pa dang phrad pa med de /
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa dang phrad pa med de /
translated: that also does not make contact with the object.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la dmigs pa nye bar gyur pa med de /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa nye bar gyur pa med de /
translated: Because that does not approach the object,

original: rang gi bdag nyid ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has not obtained its own nature.

original: gal te skye ba zhin pa de la skye ba'i bya ba bzhugs nas bdag nyid thob pa'i tshe na de dmigs pa dang phrad par @97b 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba zhin pa de la skye ba'i bya ba bzhugs nas bdag nyid thob pa'i tshe na de dmigs pa dang phrad par @97b 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the action of arising exists in that which is now arising, and that it would contact its object when it obtains its own state,

original: bshad pa // yan lag mtshang ba la ni //
analyzed: bshad pa // yan lag mtshang ba la ni //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: skye ba'i bya ba 'jug mi 'dod //
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba 'jug mi 'dod //
translated: The action of arising does not engageüîΩin that which is incomplete.

original: ces bya ba la bya ba ni rtags yod pa tsam du gzung nas dngos po thams cad la brten te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la bya ba ni rtags yod pa tsam du gzung nas dngos po thams cad la brten te /
translated: The action of arising is apprehended as merely existing, and it is based on all things.

original: gnas pa yin na gal te skye bzhin pa ni cung zhig skyes pa dang cung zhig ma skyes pa yin pas de la skye ba'i bya ba ji ltar 'jug ste /
analyzed: gnas pa yin na gal te skye bzhin pa ni cung zhig skyes pa dang cung zhig ma skyes pa yin pas de la skye ba'i bya ba ji ltar 'jug ste /
translated: But if that which is now arising is partly arisen and partly nonarisen, how could the action of arising engage it?

original: yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would have the nature of both existing and not existing.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du lung las dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du lung las dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the s≈´tra passage, ‚ÄúWhat are the phenomena that have an object?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: The mind and mental factors.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that do not have an object?

original: gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Form and nirvƒÅ·πáa,‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa yod pa kho na yin par sems na bshad pa //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa yod pa kho na yin par sems na bshad pa //
translated: If you think that only minds and mental factors have focal objects, then this is explained.

original: yang na sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: yang na sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: Or minds and mental factors

original: yang dag dmigs pa yod mi 'dod /
analyzed: yang dag dmigs pa yod mi 'dod /
translated: are not asserted to have real focal objects.

original: skye bzhin phyir dang gzung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: skye bzhin phyir dang gzung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because they are arising and because they are apprehended,

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin //
translated: they are like form and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la skye bzhin pa dmigs pa dang phrad par sems na de'i dus na dmigs par byed pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang skye bzhin pa yin la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la skye bzhin pa dmigs pa dang phrad par sems na de'i dus na dmigs par byed pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang skye bzhin pa yin la //
translated: If you think that that which is arising contacts its focal object, then at that time the mind and mental factors that are the focal object are also arising.

original: dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang skye bzhin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang skye bzhin pa bzhin te /
translated: And the focal object, such as form, is also arising.

original: skye bzhin par 'dra ba de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen yod par 'dod la //
analyzed: skye bzhin par 'dra ba de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen yod par 'dod la //
translated: Since they are similar in being arising, minds and mental factors are asserted to have the condition of focal object.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen yod par mi 'dod pa 'di la gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ci yod de ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen yod par mi 'dod pa 'di la gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ci yod de ;
translated: But form and so on are not asserted to have the condition of focal object. What is the difference in reason?

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen du brtags pa ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen du brtags pa ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, the investigation of the objective condition is conventional,

original: don dam pa ba ma yin no //üîΩyang na de dag dmigs bcas pa //
analyzed: don dam pa ba ma yin no // yang na de dag dmigs bcas pa //
translated: not ultimate.üîΩOr else, it is not tenable that they are with object,

original: dus gcig phyir na de mi rung //
analyzed: dus gcig phyir na de mi rung //
translated: because they are simultaneous.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs dmigs pa dang bcas pa de dag gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa dang phrad par sems ni de la dus tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs dmigs pa dang bcas pa de dag gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa dang phrad par sems ni de la dus tha dad pa med de /
translated: The collection of mind and mental functions with objects is not tenable, because the mind and its object, such as form, are not simultaneous,

original: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin pas dmigs par byed pa dang dmigs par brtag pa de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin pas dmigs par byed pa dang dmigs par brtag pa de mi rung ngo //
translated: like the right and left horns of a cow. Therefore, the investigation of the object and the agent of perception is not tenable.

original: de ltar dmigs pa yod min pas //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa yod min pas //
translated: Since the object does not exist in this way,

original: gang zhig gang gis dmigs @98a * //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis dmigs @98a * //
translated: what is perceived by what?

original: par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni gang yang gang gi dmigs par mi 'thad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni gang yang gang gi dmigs par mi 'thad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of this statement is that it is not tenable that anything is the object of anything.

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus the objective condition is not tenable.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir mi 'thad de /
translated: The condition of immediate antecedent is not tenable because of noncessation.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ma skyes pa la 'gag med de //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la 'gag med de //
translated: There is no cessation of what has not arisen,

original: ma skyes nyid phyir mkha' min bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma skyes nyid phyir mkha' min bzhin // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it has not arisen, like space.

original: 'gag pa ni skye ba la ltos pa yin na /
analyzed: 'gag pa ni skye ba la ltos pa yin na /
translated: Cessation is dependent on arising.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir 'gag pa yang med do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir 'gag pa yang med do //
translated: Since there is no arising, there is no cessation.

original: 'gags pa la yang 'gag med de //üîΩ'gags phyir dper na shi ba bzhin //
analyzed: 'gags pa la yang 'gag med de // 'gags phyir dper na shi ba bzhin //
translated: There is no cessation of what has ceased,üîΩbecause it has ceased, like a dead person.

original: zhes bya ba ni shi ba la yang 'chi ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shi ba la yang 'chi ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as a dead person does not die,

original: ma 'gags pa la'ang ma 'gags phyir //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa la'ang ma 'gags phyir //
translated: There is no cessation of what has not ceased,

original: da ltar 'jug pa'i mar me bzhin //
analyzed: da ltar 'jug pa'i mar me bzhin //
translated: because it has not ceased, like a burning lamp.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúis‚Äù is understood.

original: gal te ma 'gags pa la 'gag pa yod par gyur na ni mar me 'bar bzhin pa gsal bar bya ba gsal bar byed nus pa yang 'gags pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma 'gags pa la 'gag pa yod par gyur na ni mar me 'bar bzhin pa gsal bar bya ba gsal bar byed nus pa yang 'gags pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were cessation of what has not ceased, then a burning lamp would be like a lamp that has been extinguished.

original: 'gag bzhin pa la'ang mi 'dod de //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa la'ang mi 'dod de //
translated: Cessation of what is in the process of cessation is not accepted,

original: 'gag pa gong du bstan phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa gong du bstan phyir ro //
translated: because cessation has already occurred.

original: zhes bya ba 'gag bzhin pa ni gong gi cung zad ni 'gags /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'gag bzhin pa ni gong gi cung zad ni 'gags /
translated: That which is now ceasing is that which has ceased a little and that which has not ceased a little.

original: cung zad ni 'gags pa yin na 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa gnyis la ni 'gag pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: cung zad ni 'gags pa yin na 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa gnyis la ni 'gag pa mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is untenable that both that which has ceased and that which has not ceased are now ceasing,

original: skyon ji skad bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩci ste 'di snyam du rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa la ni 'gag bzhin pa phan 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig mas bar du mchod pa'i 'gag bzhin pa ni de ma thag pa'i
analyzed: skyon ji skad bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro // ci ste 'di snyam du rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa la ni 'gag bzhin pa phan 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig mas bar du mchod pa'i 'gag bzhin pa ni de ma thag pa'i
translated: because the errors already explained would ensue.

original: rkyen yin par sems na /
analyzed: rkyen yin par sems na /
translated: But if you think that because the present thing that is arising is assisted by that which is now ceasing, due to the power of the individual determination of causes and conditions, then that which is now ceasing, which is not obstructed by another past moment, is the immediately preceding condition,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de yang dus mnyam nyid gcig gam //
analyzed: bshad pa / de yang dus mnyam nyid gcig gam //
translated: Is that also just the same time

original: yang na dus gzhan 'gyur grang na //
analyzed: yang na dus gzhan 'gyur grang na //
translated: Or is it a different time?

original: mi rigs 'gag bzhin yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mi rigs 'gag bzhin yin pa'i phyir //
translated: It is illogical because it is now ceasing,

original: dgra bcom sems kyi tha ma bzhin //
analyzed: dgra bcom sems kyi tha ma bzhin //
translated: Like the final mind of an arhat.

original: zhes bya ba ni de lta na yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'gag bzhin pa ni des bskyed pa'i dngos po skye bzhin pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta na yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'gag bzhin pa ni des bskyed pa'i dngos po skye bzhin pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, it is not logical that the condition as an immediately antecedent condition that is in the process of ceasing generates the entity that is in the process of arising and is the effect of that condition as an immediately antecedent condition,

original: dus mnyam pa'i phyir skyon sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa'i phyir skyon sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are simultaneous. The error in this position has been presented earlier.

original: yang na dus tha dad par gyur na yang de de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: yang na dus tha dad par gyur na yang de de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, even if they were different in time, it is not tenable that the condition as an immediately antecedent condition is the immediately antecedent condition of that entity.

original: 'gag bzhin pa yin @98b pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa yang 'byung ba'i srid pa zad pa nyid mtshams sbyor mi bzod pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma tha ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa yin @98b pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa yang 'byung ba'i srid pa zad pa nyid mtshams sbyor mi bzod pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma tha ma bzhin no //
translated: Because it is in the process of ceasing, like the final moment of mind of an arhat that is incapable of linking with another existence and that is in the process of ceasing.

original: de ltar de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, the condition as an immediately antecedent condition is not tenable.

original: da ni bdag po'i rkyen bdag po'i go rims la bab pas /
analyzed: da ni bdag po'i rkyen bdag po'i go rims la bab pas /
translated: Now, the dominant condition will be discussed, since it is the next in the sequence.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩdngos po yod pa don dam du //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa / dngos po yod pa don dam du //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩIt is illogical for an existent entity to be a dominant condition

original: mi rigs skye ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mi rigs skye ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: in the ultimate sense, because it does not arise.

original: mo gsham bu yi yod pa bzhin //
analyzed: mo gsham bu yi yod pa bzhin //
translated: Like the son of a barren woman,

original: de phyir bdag po med par 'dod //
analyzed: de phyir bdag po med par 'dod //
translated: therefore, it is asserted that there is no dominant condition.

original: ces bya ba la bdag po'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni gang yod na gang 'byung ba de yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: ces bya ba la bdag po'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni gang yod na gang 'byung ba de yin par 'dod na /
translated: Here, if the dominant condition is asserted to be that which arises when something exists,

original: 'di la gang yod na zhes bya ba'i dngos po de don dam par skye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma thob ste /
analyzed: 'di la gang yod na zhes bya ba'i dngos po de don dam par skye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma thob ste /
translated: then the thing that exists when something exists is not obtained as a thing in itself, because it is taught that ultimately it does not arise.

original: mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra ba yin na de gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba gzhan gyi rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra ba yin na de gang 'byung ba zhes bya ba gzhan gyi rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is like the son of a barren woman, how could it be a condition of another, that which arises when it exists?

original: de'i phyir bdag po yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag po yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore the dominant condition is untenable.

original: gzhan yang // 'bras bu stong ngam mi stong pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang // 'bras bu stong ngam mi stong pa'i //
translated: Moreover:

original: rkyen zhig bdag por 'gyur grang na //
analyzed: rkyen zhig bdag por 'gyur grang na //
translated: Would a condition be dominant

original: zhes bya ba de la re zhig / stong pa ma yin des stong phyir //üîΩdper na mig ni sgra blo'i bzhin //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la re zhig / stong pa ma yin des stong phyir // dper na mig ni sgra blo'i bzhin //
translated: of an empty or nonempty effect?üîΩFirst, it is like the eye in the cognition of sound.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na mig sgra'i rnam par shes pas stong pa ni sgra'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na mig sgra'i rnam par shes pas stong pa ni sgra'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: For example, the eye is empty of the cognition of sound, but it is not a condition of the cognition of sound.

original: sgra'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu des stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du mig mig gi rnam par shes pas stong pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu des stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du mig mig gi rnam par shes pas stong pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the eye, which is empty of eye-consciousness, is not the dominant condition of eye-consciousness,

original: des stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty of that.

original: mig stong pa zhes bya ba la kun rdzob tu yang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig stong pa zhes bya ba la kun rdzob tu yang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If the eye were empty of the eye itself, this would contradict the conventional truth, because the eye is renowned in the world.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na //üîΩsbyang la sogs na gnas pa yi //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na // sbyang la sogs na gnas pa yi //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the effect arises from the cause,

original: rgyu tsam yod pa nyi tshe la //
analyzed: rgyu tsam yod pa nyi tshe la //
translated: only the cause exists,üîΩbut the effect is not seen arising from the sprout of barley, etc.

original: nas la sogs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu skye bar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: nas la sogs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu skye bar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /üîΩ'bras bu 'bras bur mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de / 'bras bu 'bras bur mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: Another fault is this:üîΩThe effect would not be an effect,

original: med pa khyod la 'bras bur 'gyur //
analyzed: med pa khyod la 'bras bur 'gyur //
translated: and the nonexistent would be an effect for you.

original: zhes bya ba la 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu yin na gal te rgyu la 'bras bu des mi stong na de la yang bya ba med pa'i phyir snga na yod pa 'bras bu yin par 'dod pa de yang 'bras bur mi 'gyurüîΩzhing gzhan @99a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu yin na gal te rgyu la 'bras bu des mi stong na de la yang bya ba med pa'i phyir snga na yod pa 'bras bu yin par 'dod pa de yang 'bras bur mi 'gyur zhing gzhan @99a * //
translated: Here, if the effect is not empty of the cause, then since it would not be produced by that cause, that which is asserted to be the effect that exists prior to it would not be an effect.

original: zhig phyis byed pa des na med pa gzhan cung zad cig khyod kyi phyogs la 'bras bu yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhig phyis byed pa des na med pa gzhan cung zad cig khyod kyi phyogs la 'bras bu yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it is produced later, then something else that is nonexistent would be the effect in your system.

original: 'di snyam du rgyu la 'bras bu nus par yod pa de nyid la 'bras bu zhes nye bar gdags te des rgyu mi stong pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du rgyu la 'bras bu nus par yod pa de nyid la 'bras bu zhes nye bar gdags te des rgyu mi stong pa kho na yin no //
translated: If you think that the effect that exists in the potential of the cause is designated as the effect, and that the cause is not empty of that,

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: bum pa'i don du 'jim pa kho na len par byed kyi bye ma dag ni mi len te /
analyzed: bum pa'i don du 'jim pa kho na len par byed kyi bye ma dag ni mi len te /
translated: Because one takes up only clay for the purpose of a vase, but not sand,

original: nus pas stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sems na bshad pa //
analyzed: nus pas stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sems na bshad pa //
translated: because it is empty of the potential.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i nus 'bras na //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i nus 'bras na //
translated: If the effect is empty of the cause,

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ci yod //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ci yod //
translated: what is the cause of that?

original: de las gzhan pa ma yin la //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ma yin la //
translated: But it is not different from that.

original: gzhi dang gzhag pa'i dngos mi 'dod ;
analyzed: gzhi dang gzhag pa'i dngos mi 'dod ;
translated: The basis and the thing based are not accepted.üîΩIf the potency of the effect is the effect itself, then what is the cause called that is different from the potency of the effect?

original: / ces bya ba ni gal te 'bras bu'i nus pa gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'bras bu yin na 'bras bu'i nus pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ce zhig yod de gang gi phyir de las gzhan ma yin na gzhi dang gzhag pa'i dngosüîΩpor rtag tu yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: / ces bya ba ni gal te 'bras bu'i nus pa gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'bras bu yin na 'bras bu'i nus pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ce zhig yod de gang gi phyir de las gzhan ma yin na gzhi dang gzhag pa'i dngos por rtag tu yang mi rung ste /
translated: Because it is not different from that, it is never tenable that the basis and the thing based exist.

original: dper na dug dang chad dag las dug dang chang gi nus pa tha mi dad pa bzhin du gzhi dang gzhag pa'i dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na dug dang chad dag las dug dang chang gi nus pa tha mi dad pa bzhin du gzhi dang gzhag pa'i dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, just as the potency of alcohol is not different from alcohol, the basis and the thing based would not exist.

original: ci ste gzhan ma yin yang sla ste //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan ma yin yang sla ste //
translated: But if it is not different, that is easy to refute.

original: 'bras bu'i ming tsam nyid la ni //üîΩdper na mkha' la mkha' gnas bzhin //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ming tsam nyid la ni // dper na mkha' la mkha' gnas bzhin //
translated: The mere name of the effectüîΩis like space abiding in space.

original: zhes bya ba na dper na gzhan ma yin yang nam mkha' la nam mkha' gnas so zhes bya ba la gzhi dang gzhag pa'i dngos po nye bar gdags su rung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba na dper na gzhan ma yin yang nam mkha' la nam mkha' gnas so zhes bya ba la gzhi dang gzhag pa'i dngos po nye bar gdags su rung ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as space is not different from space, it is tenable to designate the basis and the thing based as abiding in space.

original: gal te rgyu la 'bras bu'i nus pa gzhan ma yin yang rgyu la 'bras bu'i nus pa yod do zhes nye bar gdags su rung ngo zhes na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu la 'bras bu'i nus pa gzhan ma yin yang rgyu la 'bras bu'i nus pa yod do zhes nye bar gdags su rung ngo zhes na /
translated: But if you say that although the potency of the effect is not different from the cause, it is correct to impute that the cause has the potency of the effect,

original: de ni kho bo cag kun rdzob par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni kho bo cag kun rdzob par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: we also accept that conventionally.

original: gal te de nyid rgyu yin na //
analyzed: gal te de nyid rgyu yin na //
translated: If that is the cause,

original: gang gis mi stong de cir yod //
analyzed: gang gis mi stong de cir yod //
translated: what is there that is not empty?

original: gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is that?

original: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid de rgyu yin na ni de lta na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid de rgyu yin na ni de lta na /
translated: If the essence of the effect is the cause, then

original: khyed cag 'bras bu gang gis mi stong pa de rgyu yin par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba de las gzhan ci zhig yin par 'dod //
analyzed: khyed cag 'bras bu gang gis mi stong pa de rgyu yin par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba de las gzhan ci zhig yin par 'dod //
translated: what is there that is not empty of the effect that you assert to be the cause? What is there that you assert to be the effect?üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang // yod pa skye ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang // yod pa skye ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: because that which exists does not arise,

original: gang zhig gang gi bdag por 'dod //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi bdag por 'dod //
translated: what is the essence of what?

original: med la rkyen yang med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: med la rkyen yang med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because that which does not exist has no conditions,

original: gang zhig gang gi bdag por 'dod //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi bdag por 'dod //
translated: what is the essence of what?

original: ces bya ba ni gal te 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin na yod pa nyid yin @99b pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa yongs su grub pa dag la skye ba med pa bzhin du skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu gang gi bdag poüîΩyin par 'dod /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gal te 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin na yod pa nyid yin @99b pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa yongs su grub pa dag la skye ba med pa bzhin du skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu gang gi bdag po yin par 'dod /
translated: So what cause would be the dominant condition of what effect?

original: gal te 'bras bu med pa nyid yin na ni de med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa dag la rkyen rnams med pa bzhin du rkyen med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu med pa nyid yin na ni de med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa dag la rkyen rnams med pa bzhin du rkyen med pa'i phyir /
translated: If the effect does not exist, then like the nonexistence of the conditions of a sky flower and so on, it would be devoid of conditions because it does not exist.

original: rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu gang gi bdag po'i rkyen du 'dod /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu gang gi bdag po'i rkyen du 'dod /
translated: So what cause would be the dominant condition of what effect?

original: 'dir pha rol po'i rgol pa'i skabs snang nas slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po'i rgol pa'i skabs snang nas slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
translated: Here, the master responds to the apparent objection of the opponent:

original: gal te bum sogs skyes mthong bas //
analyzed: gal te bum sogs skyes mthong bas //
translated: If you see the production of a pot and so on,

original: mthong la gtan tshigs don med de ;
analyzed: mthong la gtan tshigs don med de ;
translated: then the reason is meaningless.

original: / mngon sum dang ni grags pa yi //
analyzed: / mngon sum dang ni grags pa yi //
translated: If you say it is undermined by perception and what is commonly acknowledged,

original: gnod pas gnod par 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: gnod pas gnod par 'gyur zhe na //
translated: then it is undermined.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te kha cig 'di skad ces /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te kha cig 'di skad ces /
translated: If someone says this, then the response is as follows.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag 'jim pa dang dbyug gu dang 'khor lo dang srad bu dang chu dang / rdza mkhan gyi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa skyes pa yin par mig la sogs pas mthong bas dbang po rnams kyis mthong ba de la ni khyod kyis smras pa'i gtan tshigs don med de /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag 'jim pa dang dbyug gu dang 'khor lo dang srad bu dang chu dang / rdza mkhan gyi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa skyes pa yin par mig la sogs pas mthong bas dbang po rnams kyis mthong ba de la ni khyod kyis smras pa'i gtan tshigs don med de /
translated: Pots and so on are manifestly established by conditions such as clay, a stick, a wheel, string, water, the potter, and so on. Since they are seen by the eye and so on, your reason is meaningless with respect to what is seen by the eye and so on.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pa'i phyir te /üîΩgang zhig ba lang la rva med de /
analyzed: mthong ba las lhag pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pa'i phyir te / gang zhig ba lang la rva med de /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition other than seeing.üîΩFor example, if someone says, ‚ÄúA cow does not have a horn because it is a living being, like a horse,‚Äù then that would be undermined by direct perception.

original: srog chags yin pa'i phyir rta bzhin no zhes zer ba de la mngon sum gyi gnod par 'gyur ba bzhin du khyod la yang re zhig de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog chags yin pa'i phyir rta bzhin no zhes zer ba de la mngon sum gyi gnod par 'gyur ba bzhin du khyod la yang re zhig de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, for you, that would be undermined by direct perception.

original: de bzhin du ri khrod pa yan chad dang gdol pa yan chad dang ba lang rdzi yan chad la yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ri khrod pa yan chad dang gdol pa yan chad dang ba lang rdzi yan chad la yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Similarly, for a forest hermit, for a low-caste person, and for a cowherd, it is like this.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag skyes par grags pas de'i phyir khyod la grags pa'i gnod par yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag skyes par grags pas de'i phyir khyod la grags pa'i gnod par yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since pots and so on are renowned as arisen, therefore the fault of contradicting what is renowned to you would ensue.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: bum pa la sogs skye ba dag / byis pa'i blo dang mthun mthong ba //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs skye ba dag / byis pa'i blo dang mthun mthong ba //
translated: The arising of pots and so on is seen to accord with the minds of childish beings.

original: gang phyir de ni mi 'gog pas //
analyzed: gang phyir de ni mi 'gog pas //
translated: Since that is not refuted,

original: de phyir ji skad smras skyon med //
analyzed: de phyir ji skad smras skyon med //
translated: therefore the fault you mention is not entailed.

original: ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i skye ba bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dpyad pa dang bral ba sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i skye ba snang ba lta bu'i byis pa'i skye bo'i blo dang mthun par mthong ba de ni kun @100a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'i skye ba bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dpyad pa dang bral ba sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i skye ba snang ba lta bu'i byis pa'i skye bo'i blo dang mthun par mthong ba de ni kun @100a * //
translated: The arising of pots and so on is seen to accord with the minds of childish beings, like the arising of illusions, mirages, cities of gandharvas, and so on, which are free of analysis in terms of arising from self, from another, from both, or without cause, from existent or nonexistent things, and so on.

original: rdzob kyi tshul du yod pas byis pa'i blo dang mthun par mthong ba de ni ma bkag ste /
analyzed: rdzob kyi tshul du yod pas byis pa'i blo dang mthun par mthong ba de ni ma bkag ste /
translated: Since that is seen to exist in the manner of the relative, it is not refuted in accordance with the minds of childish beings.

original: 'di ltar don dam pa'i blo rtog pa'i skyon gyi dri ma ma lus pa spong par bzod pas brtags na mi rigs par bstan pas de'i phyir mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pa ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam pa'i blo rtog pa'i skyon gyi dri ma ma lus pa spong par bzod pas brtags na mi rigs par bstan pas de'i phyir mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pa ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Thus, since it is accepted that the ultimate mind eliminates all stains of the faults of conceptuality, when analyzed, it is taught that it is illogical. Therefore, the faults stated are not undermined by direct perception and renown.

original: de ltar spyir lan btab nas /
analyzed: de ltar spyir lan btab nas /
translated: Having thus given a general response,

original: da ni khyad par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni khyad par brjod par bya ste /
translated: now the specific response will be stated.

original: 'di la mngon sum du smra bas ni re zhig mngon sum gyi sgo nas nges par bzung nas de'i gnod pas brgal bar bya ba yin na mngon sum yang kun rdzob pa yin pas don dam pa pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la mngon sum du smra bas ni re zhig mngon sum gyi sgo nas nges par bzung nas de'i gnod pas brgal bar bya ba yin na mngon sum yang kun rdzob pa yin pas don dam pa pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the proponent of direct perception, having first ascertained it through direct perception, should be challenged with its refutation. However, since direct perception is conventional, it is not ultimate.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gzugs la dmigs pa'i blo la ni //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa'i blo la ni //
translated: The mind that observes form

original: yang dag tu na rang rig med //
analyzed: yang dag tu na rang rig med //
translated: does not truly know itself.

original: de ma skyes phyir kho bo la //
analyzed: de ma skyes phyir kho bo la //
translated: Since it does not arise,

original: de yi gnod pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: de yi gnod pa med phyir ro //
translated: it is not undermined by that.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang de la 'jug pa skye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed kyi tshogs g-yo ba med pa'i phyir dang / dbang po rnams blun pa nyid kyi phyir gcig gis yul 'dzin pa yang mi nus la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang de la 'jug pa skye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed kyi tshogs g-yo ba med pa'i phyir dang / dbang po rnams blun pa nyid kyi phyir gcig gis yul 'dzin pa yang mi nus la /
translated: This is the summary of the meaning: because the object of knowledge and the arising of engagement with it are taught to be non-arisen, because the collection of formations is unmoving, and because the faculties are dull, one cannot apprehend an object.

original: tshogs pa las byang ba'i blo yang kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi mngon sum du 'gyur na des kho bo la gnod par 'gyur zhes don bsdu ba ni de yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa las byang ba'i blo yang kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gi mngon sum du 'gyur na des kho bo la gnod par 'gyur zhes don bsdu ba ni de yin no //
translated: And because the cognition that arises from the collection is conventional, it is said, ‚ÄúBy what direct perception would I be harmed?‚Äù

original: yang na de'i mngon sum 'di ltar mi rung ste //üîΩmngon sum blo ni don dam du //
analyzed: yang na de'i mngon sum 'di ltar mi rung ste // mngon sum blo ni don dam du //
translated: Or else, direct perception is not suitable in this way:üîΩDirect perception is not

original: don bzhin nyid du mi rigs te //
analyzed: don bzhin nyid du mi rigs te //
translated: logically possible in the ultimate.

original: byis pa'i blo dang khyad med phyir //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo dang khyad med phyir //
translated: Because it is no different from the cognition of a child,

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo'i blo bzhin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo'i blo bzhin no // zhes bya ba la //
translated: like the cognition of a whirling firebrand.

original: byis pa'i blo dang khyad med phyir //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo dang khyad med phyir //
translated: Because it is no different from the cognition of a child,

original: zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa nyid dang bstan du med pa nyid dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid ni byis pa dang / 'phags pa'i blo la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa nyid dang bstan du med pa nyid dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid ni byis pa dang / 'phags pa'i blo la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because self-awareness, being imperceptible, and being non-conceptual, there is no difference between the minds of the childish and the ƒÅryas.

original: dngos po rang gi ngo bo snang ba rtsam gyi spyod yul dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rang gi ngo bo snang ba rtsam gyi spyod yul dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the domain of the mere appearance of the intrinsic reality of things,

original: mgal me la 'khor lor snang bar gyur pa'i blo rtog pa med pa bzhin no ;
analyzed: mgal me la 'khor lor snang bar gyur pa'i blo rtog pa med pa bzhin no ;
translated: it is like the non-conceptual cognition that perceives a circle in a whirling firebrand.

original: / de yi spyod yul dngos med de //
analyzed: / de yi spyod yul dngos med de //
translated: Its domain is not a thing,

original: 'dus byas yin phyir bdag blo bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi blo'i spyod yul gyi gzugs bstan du med pa yang dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin phyir bdag blo bzhin // zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi blo'i spyod yul gyi gzugs bstan du med pa yang dngos po ma yin te /
translated: because it is conditioned, like the cognition of the self.

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir bdag gi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir bdag gi blo bzhin no //
translated: This is because the form that is the domain of direct perception is not a thing, because it is conditioned, like the cognition of the self.

original: gzhan yang / gzugs la @100b sogs pa rdzas min phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzugs la @100b sogs pa rdzas min phyir //
translated: Moreover, because form and so on are not substances,

original: de la mngon sum gnod pa med //
analyzed: de la mngon sum gnod pa med //
translated: direct perception is not undermined.

original: ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rdzas brgyad 'dus pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i blo dag ni dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de ltar mngon sum med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rdzas brgyad 'dus pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i blo dag ni dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de ltar mngon sum med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since they do not exist in that way, direct perception does not exist.

original: kho bo cag la de'i gnod pa med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag la de'i gnod pa med do //
translated: Therefore, we are not harmed by that.

original: kho bo cag la grags pa'i gnod pa yang med de /
analyzed: kho bo cag la grags pa'i gnod pa yang med de /
translated: We are also not harmed by what is renowned in the world.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mkhas pa'i tshul la dpyad pa la //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i tshul la dpyad pa la //
translated: When analyzing the way of the wise,

original: grags pa'i gnod pa yod ma yin //üîΩde nyid la ni ma rig pa'i //
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod pa yod ma yin // de nyid la ni ma rig pa'i //
translated: there is no harm by what is renowned.üîΩThis is not the occasion for the words of the blind

original: ling tog mdongs pa'i tshig skabs min //
analyzed: ling tog mdongs pa'i tshig skabs min //
translated: to be applied to reality, which is obscured by ignorance.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na mig thogs pa med cing dri ma med pas yongs su btags pa'i don rin po che ma rgad dang / bee d'u rya la sogs pa rin po che brtag pa dag la dmus lo rnams dang / rab rib kyis mig nyams pa rnams kyi skabs ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na mig thogs pa med cing dri ma med pas yongs su btags pa'i don rin po che ma rgad dang / bee d'u rya la sogs pa rin po che brtag pa dag la dmus lo rnams dang / rab rib kyis mig nyams pa rnams kyi skabs ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, the analysis of precious substances such as cat‚Äôs eye and lapis lazuli is not the occasion for the blind, whose eyes are impaired by cataracts, and whose eyes are unpurified and unimpeded.

original: de la blo gsal ba dang mig dang ldan pa rnams kyi skabs yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la blo gsal ba dang mig dang ldan pa rnams kyi skabs yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: This is the case for those who are intelligent and have eyes.

original: stong pa nyid kyi lta ba'i mig sman gyis yong su sbyangs pa'i rigs pa dri ma med pa'i mig yangs pa dang ldan pa'i mkhas pa rnams kyi skabs yin gyi /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi lta ba'i mig sman gyis yong su sbyangs pa'i rigs pa dri ma med pa'i mig yangs pa dang ldan pa'i mkhas pa rnams kyi skabs yin gyi /
translated: Likewise, this is the case for the wise, who have the eyes of stainless reasoning, which are purified by the eye medicine of the view of emptiness.

original: ma rig pa'i ling tog gis rmongs pa dang / dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mthong bar mi nus par rab rib can dang 'dra ba khams gsum pa'i dngos po sna tshogs la rtog pa yang dag pham yin pa'i kun du rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i dri mas blo gros kyi mig dkrugs pa mi mkhas pa
analyzed: ma rig pa'i ling tog gis rmongs pa dang / dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mthong bar mi nus par rab rib can dang 'dra ba khams gsum pa'i dngos po sna tshogs la rtog pa yang dag pham yin pa'i kun du rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i dri mas blo gros kyi mig dkrugs pa mi mkhas pa
translated: This is not the case for the unwise, whose eyes of intelligence are disturbed by the stains of conceptual thought, which are motivated by the conception that the various things of the three realms are real. They are confused by the cataracts of ignorance and are like those with blurred vision, who are unable to see the nature of things.

original: rnams kyi tshig gi skabs med pas grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur re skan /
analyzed: rnams kyi tshig gi skabs med pas grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur re skan /
translated: Therefore, since this is not the domain of their words, how could they possibly invalidate what is renowned?

original: de ltar gzhan las skye ba bkag pa'i zhar la 'ongs pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan las skye ba bkag pa'i zhar la 'ongs pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having thus completed the digression,

original: yang grangs can 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: yang grangs can 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Again, for the sake of the Samkhyas who maintain that the effect exists prior to the cause, it is said:

original: yod la'ang skye bar mi 'dod de //
analyzed: yod la'ang skye bar mi 'dod de //
translated: We do not maintain that what exists is produced.

original: yod pa ci phyir skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yod pa ci phyir skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Why would what exists be produced?

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni skye ba yin na yod pa la ni 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni skye ba yin na yod pa la ni 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which possesses the characteristic of origination is produced. But what exists does not originate.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du rgyu la 'bras bu nas pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa de rkyen rnams kyis rags pa nyid du sgrub par sems na bshad pa /
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du rgyu la 'bras bu nas pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa de rkyen rnams kyis rags pa nyid du sgrub par sems na bshad pa /
translated: But if you think that the effect, which exists in the nature of the cause, is established in the state of grossness by the conditions, then it is said:

original: yod pa rags par mi byed de /üîΩsnga na @101a * //
analyzed: yod pa rags par mi byed de / snga na @101a * //
translated: We do not make what exists gross.

original: med dang phyis 'byung phyir //
analyzed: med dang phyis 'byung phyir //
translated: Because it would be prior nonexistence and subsequent existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni de lta na yang 'bras bu snga na med par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta na yang 'bras bu snga na med par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Even so, the effect would be prior nonexistence,

original: rags pa nyid snga na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa nyid snga na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because grossness would be prior nonexistence.

original: dper na shing n-ya gro dha'i sa bon chung ngu la shing n-ya gro dha zhes bya ba'i sdong po yal ga dang yal ga phra mo du mas rgyas pa'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de snga na yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: dper na shing n-ya gro dha'i sa bon chung ngu la shing n-ya gro dha zhes bya ba'i sdong po yal ga dang yal ga phra mo du mas rgyas pa'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de snga na yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir
translated: For example, in a small seed of a nyagrodha tree, the nature of a nyagrodha tree, which is a trunk and many large and small branches, does not exist. Therefore, because it does not exist previously,

original: dang / phyis 'byung ba'i phyir de yod do zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: dang / phyis 'byung ba'i phyir de yod do zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: and because it arises later, it is illogical to say, ‚ÄúIt exists.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang / mig gi rags pa nyid gang yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mig gi rags pa nyid gang yin //
translated: Moreover: The coarseness of the eye

original: de ni rkyen gyis ma byas te //
analyzed: de ni rkyen gyis ma byas te //
translated: is not created by conditions.

original: snga na med phyir rdza ma bzhin //
analyzed: snga na med phyir rdza ma bzhin //
translated: Because it does not exist previously, like a pot.

original: shes bya yin phyir za po bzhin //
analyzed: shes bya yin phyir za po bzhin //
translated: Because it is an object of knowledge, like a consumer.üîΩIf conditions have the ability to generate the coarseness of the effect, which does not exist previously, then the great elements that are the conditions of the eye would also

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te rkyen rnams la 'bras bu rags pa nyid ces bya ba snga na med pa skyed pa'i mthu yod na ni mig gi rkyen gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis kyang mig la sogs pa las gzhan pa rdza ma la sogs pa dag
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te rkyen rnams la 'bras bu rags pa nyid ces bya ba snga na med pa skyed pa'i mthu yod na ni mig gi rkyen gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis kyang mig la sogs pa las gzhan pa rdza ma la sogs pa dag
translated: create pots and so on, which are other than the eye and so on.

original: ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: Why would they not create them?

original: yang dper na skyes bu shes bya yang yin la nus pa'i bdag nyid du yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: yang dper na skyes bu shes bya yang yin la nus pa'i bdag nyid du yang yod mod kyi /
translated: Again, it is just as in the case of a person who is an object of knowledge and also exists as a potential,

original: des gang yang rags pa nyid du mi byed pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des gang yang rags pa nyid du mi byed pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but he does not cause anything to be gross. It follows that the same is true of the eye, etc.

original: 'di snyam du khyod ni bdag med par smra ba yin la khyod kyis za ba po'i dpe nyid du byas pa ni rang la dpe ma grub par sems na bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di snyam du khyod ni bdag med par smra ba yin la khyod kyis za ba po'i dpe nyid du byas pa ni rang la dpe ma grub par sems na bshad pa /
translated: If you think that you are a proponent of selflessness and that the example of the experiencer is not established for you, then we reply:

original: za po la sogs kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: za po la sogs kun rdzob tu //
translated: The experiencer, etc., are assertedüîΩconventionally,

original: thun mong yin par 'dod pa'i phyir //üîΩde phyir nged la gang du yang //
analyzed: thun mong yin par 'dod pa'i phyir // de phyir nged la gang du yang //
translated: because they are commonly accepted.üîΩTherefore, in no way

original: dpe ni skyon du 'gyur ba med //üîΩces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpe ni skyon du 'gyur ba med // ces bya ba ni /
translated: is there a fault in our example.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag kyang lus dang / dbang po dang blo'i tshogs kyi yan lag gang yang rung ba shas che bar 'jug pa la ltos nas za ba po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kun rdzob tu phung po dang / khams dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag kyang lus dang / dbang po dang blo'i tshogs kyi yan lag gang yang rung ba shas che bar 'jug pa la ltos nas za ba po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kun rdzob tu phung po dang / khams dang /
translated: This is because we also use the conventional expressions ‚Äúexperiencer,‚Äù etc., in dependence on the predominance of any one of the aggregates, elements, or faculties in the collection of body, faculties, and mind.

original: skye mched kyi yul dag la tha snyad gdags pa thun mong du grub pas de'i phyir kho bo cag la tshad ma gang du yang rang la dpe ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: skye mched kyi yul dag la tha snyad gdags pa thun mong du grub pas de'i phyir kho bo cag la tshad ma gang du yang rang la dpe ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Since the objects of the sense bases are commonly established as imputations, therefore we do not commit the error of having an example that is not established for us in any valid cognition.

original: kho bos kun rdzob kho nar tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa byas kyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bos kun rdzob kho nar tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa byas kyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: We posit valid cognition only conventionally, not ultimately,

original: de ni brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de ni brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because that is inexpressible.

original: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba //
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba //
translated: The Commentary on the Essence of the Middle Way, the Blaze of Reasoning

original: bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po brgyad pa /
translated: Volume 8

original: 'dir grangs can pa @101b dag nyid las mngon par gsal bar smra ba kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can pa @101b dag nyid las mngon par gsal bar smra ba kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Here some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, who advocate manifestation from primal substance, offer a rebuttal:

original: gang dag gis dngos po rnams skye bar btags pa de dag nyid la skyon der 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang dag gis dngos po rnams skye bar btags pa de dag nyid la skyon der 'gyur gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe error you ascribe to the arising of things applies to you.

original: kho bo cag ni bum pa la sogs pa dngos po rnams 'jim pa la sogs pa dag la yod pa nyid rkyen rnams kyis mngon par gsal bar byed par smra bas kho bo cag la skyon de lta bur mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni bum pa la sogs pa dngos po rnams 'jim pa la sogs pa dag la yod pa nyid rkyen rnams kyis mngon par gsal bar byed par smra bas kho bo cag la skyon de lta bur mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But we do not commit such an error, because we say that the conditions manifest the existence of things such as pots in such things as clay.

original: de la phyir 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la phyir 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response to that, we would say this:

original: gal te gsal ba skyon med na //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba skyon med na //
translated: If manifestation is without error,

original: gang gis ci gsal ji lta bu //
analyzed: gang gis ci gsal ji lta bu //
translated: By what, how, and what is it manifested?

original: gal te de dag 'di skad ces //
analyzed: gal te de dag 'di skad ces //
translated: If they say this:

original: dper na mar mes bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: dper na mar mes bum pa bzhin //
translated: For example, like a pot by a lamp.

original: zhes zer na de la bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes zer na de la bshad pa /
translated: We would respond:

original: yod la mngon gsal med phyir ro //
analyzed: yod la mngon gsal med phyir ro //
translated: Because that which exists is not manifested.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dngos po skyes shing yod pa nyid la yod pa gzhan gyis mngon par gsal bar byed pa ni rigs grang na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dngos po skyes shing yod pa nyid la yod pa gzhan gyis mngon par gsal bar byed pa ni rigs grang na /
translated: Thus, if the manifestation of an existent thing that has arisen and exists by another existence were reasonable,

original: 'di la ni ma skyes par bstan pas ji ltar na /
analyzed: 'di la ni ma skyes par bstan pas ji ltar na /
translated: but here, because it is taught that it has not arisen, how could

original: bum pa ma skyes pa mar me ma skyes pas mngon par gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: bum pa ma skyes pa mar me ma skyes pas mngon par gsal bar byed de /
translated: an unarisen pot be manifested by an unarisen lamp?

original: gang gi phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu ma skyes shing med pa ni nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ma skyes shing med pa dag gis mngon par gsal bar byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu ma skyes shing med pa ni nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ma skyes shing med pa dag gis mngon par gsal bar byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the illusory person is not arisen and does not exist, it is not tenable that it is manifested by the non-arisen and non-existent sky flower, etc.

original: de yod pa nyid du khas blangs su zin kyang /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid du khas blangs su zin kyang /
translated: Even if you accept that it exists,

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis bshad pa //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis bshad pa //
translated: it is explained by the method of conventional truth.

original: kun rdzob tu'ang mar mes ni //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu'ang mar mes ni //
translated: Even conventionally, the lamp

original: bum pa snang dang bcas pa dang // de yi blo'am gnyen po dag / skye bar byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bum pa snang dang bcas pa dang // de yi blo'am gnyen po dag / skye bar byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: illuminates the vase and its cognition or its antidote.

original: zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la bum pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs yin pas kun rdzob tu yang mar me nye bar gyur pas ni bum pa snang ba dang bcas pa sngon ma skyes pa gdod pa skye bar byed pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la bum pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs yin pas kun rdzob tu yang mar me nye bar gyur pas ni bum pa snang ba dang bcas pa sngon ma skyes pa gdod pa skye bar byed pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: In our system, the so-called vase is a collection of elements and elemental evolutes. Even conventionally, the lamp that is present illuminates the vase that was not previously arisen and causes it to arise.

original: skyes pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not illuminate what has already arisen.

original: gal te bum pa de sngon blo'i gzung ba nyid du ma gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te bum pa de sngon blo'i gzung ba nyid du ma gyur ba yin la /
translated: If the pot were not previously the object of the cognition,

original: phyis mar mes de blo'i gzung ba nyid du gyur par byed na ni de lta na mar mes de'i blo de nyid snga na med pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phyis mar mes de blo'i gzung ba nyid du gyur par byed na ni de lta na mar mes de'i blo de nyid snga na med pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: and later the butterlamp makes it the object of the cognition, then in that case the butterlamp would generate the cognition of that which did not exist previously.

original: de'i blo snga na yod pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i blo snga na yod pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But it would not illuminate the cognition of that which existed previously.

original: ci ste mun pa'i nang na bum pa mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du @102a * //
analyzed: ci ste mun pa'i nang na bum pa mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du @102a * //
translated: If, in the darkness, the pot is not the object of the eye consciousness,

original: med par gyur pa mar mes mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du yod par byed pa na yang de nyid snga na med pa yod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: med par gyur pa mar mes mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du yod par byed pa na yang de nyid snga na med pa yod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: and the butterlamp makes it the object of the eye consciousness, then it would make that which did not exist previously exist.

original: yod pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it would not illuminate that which exists.

original: ci ste bum pa gzung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mun pa yod pa mar mes sel bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa gzung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mun pa yod pa mar mes sel bar byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the darkness, which is the opposite of the apprehension of the pot, exists and the butterlamp clears it away,

original: de lta na yang mun pa'i gnyen por snang ba dag snga na med pa nyid mar mes skye bar byed pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na yang mun pa'i gnyen por snang ba dag snga na med pa nyid mar mes skye bar byed pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: In that case, the light that is the antidote to darkness is that which causes the generation of what did not exist previously.

original: gnyen po snga na med pa dag phyis mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyen po snga na med pa dag phyis mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the previously nonexistent antidote is later made manifest.

original: ci ste bum pa gzung bar snang ba nyid snga na yod na mar mes ci bya /üîΩgzhan yang chen po la sogs pa mngon par mi gsal ba dag gsal bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa gzung bar snang ba nyid snga na yod na mar mes ci bya / gzhan yang chen po la sogs pa mngon par mi gsal ba dag gsal bar byed do zhe na /
translated: But if the appearance of the apprehended pot existed previously, what would a butter lamp do?

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, if you say that it makes manifest what is not manifest, such as a large object, that is also untenable.

original: ji lta zhe na //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na //
translated: How so?

original: mngon par mi gsal gsal mi byed //
analyzed: mngon par mi gsal gsal mi byed //
translated: It does not make manifest what is not manifest.

original: mi gsal phyir na mkha' min bzhin //
analyzed: mi gsal phyir na mkha' min bzhin //
translated: Because it is not manifest, it is like space.

original: rang tshul gyis kyang dper bya na ;
analyzed: rang tshul gyis kyang dper bya na ;
translated: If you use an example from their own system,

original: / gtso bo za po bzhin du bstan //
analyzed: / gtso bo za po bzhin du bstan //
translated: it is taught that it is like the enjoyer of the primary nature.

original: zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag nyid kyi rang gi tshul gyis kyang dper bya na snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa cha mnyam pa mi gsal ba ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag nyid kyi rang gi tshul gyis kyang dper bya na snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa cha mnyam pa mi gsal ba ni gtso bo ste /
translated: In the CƒÅrvƒÅka‚Äôs own system, the primary nature is the unmanifest state of the equilibrium of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: rang bzhin yin la de bzhin du za ba po skyes bu zhes bya ba yang ma skyes pa'i phyir /üîΩmngon par mi gsal ba yin pas gsal bar mi byed pa de bzhin du chen po la sogs pa mngon phar mi gsal ba la yang gsal bar mi byed de /
analyzed: rang bzhin yin la de bzhin du za ba po skyes bu zhes bya ba yang ma skyes pa'i phyir / mngon par mi gsal ba yin pas gsal bar mi byed pa de bzhin du chen po la sogs pa mngon phar mi gsal ba la yang gsal bar mi byed de /
translated: Likewise, the so-called consumer, the person, is not born, and so

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: it is not manifest. Therefore, it does not manifest. Likewise, the great elements and so on, which are not manifest, do not manifest because they are not manifest.

original: ci ste rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis za ba po yang gsal bar bya ba yin par rtog na de lta na //
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis za ba po yang gsal bar bya ba yin par rtog na de lta na //
translated: If you think that the consumer is manifest in some way, then:

original: gal te de yang mngon gsal na //
analyzed: gal te de yang mngon gsal na //
translated: If it is manifest,

original: za po kun 'gro ma yin zhing //
analyzed: za po kun 'gro ma yin zhing //
translated: the consumer would not be omnipresent,

original: rgyu med ma yin shes yod min //
analyzed: rgyu med ma yin shes yod min //
translated: it would not be causeless, it would not be consciousness,

original: mi gsal ba yang nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi gsal ba yang nyams par 'gyur //
translated: and nonmanifestation would be destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te za ba po de yang mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin na za ba po de yang bum la sogs pa bzhin du kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu med pa ma yin pa dang / shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te za ba po de yang mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin na za ba po de yang bum la sogs pa bzhin du kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu med pa ma yin pa dang / shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa dang /
translated: If the consumer is manifest, then the consumer would not be omnipresent like a pot and so on, it would not be causeless, it would not be consciousness, and nonmanifestation would be destroyed.

original: za ba po'i ngo bo nyid mi gsal ba zhes bya ba yang nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: za ba po'i ngo bo nyid mi gsal ba zhes bya ba yang nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of the enjoyer would also be impaired, called ‚Äúunmanifest.‚Äù

original: gtso bo yang mngon par gsal bar bya ba nyid du rtog na de lta na /
analyzed: gtso bo yang mngon par gsal bar bya ba nyid du rtog na de lta na /
translated: If you imagine that the primal substance is also manifest, then:

original: gal te gtso bo mngon @102b gsal na //
analyzed: gal te gtso bo mngon @102b gsal na //
translated: If the primal substance is manifest,üîΩthen it follows that the primal substance is a product,

original: khyod kyi gtso bo bya ba dang // dpag yod gsal bar thal 'gyur te //
analyzed: khyod kyi gtso bo bya ba dang // dpag yod gsal bar thal 'gyur te //
translated: is finite, and is manifest.

original: de ni de dag min par grags //
analyzed: de ni de dag min par grags //
translated: But it is renowned that it is not those.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te gtso bo yang mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin na khyod kyi gtso bo bya ba nyid dang / dpag tu yod pa nyid dang / gsal ba nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te gtso bo yang mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin na khyod kyi gtso bo bya ba nyid dang / dpag tu yod pa nyid dang / gsal ba nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te //
translated: If the primal substance is also manifest, then it follows that the primal substance is a product, is finite, and is manifest.

original: gtso bo de ni ma byas pa dang thams cad du song ba dang / mi gsal ba yin pas byang ba dang dpag tu yod pa dang gsal bar de dag ma yin par khyed nyid la grags pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: gtso bo de ni ma byas pa dang thams cad du song ba dang / mi gsal ba yin pas byang ba dang dpag tu yod pa dang gsal bar de dag ma yin par khyed nyid la grags pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: But it is renowned that it is not those. You yourself accept that the primal substance is not a product, is all-pervading, and is unmanifest.

original: gsal bar byed pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also untenable that it is manifest.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gis gsal byed gang dag 'dod //
analyzed: gang gis gsal byed gang dag 'dod //
translated: What is the manifest? What is the manifester?

original: de dag de gsal byed mi 'dod //
analyzed: de dag de gsal byed mi 'dod //
translated: But they are not accepted as the manifestor of that.

original: rgyu nyid la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: rgyu nyid la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: Because of being the cause, etc.,

original: rgyu spun la sogs zho'i min bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu spun la sogs zho'i min bzhin //
translated: like the cause, the thread, etc., of curd.

original: zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa gang gis gsal byed sa la sogs pa rkyen gang dag yin par 'dod pa de dag ni gsal bar byed pa yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa gang gis gsal byed sa la sogs pa rkyen gang dag yin par 'dod pa de dag ni gsal bar byed pa yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: The cause, etc., of the sprout, etc., are not accepted as the manifestor of the sprout, etc., because of being the cause, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyu nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis te /
translated: Because of being the cause, etc.,

original: rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes bya nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes bya nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of being the cause, because of being an entity, and because of being an object of knowledge.

original: dpe ji lta bu zhe na ;üîΩrgyu spun la sogs pa zho'i gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dpe ji lta bu zhe na ; rgyu spun la sogs pa zho'i gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa bzhin te /
translated: What is the example?üîΩLike the cause, the thread, etc., of curd, which is not the manifestor.

original: dper na 'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba'i gsal bar byed pa snam bu la sogs pa mngon par sgrub pa'i rgyu spun dang / tshig pa dang thags zangs dang 'ul bu la sogs pa dag ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba'i gsal bar byed pa snam bu la sogs pa mngon par sgrub pa'i rgyu spun dang / tshig pa dang thags zangs dang 'ul bu la sogs pa dag ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the cause of the production of curd from milk is not the thread, etc., which are the cause of the production of cloth, etc.

original: gal te 'di snyam du rgyu spun la sogs pa dag la yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis na zho la sogs pa'i dngos po dag mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod de /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du rgyu spun la sogs pa dag la yang rnam grangs gzhan gyis na zho la sogs pa'i dngos po dag mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod de /
translated: But if you think that even in the case of the causes such as the seed, the capacity to manifest the things such as the curd exists by way of another alternative,

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?üîΩBecause when the causes such as the seed are destroyed by the destruction of the eon, and then when the eon is reformed by the formation of the eon, the things such as the curd are manifested by other conditions,

original: rgyu spun la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag 'jig pa'i bskal pas zhig nas yang phyir chags pa'i bskal pas phyir chags pa'i tshe na rkyen gzhan dag gis mngon par gsal bar byed pas zho la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan dag gis mngon par gsal bar
analyzed: rgyu spun la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag 'jig pa'i bskal pas zhig nas yang phyir chags pa'i bskal pas phyir chags pa'i tshe na rkyen gzhan dag gis mngon par gsal bar byed pas zho la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan dag gis mngon par gsal bar
translated: and there is a time when the things such as the curd are manifested by other causes.

original: byed par 'gyur ba'i dus de lta bu yang yod pas dbu ma pa'i dpe med par sems na de'i phyir @103a * //
analyzed: byed par 'gyur ba'i dus de lta bu yang yod pas dbu ma pa'i dpe med par sems na de'i phyir @103a * //
translated: If you think that the Madhyamaka example does not exist, thenüîΩit is said:

original: bshad pa // gal te rgyu spun la sogs pa la'ang //
analyzed: bshad pa // gal te rgyu spun la sogs pa la'ang //
translated: If you think that the causes such as the seed

original: de'i nus yod phyir dper med na //
analyzed: de'i nus yod phyir dper med na //
translated: have the capacity for that, and the example does not exist,

original: de min rgyu spun la sogs dngos //üîΩde dag de gsal byed min phyir //
analyzed: de min rgyu spun la sogs dngos // de dag de gsal byed min phyir //
translated: then the things such as the seed are not

original: zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni //
translated: the manifestor of that, because they are not that.

original: gal te rgyu spun la sogs pa dag rnam grangs gzhan gyis zho la sogs pa'i gsal bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba yod du zin na yang rgyu spun la sogs pas rgyu spun la sogs pa dngos kyi ngo bo nyid de dag gis zho zhes bya ba
analyzed: gal te rgyu spun la sogs pa dag rnam grangs gzhan gyis zho la sogs pa'i gsal bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba yod du zin na yang rgyu spun la sogs pas rgyu spun la sogs pa dngos kyi ngo bo nyid de dag gis zho zhes bya ba
translated: If the causes such as thread were to become the clarifiers of the manifestations such as cloth through another enumeration, then the causes such as thread would be the entity of the causes such as thread.üîΩ

original: la sogs pa'i 'bras bu de gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i 'bras bu de gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If causes such as threads were to produce the manifestation of curd and so on by another alternative, then the causes such as threads would not produce the effect called curd and so on, since the causes such as threads are the substantial entities of the causes such as threads.

original: ji ltar yang mi srid pa'i phyir dang gang du yang ma mthong bas de'i phyir kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yang mi srid pa'i phyir dang gang du yang ma mthong bas de'i phyir kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this is impossible and since it is not seen anywhere, therefore my example does not fail.

original: grangs can dag las kha cig sa la sogs pa rnam par phye ba dang / sa bon gyi mtshan nyid rnam par ma phye ba'i byed rgyu dag las 'bras bu skye bar sems pa de dag ni bdag dang gzhan las skye bar smra la /
analyzed: grangs can dag las kha cig sa la sogs pa rnam par phye ba dang / sa bon gyi mtshan nyid rnam par ma phye ba'i byed rgyu dag las 'bras bu skye bar sems pa de dag ni bdag dang gzhan las skye bar smra la /
translated: Some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas think that effects arise from causal conditions such as threads that are distinguished as earth and so on but are not distinguished as the characteristics of seeds. They say that effects arise from self and other.

original: gcer bu pa dag kyang gser dang me la sogs pa las gser gyi sor gdub bdag dang gzhan las skye bar sems pa de dag nyid kyang 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang med par smra ste /
analyzed: gcer bu pa dag kyang gser dang me la sogs pa las gser gyi sor gdub bdag dang gzhan las skye bar sems pa de dag nyid kyang 'bras bu snga na yod pa dang med par smra ste /
translated: The naked ascetics also think that a gold ring arises from gold, fire, and so on, and that it arises from itself and another.üîΩThey also say that the effect exists prior to the cause, and that it does not exist prior to the cause.

original: 'di ltar sor gdub ces bya ba'i 'bras bu de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir ni snga na yod pa yin la rang gi bdag nyid ma thob pa'i phyir ni snga na med pa yin par smra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sor gdub ces bya ba'i 'bras bu de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir ni snga na yod pa yin la rang gi bdag nyid ma thob pa'i phyir ni snga na med pa yin par smra'o //
translated: Thus they say that the effect called a ring exists prior to the cause because it will arise immediately, and that it does not exist prior to the cause because it has not yet obtained its own nature.

original: de dag gi phyir bshad pa //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir bshad pa //
translated: To explain this, the treatise states:üîΩArising from self and other,

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba dang // bdag nyid yod dang med mi 'dod //üîΩgnyi gar smra ba yod min te //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba dang // bdag nyid yod dang med mi 'dod // gnyi gar smra ba yod min te //
translated: Existence and nonexistence of self are not accepted.üîΩThe assertion of both

original: rigs pas gong du bstan phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas gong du bstan phyir ro //
translated: Is untenable because it has been taught above through reasoning.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyi gar smra ba dag kyang 'gal ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyi gar smra ba dag kyang 'gal ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir mi 'thad de /
translated: The assertion of both is untenable because it has the fault of contradiction.

original: gal te bdag las na ni ji ltar gzhan las yin /
analyzed: gal te bdag las na ni ji ltar gzhan las yin /
translated: If it arises from itself, how could it arise from another?

original: 'on te gzhan las na ni 'o na de lta na bdag las zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan las na ni 'o na de lta na bdag las zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal lo //
translated: But if it arises from another, then in that case, this contradicts the statement ‚Äúfrom self.‚Äù

original: so sor yang bdag las dang gzhan las bya ba'i cha ji ltar sngar bkag pa de kho na bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor yang bdag las dang gzhan las bya ba'i cha ji ltar sngar bkag pa de kho na bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: And individually, the part of the action that arises from self and the part that arises from another should be stated just as they were previously refuted.

original: yang gzhan yang //üîΩkun rdzob tu yang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang // kun rdzob tu yang 'bras bu ni //
translated: Moreover:üîΩEven conventionally, we do not assert

original: rkyen rnams kyis ni gsal mi 'dod //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyis ni gsal mi 'dod //
translated: that effects are clearly manifest from conditions.

original: de zhig bar du rjes sgrub phyir //
analyzed: de zhig bar du rjes sgrub phyir //
translated: Because it is established that they are related

original: sa la sogs pas bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: sa la sogs pas bum pa bzhin //
translated: like a pot and its clay and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la tshad ma thams cad don dam @103b pa ba yin pa las tshad ma 'di ni kun rdzob tu yang gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i mngon par gsal ba 'gog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la tshad ma thams cad don dam @103b pa ba yin pa las tshad ma 'di ni kun rdzob tu yang gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i mngon par gsal ba 'gog par byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, although all valid knowledges are ultimate, this valid knowledge refutes the manifest that is imputed by others even conventionally.

original: 'jim pa la sogs pa ni bum pa zhig pa'i mthar thug gi bar du rjes su 'brel par sgrub pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'jim pa la sogs pa ni bum pa zhig pa'i mthar thug gi bar du rjes su 'brel par sgrub pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Because it is established that clay and so on are related until the final disintegration of the pot.

original: de'i phyir de de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan dag gi mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan dag gi mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin pa mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is illogical that it is the manifestor of other effects in that way.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rjes su gtan du 'brel par sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rjes su gtan du 'brel par sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Manifestation is not established as a permanent connection with a thing,

original: mar me bum pa'i rjes su gtan du sgrub pa ma yin pa bzhin la 'bras bu ni zhig pa'i mthar thug gi bar du yang yan lag dang yan lag can gyi dngos pos rtag par dngos po'i rjes su 'brel par sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par gsal
analyzed: mar me bum pa'i rjes su gtan du sgrub pa ma yin pa bzhin la 'bras bu ni zhig pa'i mthar thug gi bar du yang yan lag dang yan lag can gyi dngos pos rtag par dngos po'i rjes su 'brel par sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par gsal
translated: like a lamp is not established as a permanent connection with a pot. But an effect is established as a permanent connection with a thing by the state of being an integral part of it until the end of its disintegration.

original: ba dang 'bras bu la khyad par de yod do //
analyzed: ba dang 'bras bu la khyad par de yod do //
translated: Therefore, there is this difference between manifestation and an effect.

original: de ltar na dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga las kyang skye ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga las kyang skye ba med do //
translated: Thus things do not arise from self, from another, or from both.

original: 'dir 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: Here the LokƒÅyatas say:

original: dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las skye ba med pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las skye ba med pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that things do not arise from self, from another, or from both.
