original: 'on kyang nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos par ngo bo nyid kho na las skye bar dam 'cha' ste /üîΩgsal ba med pas byas pa'i dngos po sna tshogs mngon par 'grub pa snang ba'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: 'on kyang nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos par ngo bo nyid kho na las skye bar dam 'cha' ste / gsal ba med pas byas pa'i dngos po sna tshogs mngon par 'grub pa snang ba'i phyir dper na /
translated: But they assert that things that are internal sources arise from their own intrinsic reality alone, without depending on causes and conditions.üîΩBecause they assert that various things that are created by consciousness exist, they say, for example, that a lotus with a fresh, slightly yellow and red colored stamen, a beautiful pericarp, soft leaves, and a rough stem,

original: padma ze ba kha dog gsar pa yid tsam ser zhing dmar ba dri zhim po dang / ze'u 'bru mdzes pa dang / lo ma 'jam pa dang / sdong bu rtsub pa dang ldan pa dag dang // rma bya mjug sgo'i tshogs zla gam sna tshogs gsal ba mang po dang /
analyzed: padma ze ba kha dog gsar pa yid tsam ser zhing dmar ba dri zhim po dang / ze'u 'bru mdzes pa dang / lo ma 'jam pa dang / sdong bu rtsub pa dang ldan pa dag dang // rma bya mjug sgo'i tshogs zla gam sna tshogs gsal ba mang po dang /
translated: a peacock with a tail feather that is a collection of various half-moons,

original: lus kyi sgro gshog sngo zhing 'tsher bag can dang ldan pa dag dang / tsher ma rtse mo ma bzhogs par rno zhing rtsub pa dang ldan pa dag bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi sgro gshog sngo zhing 'tsher bag can dang ldan pa dag dang / tsher ma rtse mo ma bzhogs par rno zhing rtsub pa dang ldan pa dag bzhin no zhe na /
translated: and a thorn that is sharp and rough without its tip being broken exist without being created by consciousness.

original: de dag gi phyir 'di skad bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir 'di skad bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response to that, this is said:

original: mig ni kun rdzob nyid du yang //
analyzed: mig ni kun rdzob nyid du yang //
translated: Even conventionally, the eye

original: glo bur skye bar mi 'dod de //
analyzed: glo bur skye bar mi 'dod de //
translated: One should not maintain that it is produced adventitiously,

original: spyi dang khyad par ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is endowed with a universal and a particular,

original: de ni dper na bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: de ni dper na bum pa bzhin //
translated: like a pot, for example.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'jig rten na nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po gang la rgyu mi snang ba de ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'jig rten na nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po gang la rgyu mi snang ba de ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: In this way, in the world, there is nothing whatsoever that is not seen to have a cause, whether it is an internal or external thing.

original: @104a * // re zhig padma la sogs pa yang chu dang rdzas dang sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu dag dang ldan no //
analyzed: @104a * // re zhig padma la sogs pa yang chu dang rdzas dang sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu dag dang ldan no //
translated: For example, even a lotus, etc., is endowed with causes such as water, earth, seeds, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten ni sems kyis bris so zhes brjod pas rma bya la sogs pa yang sems pas mngon par 'dus byas pas sna tshogs su bkra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten ni sems kyis bris so zhes brjod pas rma bya la sogs pa yang sems pas mngon par 'dus byas pas sna tshogs su bkra'o //
translated: In the same way, since it is said that the world is written by the mind, even peacocks, etc., are variegated by the mind‚Äôs creative activity.

original: cher ma la sogs pa rtsub pa dang me tog la sogs pa 'jam pa yang sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang nyid las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cher ma la sogs pa rtsub pa dang me tog la sogs pa 'jam pa yang sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang nyid las 'gyur ro //
translated: Even the roughness of bark, etc., and the smoothness of flowers, etc., are due to the power of the karma of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du mig kyang khu chu dang khrag dang mer mer po la sogs pa dang / 'byung ba chen po dag gi rgyu las byung ba nyid yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul nyid du yang glo bur du skye bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig kyang khu chu dang khrag dang mer mer po la sogs pa dang / 'byung ba chen po dag gi rgyu las byung ba nyid yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul nyid du yang glo bur du skye bar mi 'dod de /
translated: So too, the eye is not asserted to arise adventitiously even in the manner of conventional truth because it arises from the cause of semen, blood, and so on and the great elements.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir de ni dper na bum pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir de ni dper na bum pa bzhin te /
translated: Because it possesses the general characteristics of impermanence and so on and because it possesses the specific characteristics of being the nature of the eye and so on that possess form derived from the elements, it is like a pot.

original: bum pa yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa dang / gsus pa che ba dang / kha yangs pa dang / dbyibs zlum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir kun rdzob nyid du yang glo bur du skye bar mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa dang / gsus pa che ba dang / kha yangs pa dang / dbyibs zlum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir kun rdzob nyid du yang glo bur du skye bar mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: Because a pot possesses the general characteristics of impermanence and so on and because it possesses the specific characteristics of being large bellied, having a wide mouth, being round in shape, and so on, it is not asserted to arise adventitiously even in the manner of conventional truth.

original: gzhan yang / 'bras bu yin phyir rim skye'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'bras bu yin phyir rim skye'i phyir //
translated: Because it is a result, because it arises in sequence,

original: 'jig pa'i phyir dang yongs 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i phyir dang yongs 'gyur phyir //
translated: because it perishes, because it transforms,

original: rgyu rkyen nges pa'i phyir dang ni //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen nges pa'i phyir dang ni //
translated: because of the certainty of causes and conditions,

original: skye ba'i phyir yang shes par bya //
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir yang shes par bya //
translated: and because of arising, it is like a pot.

original: zhes bya ba ni bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the sentence ‚Äúbecause it is like a pot.‚Äù

original: de la 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúbecause it is a result‚Äù means it is a result.

original: rim skye zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i phyir dus su skye ba'o //
analyzed: rim skye zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i phyir dus su skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising in sequence‚Äù means arising at the proper time because of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni chud za ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni chud za ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPerishing‚Äù means being destroyed.

original: yongs 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yongs 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTransforming‚Äù means changing into something else.

original: rgyu rkyen nges pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen nges pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe certainty of causes and conditions‚Äù means

original: rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges par snang ba las 'bras bu nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges par snang ba las 'bras bu nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: the certainty of the result arising from the appearance of the certainty of individual causes and conditions.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par grub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù means manifest establishment.

original: dngos po de dag ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis bum pa bzhin du kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul nyid du @104b yang rgyu med pa las glo bur du skye ba ma yin par nges so //
analyzed: dngos po de dag ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis bum pa bzhin du kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul nyid du @104b yang rgyu med pa las glo bur du skye ba ma yin par nges so //
translated: Because those things are effects, etc., by these reasons, like a pot, it is certain that they are not suddenly produced without a cause, even in the manner of conventional truth.

original: 'dir med par smra ba dag dbu ma pa la dpe'i skyon 'dogs pa'i rgyu thabs kyis 'jig rten snga ma dgag par yang sems na /
analyzed: 'dir med par smra ba dag dbu ma pa la dpe'i skyon 'dogs pa'i rgyu thabs kyis 'jig rten snga ma dgag par yang sems na /
translated: Here, the nihilists, by the method of imputing a fault of example to the Madhyamikas, think to refute the previous world.

original: phyir ldog par byed de /
analyzed: phyir ldog par byed de /
translated: But they turn away,

original: khyed dbu ma pa ni 'jim gong dang glebs pa dang bskor ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis bum pa mngon par 'grub par 'dod ces grags pas de dpe nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pa ni 'jim gong dang glebs pa dang bskor ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis bum pa mngon par 'grub par 'dod ces grags pas de dpe nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: because it is well known that you Madhyamikas assert that the pot is manifestly established by the process of lump of clay, spinning of the wheel, etc., so you use that as an example.

original: kho bo cag ni 'jim gong ni 'jim gong gi rang bzhin nyid du 'gags pas yang skye ba med la de bzhin du glebs pa dang / bskor ba la sogs pa yang de dag gi rang bzhin nyid du 'gags pas yang skye ba med pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa ni rgyu med pa kho na las 'byung bar 'dod pas de'i phyir khyed kyi dpe med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'jim gong ni 'jim gong gi rang bzhin nyid du 'gags pas yang skye ba med la de bzhin du glebs pa dang / bskor ba la sogs pa yang de dag gi rang bzhin nyid du 'gags pas yang skye ba med pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa ni rgyu med pa kho na las 'byung bar 'dod pas de'i phyir khyed kyi dpe med do //
translated: We do not assert that a clay lump arises again, because it has ceased as the intrinsic reality of a clay lump. Likewise, a wheel, a circle, and so on do not arise again, because they have ceased as the intrinsic reality of a wheel, a circle, and so on. Therefore, a pot and so on arise only without a cause. Therefore your example does not exist.

original: yang na 'jim gong zhes bya ba de tsee tra'am mee tra zhig yin na yang tshe rabs gzhan du 'gags pas yang skye ba med de zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'jim gong zhes bya ba de tsee tra'am mee tra zhig yin na yang tshe rabs gzhan du 'gags pas yang skye ba med de zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, if that so-called clay lump is a cetrƒ´ or maitrika, it does not arise again in another life because it has ceased, because it has disintegrated.üîΩOr, like a pot, it does not exist because it is a result.

original: yang na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes med par smra ba dag gis 'jig rten snga ma 'gags pa'i phyir smras pa /üîΩde la 'dir slob dpon gyis bshad pa //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes med par smra ba dag gis 'jig rten snga ma 'gags pa'i phyir smras pa / de la 'dir slob dpon gyis bshad pa //
translated: The master here explains that to the nihilists who say that the previous world ceases.

original: gal te 'jim gong tshe gzhan la //
analyzed: gal te 'jim gong tshe gzhan la //
translated: If a clay lump in another life

original: 'gags pa mi skye zhig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gags pa mi skye zhig pa'i phyir //
translated: does not arise because it has ceased,

original: 'bras bu yin phyir dper na ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin phyir dper na ni //
translated: Because it is the effect, it is like a pot.

original: bum pa bzhin du 'dod ce na //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin du 'dod ce na //
translated: If you assert that,

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa nyid yin no //
translated: this is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de'i lan ni /
analyzed: de'i lan ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: ji ltar bum pa bum pa yi //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa bum pa yi //
translated: Just as a pot, by the nature of a pot,

original: ngo bo nyid 'gags mi skye ba //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'gags mi skye ba //
translated: ceases but does not arise,

original: de ltar 'jim gong 'dod na ni ;üîΩ/'dod pa nyid du sgrub pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar 'jim gong 'dod na ni ; /'dod pa nyid du sgrub pa yin //
translated: if you assert that a lump of clay

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: is just like that, you are proving what is already established.

original: ji ltar kho bo bum pa bum pa'i ngo bo nyid gang gis 'gags par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid de nyid kyis mi skye bar 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar kho bo bum pa bum pa'i ngo bo nyid gang gis 'gags par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid de nyid kyis mi skye bar 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Just as we assert that a pot, by the nature of a pot, ceases but does not arise by the nature of a pot,üîΩnevertheless we do assert that another continuum that is a different nature, such as shards and dust, arises from it.

original: 'on kyang de las gyo mo dang gyo du ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyun gzhan skya ba yod pa kho nar 'dod pa de ltar khyod kyang 'jim gong zhes bya ba 'jim pa'i gong bu nyid la bya yang rung tsee tra'am mee tra la yang
analyzed: 'on kyang de las gyo mo dang gyo du ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyun gzhan skya ba yod pa kho nar 'dod pa de ltar khyod kyang 'jim gong zhes bya ba 'jim pa'i gong bu nyid la bya yang rung tsee tra'am mee tra la yang
translated: Just as that is so, if you assert that a lump of clay, which is a lump of clay, or a caitya, or Maitreya,üîΩceases but does not arise by the nature of a lump of clay, or a caitya, or Maitreya,

original: bya yang rung ste /
analyzed: bya yang rung ste /
translated: you are proving what is already established.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid gang gis 'gags par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis kyang mi skye bar 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid gang gis 'gags par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis kyang mi skye bar 'dod mod kyi /
translated: If you assert that a thing does not arise by the intrinsic reality through which it has ceased,

original: 'on kyang de las bum pa la sogs @105a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de las bum pa la sogs @105a * //
translated: then it is certainly the case that a continuum of things such as a vase arises from that.

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyun gzhan skye ba yod pa kho nar 'dod na ni kun rdzob tu yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyun gzhan skye ba yod pa kho nar 'dod na ni kun rdzob tu yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
translated: If you assert that, then you are proving what is established for us, even in terms of the conventional.

original: don dam par yang rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med pa'i phyir kho bo'i 'dod pa nyid sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par yang rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med pa'i phyir kho bo'i 'dod pa nyid sgrub pa yin no //
translated: And you are proving what we accept, because in all ways arising does not exist even in terms of the ultimate.

original: 'on te 'gags pa rgyu yin na ;
analyzed: 'on te 'gags pa rgyu yin na ;
translated: But if you assert that a thing that has ceased is a cause,

original: / des na gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid //
analyzed: / des na gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid //
translated: then your reason is contradictory.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is the response.

original: 'on te khyod 'di snyam du 'jim gong la sogs pa dgag par gyur ba de dag ni phyis gzhan dag gi rgyur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te khyod 'di snyam du 'jim gong la sogs pa dgag par gyur ba de dag ni phyis gzhan dag gi rgyur mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if you think that those things such as a lump of clay that have ceased do not later become the cause of others,

original: 'di ltar gang 'gags pa de ni rgyun chad pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang 'gags pa de ni rgyun chad pa nyid de /
translated: then that which has ceased is just severed.

original: 'gags pa ni rab tu zhig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gang skye ba de ni ngo bo nyid kho na las skye ste /
analyzed: 'gags pa ni rab tu zhig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gang skye ba de ni ngo bo nyid kho na las skye ste /
translated: because cessation has the characteristic of complete disintegration.üîΩIf you think that whatever arises arises from its own intrinsic reality alone,

original: 'gags pa gang la yang mi ltos pa yin par sems na des na zhig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba khyod kyi gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'gags pa gang la yang mi ltos pa yin par sems na des na zhig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba khyod kyi gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid de /
translated: and that it does not depend on cessation, then your reason ‚Äúbecause of disintegration‚Äù is contradictory,

original: sa bon 'gags pa las myu gu la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon 'gags pa las myu gu la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen that a sprout arises from a seed that has ceased.

original: gal te sa bon ma 'gags par yang myu gu skye bar gyur na ni sbyang la sogs pa la 'dug pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sa bon ma 'gags par yang myu gu skye bar gyur na ni sbyang la sogs pa la 'dug pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a sprout arose from a seed that had not ceased, then it would follow that a sprout would arise from a seed that is stored in a granary.üîΩTherefore, since it is inferred that it disintegrates, an effect arises from a seed that has ceased.

original: de'i phyir zhig pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir 'jim gong la sogs pa 'gags par gyur pa dag kyang gnas skabs phyi ma gzhan dag gi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhig pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir 'jim gong la sogs pa 'gags par gyur pa dag kyang gnas skabs phyi ma gzhan dag gi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, even though a seed, etc., has ceased, it becomes the cause of subsequent states.

original: de las skye ba kho nar bstan par gyur pas chos can gyi ngo bo nyid log par bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de las skye ba kho nar bstan par gyur pas chos can gyi ngo bo nyid log par bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Because it is taught that it arises from that, the meaning of the reason is contradictory because it proves the essential nature of the subject is reversed.

original: gal te rgyun nyid ma nyams na //
analyzed: gal te rgyun nyid ma nyams na //
translated: If the continuum itself is not destroyed,

original: des na 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: then your reason would be mistaken.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te sa bon la sogs pa rgyun nyid kyis nges par gnas pa ma nyams pa myu gu dang sdong bu dang / sdu gu dang yal ga dang 'dab ma dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du skye ba de ltar 'dod na ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te sa bon la sogs pa rgyun nyid kyis nges par gnas pa ma nyams pa myu gu dang sdong bu dang / sdu gu dang yal ga dang 'dab ma dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du skye ba de ltar 'dod na ;
translated: If you assert that a seed and so on arises in the form of a sprout, a stem, a flower, a branch, a leaf, and so on, by the continuum itself, without being destroyed,

original: des na khyod kyi gtan tshigs zhig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na khyod kyi gtan tshigs zhig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then your reason would be mistaken because it would be destroyed.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos 'brel pa'i rgyun ni rgyun ces bya'i /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos 'brel pa'i rgyun ni rgyun ces bya'i /
translated: A continuum is called a continuum because it is connected by the state of being a cause and effect.

original: rgyu chad pa la yang rgyun mi 'byung la rgyun ma nyams pa la yang rgyun mi 'byung bas @105b 'bras bu mi srid pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu chad pa la yang rgyun mi 'byung la rgyun ma nyams pa la yang rgyun mi 'byung bas @105b 'bras bu mi srid pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, if the cause is severed, the continuum would not occur, and if the continuum is not severed, the continuum would not occur. Therefore, it is a mistake to say that the effect is impossible.

original: 'jig rten snga ma sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni 'di yin te /üîΩmngal gnas sngon rol blo la ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten snga ma sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni 'di yin te / mngal gnas sngon rol blo la ni //
translated: This is the valid cognition that establishes the previous world.üîΩThe cognition that exists prior to

original: mdun rol kho nar 'gags blo yod //
analyzed: mdun rol kho nar 'gags blo yod //
translated: the embryo has a prior cognition that has ceased.

original: shes bya gzhan gyis de gzhan phyir //
analyzed: shes bya gzhan gyis de gzhan phyir //
translated: Because it is different from other objects of cognition,

original: yang na blo phyir de'i 'og bzhin //
analyzed: yang na blo phyir de'i 'og bzhin //
translated: or because it is a cognition, it is like the subsequent.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo gang yin pa de la ni mdun rol kho nar 'gags pa'i blo sngon du song ba yod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo gang yin pa de la ni mdun rol kho nar 'gags pa'i blo sngon du song ba yod de /
translated: The cognition that exists prior to the embryo has a prior cognition that has ceased.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes bya gzhan gyis de gzhan yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩgang gi phyir blo de ni shes bya rtogs pa yin na mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo de la ni shes bya med de /
analyzed: shes bya gzhan gyis de gzhan yin pa'i phyir te / gang gi phyir blo de ni shes bya rtogs pa yin na mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo de la ni shes bya med de /
translated: Because it is different from other objects of cognition.

original: shes bya ni /
analyzed: shes bya ni /
translated: If that cognition is the realization of an object of cognition, then that cognition that exists prior to the embryo does not have an object of cognition.üîΩWhy is that?

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po dag las mngon par 'grub pa yin na /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po dag las mngon par 'grub pa yin na /
translated: The mind is established from the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties.

original: de la de'i tshe dbang po de dag med pa'i phyir de la shes bya med do //
analyzed: de la de'i tshe dbang po de dag med pa'i phyir de la shes bya med do //
translated: At that time, since those faculties do not exist, the object of knowledge does not exist.

original: blo de ni 'jig rten snga ma gzhan gyi shes bya tha dad pa gzhan la dmigs pas blo tha dad pa gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags par rigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: blo de ni 'jig rten snga ma gzhan gyi shes bya tha dad pa gzhan la dmigs pas blo tha dad pa gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags par rigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: That mind is called another mind that observes another object of knowledge in another previous world. It is reasonable to call it another mind because it is another mind that is the object of knowledge of another.

original: de ltar shes bya gzhan gyi blo de gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes bya gzhan gyi blo de gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, it is another mind because it is another mind that is the object of knowledge of another.

original: yang na blo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na blo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or it is a mind because

original: gang dang gang blo yin pa de dang de la ni mdun rol kho nar 'gags pa'i blo snga ma yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang blo yin pa de dang de la ni mdun rol kho nar 'gags pa'i blo snga ma yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: whatever is a mind is a mind that has ceased in the past.

original: dper na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: For example, what is it like?

original: de'i 'og bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og bzhin te /
translated: It is like the following.

original: btsas pa'i 'og rol gyi dus kyi blo la yul du ma la 'jug pa dang / mdun rol kho nar 'gags pa'i blo snga ma gzhan yod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: btsas pa'i 'og rol gyi dus kyi blo la yul du ma la 'jug pa dang / mdun rol kho nar 'gags pa'i blo snga ma gzhan yod pa bzhin te /
translated: The mind that exists at the time after birth is a mind that has another mind that has ceased in the past.

original: slob dpon dpa' bos /
analyzed: slob dpon dpa' bos /
translated: Master ƒÄrya≈õ≈´ra says:

original: blo ni shes bya rtogs pa yin par gsungs //
analyzed: blo ni shes bya rtogs pa yin par gsungs //
translated: It is said that mind is the realization of objects of knowledge.

original: des na mngal gnas sngon rol blo yul yod //
analyzed: des na mngal gnas sngon rol blo yul yod //
translated: Therefore, prior to the womb, mind has objects.

original: de 'di ma yin mig la sogs med phyir //
analyzed: de 'di ma yin mig la sogs med phyir //
translated: It is not this, because eyes and so on do not exist.

original: gang gi yin te 'jig rten snga mar grub //
analyzed: gang gi yin te 'jig rten snga mar grub //
translated: Whose is it? It is established in the previous world.

original: ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is just as explained.

original: gal te 'di snyam du blo ni gcig kho nar zad de /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du blo ni gcig kho nar zad de /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúMind is only one.

original: blo yin pa'i phyir ma shi ba'i bar du nges par gnas pa yin pas de'i phyir dpe med par sems na bshad pa /
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir ma shi ba'i bar du nges par gnas pa yin pas de'i phyir dpe med par sems na bshad pa /
translated: Because it is mind, it definitely endures until death. Therefore, it is not an example,‚Äù then it is explained:üîΩThe mind of sound and the mind of form

original: tsee tra la ni sbra blo dang // gzugs blo skye ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: tsee tra la ni sbra blo dang // gzugs blo skye ba gang yin pa //
translated: that arise in the Caitra continuum

original: de gnyis mi gcig yul gzhan phyir //
analyzed: de gnyis mi gcig yul gzhan phyir //
translated: are not the same because they have different objects.

original: dper na rgyud gzhan dag gi bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni tsee tra'i rgyud la sgra'i blo dang gzugs kyi bro skye ba gang yin pa @106a * //
analyzed: dper na rgyud gzhan dag gi bzhin // zhes bya ba ni tsee tra'i rgyud la sgra'i blo dang gzugs kyi bro skye ba gang yin pa @106a * //
translated: For example, it is like the mind of another continuum.

original: de dag ni gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind of sound and the mind of form that arise in the Caitra continuum are not the same.

original: shes bya'i yul tha dad pa'i phyir mee tra zhes bya ba'i rgyud gzhan gyi blo bzhin no //üîΩde'i phyir pha rol phyir yang ni //üîΩdpe med par ni mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: shes bya'i yul tha dad pa'i phyir mee tra zhes bya ba'i rgyud gzhan gyi blo bzhin no // de'i phyir pha rol phyir yang ni // dpe med par ni mi 'gyur te //
translated: because the objects of cognition are different, like the cognition of another continuum.

original: blo phyir de yang gcig nyid min //
analyzed: blo phyir de yang gcig nyid min //
translated: Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs reason ‚Äúbecause it is a cognition‚Äù does not prove that the cognition is a single unit,

original: gzhan blos 'khrul par 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan blos 'khrul par 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: because it is a cognition.üîΩIt is not a single unit, because it is a cognition, like the cognition of another continuum.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i gtan tshigs blo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba des blo de yang gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i gtan tshigs blo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba des blo de yang gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs reason ‚Äúbecause it is a cognition‚Äù does not prove that the cognition is a single unit,

original: gzhan gyi blos gtan tshigs 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi blos gtan tshigs 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the reason would be erroneous due to the cognition of another continuum.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: blo yin pa'i phyir des na ci rgyud gzhan gyi blo bzhin du tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir des na ci rgyud gzhan gyi blo bzhin du tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ram /
translated: Because it is a cognition, is it different, like the cognition of another continuum?

original: 'on te rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or is it a single unit, like the cognition of form and so on that belongs to a single continuum? It is uncertain.

original: de ltar re zhig 'jig rten snga ma gzhan yod pa nyid du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'jig rten snga ma gzhan yod pa nyid du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, first the existence of a previous world is established.

original: da ni 'jig rten phyi ma gzhan yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi bsam pas phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa byas nas sun dbyung bar bya ste /üîΩde la / gal te med smra byis pa yi //
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten phyi ma gzhan yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi bsam pas phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa byas nas sun dbyung bar bya ste / de la / gal te med smra byis pa yi //
translated: Now, in order to prove that there is another world, the opponent‚Äôs position is stated and refuted by way of his thoughts.

original: 'chi 'pho'i sems la mtshams sbyor med //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho'i sems la mtshams sbyor med //
translated: If you say that the mind of death of a child who advocates nonexistence is not a link,

original: 'chi 'pho'i sems phyir dgra bcom gyi //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho'i sems phyir dgra bcom gyi //
translated: then you must prove that the mind of death of an arhat is not a link,

original: tha ma'i sems bzhin sgrub byed na //
analyzed: tha ma'i sems bzhin sgrub byed na //
translated: like the final mind of an arhat.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de'i lan ni /
analyzed: de'i lan ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: gtan tshigs ma nges nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges nyid 'gyur te //
translated: The reason is not established,

original: 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems kyis so //
translated: because of the mind of death in the past.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩpha rol po'i gtan tshigs 'chi 'pho'i sems ni sems yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / pha rol po'i gtan tshigs 'chi 'pho'i sems ni sems yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur te ;
translated: And so on.üîΩThe reason of the opponent, ‚Äúbecause it is a mind,‚Äù is not established.

original: ci re zhig 'chi 'pho'i sems yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci re zhig 'chi 'pho'i sems yin pa'i phyir /
translated: What is it? If it is because of the mind of death,

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma bzhin du nyid mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur ram 'on te 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems bzhin du nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma bzhin du nyid mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur ram 'on te 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems bzhin du nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: It is uncertain whether it links with a subsequent mind, like the final mind of an arhat, or whether it does not link with a subsequent mind, like the death mind of an ordinary being.

original: 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems yod par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems yod par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that the death mind of the past exists?üîΩBecause they remember past lives and so on,

original: tshe rabs dran la sogs yod dang // tshul smras phyir na de yang yod //üîΩces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshe rabs dran la sogs yod dang // tshul smras phyir na de yang yod // ces bya ba smras te /
translated: and because they speak of past lives.üîΩThose who remember past lives in this world remember many past lives.

original: 'jig rten 'di na tshe rabs dran pa gang dag gis tshe rabs snga ma rnam pa du ma dran par byed ma dag dang / kha cig pha ma'i spyod yul tha dad @106b pa dag dang mi mthun pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa dag snang ba la sogs pa dag kyang yod pas de'i phyir de dag gi spyod pa de lta bu dag ni sngon goms pa nyid
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na tshe rabs dran pa gang dag gis tshe rabs snga ma rnam pa du ma dran par byed ma dag dang / kha cig pha ma'i spyod yul tha dad @106b pa dag dang mi mthun pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa dag snang ba la sogs pa dag kyang yod pas de'i phyir de dag gi spyod pa de lta bu dag ni sngon goms pa nyid
translated: Some remember the different conduct of their parents and the different moral disciplines they observed.

original: las gyur pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: las gyur pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore we should understand that such conduct is due to previous habituation.

original: yang na / 'jig rten snga ma yod pa'i tshul //
analyzed: yang na / 'jig rten snga ma yod pa'i tshul //
translated: The mode of existence of the previous world

original: mngal nas sngon rol blo la ni //
analyzed: mngal nas sngon rol blo la ni //
translated: is like the mind prior to birth

original: mdun rol kho nar 'gags pa yod //
analyzed: mdun rol kho nar 'gags pa yod //
translated: which is blocked only in the future.

original: shes bya gzhan gyis de gzhan phyir //
analyzed: shes bya gzhan gyis de gzhan phyir //
translated: Because it is different from other objects of consciousness,

original: yang na blo phyir de'i 'og bzhin //
analyzed: yang na blo phyir de'i 'og bzhin //
translated: or else, because of the mind, it is like the subsequent.

original: zhes sngar ji skad smras pa'i phyir na 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems de yang yod pa kho nar nges so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes sngar ji skad smras pa'i phyir na 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems de yang yod pa kho nar nges so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As it was previously stated, therefore, the mind of death and transmigration of the past definitely exists. This is the meaning of the conclusion.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / 'phags pa min pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'phags pa min pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems //
translated: The mind of death and transmigration of the non-ƒÅrya

original: sems gzhan bskyed pa nyid yin te //
analyzed: sems gzhan bskyed pa nyid yin te //
translated: is the generation of another mind,

original: ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is associated with ignorance,

original: sems de skyed par byed pa bzhin //
analyzed: sems de skyed par byed pa bzhin //
translated: like the generation of that mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni byis pa 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems ni sems gzhan bskyed pa nyid yin te zhes dam bca'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byis pa 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'chi 'pho'i sems ni sems gzhan bskyed pa nyid yin te zhes dam bca'o //
translated: This is the thesis: the mind of death and transmigration of the non-ƒÅrya child is the generation of another mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the reason that it is associated with ignorance.

original: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the example?

original: 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho nyid kyi sems de skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'chi 'pho nyid kyi sems de skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the mind at death in the past generates the mind at birth.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan du 'jig rten rgyud pan pa'i bsam pas phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag nas de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan du 'jig rten rgyud pan pa'i bsam pas phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag nas de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in another way, the opponent‚Äôs position is stated from the perspective of the worldly perspective, and in order to refute that, it is said:üîΩIf you do not assert that the body, sense faculties, and mind

original: gal te lus dang dbang blo dag / rang gi las kyis skyed mi 'dod //
analyzed: gal te lus dang dbang blo dag / rang gi las kyis skyed mi 'dod //
translated: are generated by their own karma,

original: zhig phyir dper na bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: zhig phyir dper na bum pa bzhin //
translated: then they would be like a pot, because they would be destroyed.

original: de phyir 'jig rten pha rol med //
analyzed: de phyir 'jig rten pha rol med //
translated: Therefore the world beyond does not exist.

original: ces bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa yin te /üîΩgal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'jig rten ni las bdag gir bya ba dang / las kyi skye gnas pa dang / las kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / las kyi bgo skal ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gis lus dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa yin te / gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'jig rten ni las bdag gir bya ba dang / las kyi skye gnas pa dang / las kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / las kyi bgo skal ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gis lus dang /
translated: This is the statement of the opponent‚Äôs position.üîΩIf you Buddhists do not assert that the world is the appropriator of karma, the birthplace of karma, the follower of karma, and the inheritor of karma, and so on, and you do not assert that the body,üîΩsense faculties, and mind are generated by their own karma,

original: dbang po dang / blo dag rang gi las kyis bskyed par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ltar kho bo cag mi 'dod de /
analyzed: dbang po dang / blo dag rang gi las kyis bskyed par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ltar kho bo cag mi 'dod de /
translated: then they would be like a pot, because they would be destroyed.

original: zhig pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhig pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Because it is destroyed, like a pot.

original: de'i lan ni /üîΩde nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
analyzed: de'i lan ni / de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
translated: The response to that is:üîΩIt is not produced by that,

original: de gzhan gyis kyang ma byas phyir //
analyzed: de gzhan gyis kyang ma byas phyir //
translated: because it is not produced by that or by another.

original: 'jig rten rang gi las skyed min //üîΩgzhan 'di ded la ci zhig gnod //
analyzed: 'jig rten rang gi las skyed min // gzhan 'di ded la ci zhig gnod //
translated: The world is not produced from its own karma.

original: ces bya ba yin te /üîΩkho bo cag gi las brtag gi las brtag pa'i skabs su don dam par las bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis @107a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te / kho bo cag gi las brtag gi las brtag pa'i skabs su don dam par las bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis @107a * //
translated: What is harmed by this other argument?

original: byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa bkag zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa bkag zin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the context of the examination of karma, we have already refuted the ultimate production of karma by itself, by another,üîΩand by both.

original: khyod kyis smras pa'i tshad ma gzhan 'di ded la ci zhig gnod /
analyzed: khyod kyis smras pa'i tshad ma gzhan 'di ded la ci zhig gnod /
translated: What is harmed by this other argument you have advanced?

original: ci ste khyod dngos po rnams las la mi ltos par skyes par smra na ni de la /
analyzed: ci ste khyod dngos po rnams las la mi ltos par skyes par smra na ni de la /
translated: But if you say that things arise without depending on karma, then:

original: las kyis skyed nyid ma yin la //
analyzed: las kyis skyed nyid ma yin la //
translated: It is not produced by karma,

original: dpe ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and there is no example.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig 'di ltar las lam ltos par skye'o zhes bya ba'i dpe brjod par bya dgos so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig 'di ltar las lam ltos par skye'o zhes bya ba'i dpe brjod par bya dgos so /
translated: You would have to cite an example of something that arises without depending on karma.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi rtsa dang lo ma dang / 'dab ma la sogs pa dag lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi rtsa dang lo ma dang / 'dab ma la sogs pa dag lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: leaves, etc.,üîΩthen we reply:

original: de'i phyir / shing la sogs pa dus skye ba //
analyzed: de'i phyir / shing la sogs pa dus skye ba //
translated: The arising of trees, etc.

original: sems can las kyi dbang gis te //üîΩsems dmyal gnas dang mtho ris na //
analyzed: sems can las kyi dbang gis te // sems dmyal gnas dang mtho ris na //
translated: is due to the power of sentient beings‚Äô karma.üîΩJust as weapons and wish-fulfilling trees

original: mtshon dang dpag bsam shing skye bzhin //
analyzed: mtshon dang dpag bsam shing skye bzhin //
translated: arise in the hells and in the higher realms.

original: zhes bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad de /
translated: This is what we explain.

original: las kyi sam bskyed pa'i dpe 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las kyi sam bskyed pa'i dpe 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no example of anything generated by karma,

original: 'jig rten las kyis ma bskyed do zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las kyis ma bskyed do zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not tenable to say that the world is not generated by karma.

original: re zhig de la 'di skad ces dri bar yang bya ste /üîΩ'byung ba rnams las blo gros ni //
analyzed: re zhig de la 'di skad ces dri bar yang bya ste / 'byung ba rnams las blo gros ni //
translated: First, you should be questioned as follows:üîΩHow can the mind, which has a different characteristic

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun ji ltar 'byung //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun ji ltar 'byung //
translated: from the elements, arise from the elements?

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi rgyu dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba yin na 'byung ba chen po sems med pa rnams las blo gros mtshan nyid shin tu mi mthun pa ji ltar 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi rgyu dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba yin na 'byung ba chen po sems med pa rnams las blo gros mtshan nyid shin tu mi mthun pa ji ltar 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, if things arise in the nature of their causes, how can the mind, which has a completely different characteristic from the mindless great elements, arise from the great elements?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind,

original: nam mkha' lhan cig tshogs pa la //üîΩtil la til mar yod pa ltar //
analyzed: nam mkha' lhan cig tshogs pa la // til la til mar yod pa ltar //
translated: and space,

original: shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: are not consciousness,

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o /
translated: just as sesame oil is not in the sesame seed.

original: 'dir pha rol po dag gis smras pa /üîΩ'byung ba sems med rnams las ni //
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag gis smras pa / 'byung ba sems med rnams las ni //
translated: Here, the opponent says:üîΩConsciousness arises from mindless

original: shes pa yod pa nyid skye ste //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid skye ste //
translated: primary elements,üîΩbecause it is produced, like the power of

original: skye can yin phyir myos mthu dang // me shel las ni me bzhin no //
analyzed: skye can yin phyir myos mthu dang // me shel las ni me bzhin no //
translated: intoxication, and fire from a magnifying glass.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po sems med pa rnams las blo shes pa yod pa nyid skye ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po sems med pa rnams las blo shes pa yod pa nyid skye ste /
translated: Consciousness arises from mindless primary elements.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is produced.

original: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the examples?

original: chang las myos pa'i mthu 'byung ba dang / me shel las mi 'byung ba dang / chu shes las chu 'byung ba dang / ba lang gi sdu dang / lug gi bal las rtsva d'ur ba 'byung ba dang / rva las smyi ma 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: chang las myos pa'i mthu 'byung ba dang / me shel las mi 'byung ba dang / chu shes las chu 'byung ba dang / ba lang gi sdu dang / lug gi bal las rtsva d'ur ba 'byung ba dang / rva las smyi ma 'byung ba dang /
translated: The power of intoxication arises from beer, fire arises from a magnifying glass, water arises from a water crystal, grass arises from cow dung, wool arises from a sheep, and a calf arises from a cow.

original: shing las thal ba 'byung ba dang / 'o ma las zho 'byung ba la sogs pa rgyu las @107b 'bras bu mtshan nyid shin tu mi mthun pa dag 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shing las thal ba 'byung ba dang / 'o ma las zho 'byung ba la sogs pa rgyu las @107b 'bras bu mtshan nyid shin tu mi mthun pa dag 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a result that is very different in its characteristics arises from a cause, such as ashes from wood, yogurt from milk, and so on.

original: de la bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bshad pa /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: myos mthu shes yod ma yin pas //
analyzed: myos mthu shes yod ma yin pas //
translated: Because the power of intoxication does not exist,

original: khyod kyi dpe ni med pa nyid //üîΩces bya ba ni gang dag khyod kyi dper bstan pa de dag thams cad la ni shes pa nyid med pas de'i phyir 'byung ba shes pa med pa nyid la shes pa yod pa nyid skye ba'i dpe snga ma dang mi 'dra ba 'ga' yang med pas khyod
analyzed: khyod kyi dpe ni med pa nyid // ces bya ba ni gang dag khyod kyi dper bstan pa de dag thams cad la ni shes pa nyid med pas de'i phyir 'byung ba shes pa med pa nyid la shes pa yod pa nyid skye ba'i dpe snga ma dang mi 'dra ba 'ga' yang med pas khyod
translated: your example does not exist.üîΩSince consciousness does not exist in any of the examples you have presented, therefore there is no example at all of the arising of the existence of consciousness from the nonexistence of consciousness.

original: kyi dpe med pa nyid do //
analyzed: kyi dpe med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore your example does not exist.

original: gzhan yang / rgyu rnams rigs mthun yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rgyu rnams rigs mthun yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover: Because the causes are of a concordant type,

original: gtan tshigs kyang ni 'gal ba nyid //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang ni 'gal ba nyid //
translated: the reason is contradictory.

original: ces bya ba ni rgyu de dag thams cad ni rigs mthun pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rgyu de dag thams cad ni rigs mthun pa nyid yin te /
translated: All those causes are of a concordant type.

original: de'i nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because they are its potential.

original: gal te nus pas stong pa'i dngos po thams cad las kyang 'bras bu mi mthun pa 'byung bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te nus pas stong pa'i dngos po thams cad las kyang 'bras bu mi mthun pa 'byung bar gyur na ni /
translated: If a dissimilar effect were to arise from all things that are empty of potential,

original: me shel las kyang chu 'byung ba dang / chu shel las kyang me 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: me shel las kyang chu 'byung ba dang / chu shel las kyang me 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: then it would be logical for water to arise from a fire crystal and fire to arise from a water crystal.üîΩIn this way, the effect of grain, which is intoxicating liquor, is ascertained individually, and therefore only that arises from it, not anything else.

original: 'di ltar chang gi 'bras bu myos pa ni so sor nges pa yin pas de las de nyid 'byung gi gzhan mi 'byung bas rigs mthun pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po las rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs skye
analyzed: 'di ltar chang gi 'bras bu myos pa ni so sor nges pa yin pas de las de nyid 'byung gi gzhan mi 'byung bas rigs mthun pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po las rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs skye
translated: Since a dissimilar effect does not arise from a thing that is similar or dissimilar, your reason is inconclusive.

original: ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don rigs mi mthun pa las mi 'byung bas 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don rigs mi mthun pa las mi 'byung bas 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of that is this: since a dissimilar effect does not arise, there is a contradiction.

original: gzhan yang / nang gi 'byung ba rnams kyang ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / nang gi 'byung ba rnams kyang ni //
translated: Moreover, the internal elements

original: shes pa yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa ma yin te //
translated: do not exist without consciousness.

original: sa la sogs pa'i dngos phyir dang // 'byung ba yin phyir de gzhan bzhin //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i dngos phyir dang // 'byung ba yin phyir de gzhan bzhin //
translated: Because they are things such as earth and because they are elements, they are like the others.

original: zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi rol gyi 'byung ba rnams ni ngo bo nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir nang gi 'byung ba rnams ni shes pa yod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi rol gyi 'byung ba rnams ni ngo bo nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir nang gi 'byung ba rnams ni shes pa yod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, since the internal and external elements are similar in nature, the internal elements have the nature of the existence of consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi 'byung ba rnams ni shes pa yod pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu'i khyad par ci yod pa yang brjod dgos so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'byung ba rnams ni shes pa yod pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu'i khyad par ci yod pa yang brjod dgos so //
translated: But the external elements do not have the nature of the existence of consciousness.

original: des na ji ltar 'byung ba rnams las shes pa yod pa nyid mi 'byung ba bzhin du shes pa yod pa nyid las kyang 'byung ba rnams mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'byung ba rnams las shes pa yod pa nyid mi 'byung ba bzhin du shes pa yod pa nyid las kyang 'byung ba rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, just as consciousness does not arise from the elements, the elements do not arise from consciousness.üîΩTherefore, the wise should understand

original: de'i phyir mngal gnas sngon rol sems //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngal gnas sngon rol sems //
translated: that prior to the embryo,

original: sems gzhan sngon du song yin par //üîΩmkhas pa rnams kyis shes bya ste //
analyzed: sems gzhan sngon du song yin par // mkhas pa rnams kyis shes bya ste //
translated: there is a mind that precedes it,

original: 'dzin pa yin phyir de'i 'og bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni mngal @108a * //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yin phyir de'i 'og bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni mngal @108a * //
translated: because it is the appropriator, like what follows it.üîΩThe wise should understand that prior to the embryo, there is a mind that precedes it, because it is the appropriator, like what follows it.

original: na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par shes pa gzhan sngon du song ba las byung ba yin par mkhas pa rnams kyis shes par bya ste /
analyzed: na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par shes pa gzhan sngon du song ba las byung ba yin par mkhas pa rnams kyis shes par bya ste /
translated: And the consciousness that existed prior to birth also arose from another consciousness that preceded it.

original: 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir btsas pa'i 'og rol gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir btsas pa'i 'og rol gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun bzhin no //
translated: This should be understood by the wise, just like the continuum of consciousness after birth, because it is a consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir ;
translated: Because

original: be'u yang sngon chad goms byas pas //
analyzed: be'u yang sngon chad goms byas pas //
translated: a calf, having been previously habituated,

original: byung ma thag tu zas tshol byed //
analyzed: byung ma thag tu zas tshol byed //
translated: seeks food as soon as it is born.

original: zas kyi don du bskyod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zas kyi don du bskyod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it moves for the sake of food,

original: dper na dbang po smin pa bzhin //
analyzed: dper na dbang po smin pa bzhin //
translated: like a sense faculty that has matured.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir yang mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par shes pa gzhan sngon du song ba las byung ba yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir yang mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par shes pa gzhan sngon du song ba las byung ba yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the consciousness that existed prior to the time of being in the womb also arose from another consciousness that preceded it.

original: gal te de sngon gyi srid pa gzhan dag tu kha zas la sogs pa goms par ma byas na /
analyzed: gal te de sngon gyi srid pa gzhan dag tu kha zas la sogs pa goms par ma byas na /
translated: If a person had not previously habituated himself to food and so on in other lives,

original: ji ltar be'u byung ma thag kho nar sus kyang ma bskul bar sems gsal bas zas kyi don du skyod par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar be'u byung ma thag kho nar sus kyang ma bskul bar sems gsal bas zas kyi don du skyod par byed de /
translated: Just as soon as a calf is born, without being prompted by anyone, it moves to the udder because of its clear consciousness.

original: de ltar zas kyi don du skyod par byed pa'i phyir dper na dbang po yongs su smin pa gzhon nu dang bar ma dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs na gnas pa dag bzhin du be'u dag gis kyang sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu goms par byas par mngon no //
analyzed: de ltar zas kyi don du skyod par byed pa'i phyir dper na dbang po yongs su smin pa gzhon nu dang bar ma dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs na gnas pa dag bzhin du be'u dag gis kyang sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu goms par byas par mngon no //
translated: Because it moves to the udder, it is evident that calves have cultivated that in other lives, just as those whose faculties are fully ripened, whether young, middle aged, or old.

original: gal te 'di snyam du bskyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa ste /üîΩbskyod pa'i phyir des na ci re zhig khab long gis rdo la sogs pa bskyod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du bskyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa ste / bskyod pa'i phyir des na ci re zhig khab long gis rdo la sogs pa bskyod pa bzhin du /
translated: If you think that the reason ‚Äúbecause it moves‚Äù is indefinite,üîΩthen because it moves, is it the case that a calf moves without having cultivated that at all, like a magnet moving iron and so on?

original: be'us kyang sngon goms par ma byas pa kho nar skyod par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: be'us kyang sngon goms par ma byas pa kho nar skyod par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Or is it the case that a calf moves because it has cultivated that in other lives, like a person who has trained in archery?

original: 'on te dbang po yongs su smin pa bzhin du sngon goms par byas pas bskyod pa yin pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sems na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po yongs su smin pa bzhin du sngon goms par byas pas bskyod pa yin pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sems na /
translated: Or, if you think that it is not certain that the movement is due to prior habituation, like the full development of the faculties,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: khab long gis ni rdo bskyod pas //
analyzed: khab long gis ni rdo bskyod pas //
translated: The movement of a stone by a magnet

original: gtan tshigs ma nges nyid ma yin //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges nyid ma yin //
translated: is not an uncertain reason.

original: de ni zas za mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni zas za mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is seen to eat food,

original: ma grub nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: it is not unestablished.

original: zhes bya ba ni khab long gis rdo la sogs pa bskyod pa yod pa bden mod kyi de ni zas kyi don du ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khab long gis rdo la sogs pa bskyod pa yod pa bden mod kyi de ni zas kyi don du ma yin no //
translated: It is true that a magnet moves a stone and so on, but not for the purpose of eating.

original: de'i phyir zas kyi don du bskyod pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs khyad par can byas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir zas kyi don du bskyod pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs khyad par can byas pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because the reason is specified as ‚Äúbecause it moves for the purpose of eating,‚Äù

original: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
translated: the fault stated does not arise.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la skur ba 'debs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba can dag cag gis de sgrub pa gang yin pa @108b smras pa ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la skur ba 'debs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba can dag cag gis de sgrub pa gang yin pa @108b smras pa ;
translated: Those who adhere to the view that denies the existence of other worlds are the ones who prove it.

original: 'jig rten pha rol ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: They say, ‚ÄúOther worlds do not exist.

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir na nam mkha'i me tog rgyas pa bzhin no zhen bshad pa /üîΩ'di la mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de mngon dum gyis 'grub par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir na nam mkha'i me tog rgyas pa bzhin no zhen bshad pa / 'di la mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de mngon dum gyis 'grub par 'gyur ram /
translated: Because they are not observed, like a flower in the sky.üîΩHere, is the reason ‚Äúbecause they are not observed‚Äù established by direct perception?

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas 'grub par *'gyur bar rtog grang na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas 'grub par *'gyur bar rtog grang na /
translated: Or is it established by inference?

original: de la gal te mngon dum gyis 'grub bo zhe na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te mngon dum gyis 'grub bo zhe na ni /
translated: If it is established by direct perception,

original: yi dags dang sha za la sogs pa dag gis ma nges so //
analyzed: yi dags dang sha za la sogs pa dag gis ma nges so //
translated: it is not definite for hungry ghosts, cannibals, and so on.

original: 'byung po dag med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung po dag med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that spirits do not exist,

original: phyir btang ba'i gsos byed pa dag snang ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: phyir btang ba'i gsos byed pa dag snang ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because those who are healed by exorcism appear.

original: khyed kyis de dag mi mthong na bar mdo'i srid pa lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa'i yul dag mthong ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: khyed kyis de dag mi mthong na bar mdo'i srid pa lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa'i yul dag mthong ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If you do not see them, then it goes without saying that those with the divine eye of the intermediate state will see them.

original: drang srong lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa dag ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: drang srong lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa dag ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that those with the divine eye of the ·πõ·π£is do not exist.

original: shes pa'i mthu khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i bstan bcos kyi byed po bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i mthu khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i bstan bcos kyi byed po bzhin no //
translated: because they have the special power of knowledge, like the author of the treatises of the Lokayatas.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished,

original: de dag gis byas pa'i sman dbyang las bshad pa'i bya ba dag grub pa'i phyir dang / dug dang gnam lcags dang rig sngags dag kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa'i sman dbyang las bshad pa'i bya ba dag grub pa'i phyir dang / dug dang gnam lcags dang rig sngags dag kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activities explained in the Caraka medical treatise composed by them are established, and because poison, meteors, and spells are established.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i bstan bcos kyi byed pa bo ni lha'i mig dang ldan pa nyid du ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i bstan bcos kyi byed pa bo ni lha'i mig dang ldan pa nyid du ma grub po zhe na /
translated: But it is not established that the author of the treatises of the Lokayatas has the divine eye.

original: 'o na de lta na des shes pa gang gis 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba'i don 'di dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'o na de lta na des shes pa gang gis 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba'i don 'di dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: Well then, by what knowledge does he perceive the fact that there is no world beyond?

original: gal te mngon sum gyis so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis so zhe na /
translated: If by direct perception,

original: 'jig rten pha rol med pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: the nonexistence of the world beyond is not to be understood by the valid knowledge of direct perception,

original: med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is the nature of nonexistence, like a nonentity.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is established by inference,

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang mi 'grub ste //
translated: then inference also does not establish it.

original: med pa po mngon sum tsam tshad mar smra ba dag la khas blangs pas gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa po mngon sum tsam tshad mar smra ba dag la khas blangs pas gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For those who maintain that mere direct perception is a valid means of knowledge, the error of contradiction by what is accepted arises.

original: de'i phyir khyed kyis 'jig rten pha rol med par shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed kyis 'jig rten pha rol med par shes par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should not understand that a world beyond does not exist,

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu'i yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu'i yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is not to be understood by direct perception or inference, like the existence of the son of a barren woman.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i bstan bcos ni tshad ma las khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i bstan bcos ni tshad ma las khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: The treatise of LokƒÅyata should not be accepted as valid knowledge,

original: lha'i mig dang mi ldan pas byas pa'i phyir smyon pa'i tshig bzhin no //üîΩrjes su dpag pa las kyang @109a * //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang mi ldan pas byas pa'i phyir smyon pa'i tshig bzhin no // rjes su dpag pa las kyang @109a * //
translated: because it is composed by one who does not possess the divine eye, like the words of a madman.

original: bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: bzlog par bya ste /
translated: It should also be refuted by inference.

original: mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo ni rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pa sngon du song ba las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo ni rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pa sngon du song ba las byung ba yin te /
translated: The mind prior to being in the womb arises from a mind of a similar type that is not a different continuum.

original: blo yin pa'i phyir lang tsho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan gyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir lang tsho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan gyi blo bzhin no //
translated: because it is a mind, like the mind in another state, such as youth.

original: ldog pa ni bum pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni bum pa lta bu'o //
translated: The example is like a pot.

original: gal te 'di skad ces de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad ces de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThis is the establishment of what is already established,

original: pha ma dag gi blo yang so sor rgyud tha dad pa ma yin zhing rigs mthun pa yang yin la /
analyzed: pha ma dag gi blo yang so sor rgyud tha dad pa ma yin zhing rigs mthun pa yang yin la /
translated: because the minds of the parents are not separate continua and are of a similar type,

original: mer mer po la sogs pa'i blo de dag gi sngon du song ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa'i blo de dag gi sngon du song ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: and they precede the minds of the embryo and so on,‚Äù

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: that is not correct.

original: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba'i don ni mer mer po la sogs pa'i blo dag rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pas bskyed par sgrub pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba'i don ni mer mer po la sogs pa'i blo dag rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pas bskyed par sgrub pa yin pas /
translated: Here the meaning to be established is that the minds of the embryo and so on are produced by minds of a similar type that are not separate continua.

original: rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pa snga ma gzhan gang yin pa de nyid 'jig rten pha rol snga ma yin pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pa snga ma gzhan gang yin pa de nyid 'jig rten pha rol snga ma yin pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because the previous mind of a similar type that is not a separate continuum is the previous world, it is not the establishment of what is already established.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i blo yang rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i blo yang rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Moreover, the mind of death of one who is not an arhat is the cause of another mind of a similar type that is not a different continuum.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag la nyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag la nyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he possesses the fetter of latent afflictions such as attachment.

original: dgra bcom pa ma yin pa gzhon nu'i gnas skabs kyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ma yin pa gzhon nu'i gnas skabs kyi blo bzhin no //
translated: This is like the mind of a non-arhat in the youthful state.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni dgra bcom pa'i blo tha ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni dgra bcom pa'i blo tha ma bzhin no //
translated: The dissimilar example is the final mind of an arhat.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol na yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol na yang yod do //
translated: Therefore, it exists in the next world.

original: ci ste / 'di snyam du mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo ni rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pa sngon du song ba las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste / 'di snyam du mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo ni rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i blo rigs mthun pa sngon du song ba las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that the mind prior to the womb is not derived from a previous mind of a similar type that is not a different continuum,

original: blo dang po yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i blo'i skad cig ma dang po bzhin no zhes bya bar sems na 'dir mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo la blo dang po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i blo dangüîΩpor 'gyur ram //
analyzed: blo dang po yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i blo'i skad cig ma dang po bzhin no zhes bya bar sems na 'dir mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo la blo dang po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i blo dang por 'gyur ram //
translated: If you think this, then in this case, the mind prior to the womb would be the first mind, and therefore the first mind would be the mind of the eye faculty and so on.

original: 'on te yid kyi blo dang por 'gyur grang na /üîΩde la re zhig mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i blo ni dang po nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'on te yid kyi blo dang por 'gyur grang na / de la re zhig mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i blo ni dang po nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: Or would it be the first mind of the mental faculty?

original: de'i tshe na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag med pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa yang nye bar ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag med pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa yang nye bar ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, it is illogical that the mind of the eye faculty and so on is the first because at that time the eye faculty and so on do not exist and the object does not approach.

original: yid kyi blo yang dang po ma yin te //
analyzed: yid kyi blo yang dang po ma yin te //
translated: The mind of the mental faculty is also not the first because it is said:

original: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: The mind that has just ceased

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: is the mental faculty.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten snga ma @109b khas mi len pa'i phyir snga ma 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid med na 'das ma thag pa nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten snga ma @109b khas mi len pa'i phyir snga ma 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid med na 'das ma thag pa nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: and because they do not assert a prior world, how could the immediately past state exist if the prior consciousness does not exist?

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du smra ba dag la ni gnyi ga yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du smra ba dag la ni gnyi ga yang rung ste /
translated: For those who assert the existence of a prior world, both are possible.

original: 'jig rten snga ma pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag 'gags pa na de ma thag pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dmigs pa nye bar ma gyur kyang snga ma'i dmigs la ltos pas blo zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten snga ma pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag 'gags pa na de ma thag pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dmigs pa nye bar ma gyur kyang snga ma'i dmigs la ltos pas blo zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ceased sense faculties of the prior world are the immediately preceding condition of the sense faculties of the present world, and because it is possible to designate the mind as the mind that focuses on the prior object even though the object does not exist.

original: snga ma'i rnam par shes pa 'das pa nyid las yid kyi blo de'i dang po yang 'byung bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i rnam par shes pa 'das pa nyid las yid kyi blo de'i dang po yang 'byung bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also possible for the first moment of mental cognition to arise from the prior consciousness that has ceased.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad smra bar nus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad smra bar nus te /
translated: Therefore one can say the following.

original: mer mer po'i gnas skabs kyi blo gang yin pa de ni 'das pa de ma thag pa'i blo'i khyad par la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: mer mer po'i gnas skabs kyi blo gang yin pa de ni 'das pa de ma thag pa'i blo'i khyad par la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The mind that is in the state of the kalala is dependent on the mind that is the immediately preceding condition of that.

original: blo yin pa'i phyir gnyid log pa'i 'og tu sad pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir gnyid log pa'i 'og tu sad pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: Because it is a mind, like the mind of one who is awake after having been asleep.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The example of dissimilarity is like a monk who has entered the absorption of cessation.

original: de'i phyir med pa bdag mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol la blo nyid yod par rtog pa la yang 'jig rten pha rol grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa bdag mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol la blo nyid yod par rtog pa la yang 'jig rten pha rol grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even in the conception that the non-existent self exists prior to the womb, the establishment of the next world is still tenable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo ni 'das pa de ma thag pa'i blo'i yul la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo ni 'das pa de ma thag pa'i blo'i yul la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The mind prior to the womb is dependent on the mind that is the immediately preceding condition of that.

original: dbang po'i blo yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi dbang po'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi dbang po'i blo bzhin no //
translated: Because it is a mind of the sense faculties, like the mind of the sense faculty of concentration.

original: gang dag 'di skad ces mngal na gnas pa lus dang yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa mngal nas 'byung ba'i blo ni dang po yin par smra ba de dag la yang skye ba'i sngon rol gyi blo gang yin pa de ni 'das pa de ma thagüîΩpa'i blo'i yul la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag 'di skad ces mngal na gnas pa lus dang yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa mngal nas 'byung ba'i blo ni dang po yin par smra ba de dag la yang skye ba'i sngon rol gyi blo gang yin pa de ni 'das pa de ma thag pa'i blo'i yul la ltos pa yin te /
translated: Those who say that the first cognition is the one that emerges from the womb, with a body and all its limbs fully developed, should be addressed as follows: The cognition that exists prior to birth is the object of the immediately past cognition,

original: dbang po'i blo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is a cognition of the sense faculties,

original: bsam gtan gyi dbang po'i blo bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dbang po'i blo bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: like the cognition of the faculty of meditative absorption.

original: zag pa med pa'i blo'i skad cig ma dang po la yang pha rol pos bsgrub par bya ba'i don med de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i blo'i skad cig ma dang po la yang pha rol pos bsgrub par bya ba'i don med de /
translated: Moreover, the first moment of uncontaminated cognition is not the object to be established by the opponent,

original: de ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bag chags sngon du song ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bag chags sngon du song ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from the latent propensities of the knowledge that arises from listening, reflection, and meditation.
