original: ci ste blo gzhan gyis skyed pa'i blo yang dang po yin pas dang po'o zhes brjod na mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste blo gzhan gyis skyed pa'i blo yang dang po yin pas dang po'o zhes brjod na mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo grub pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that the first cognition is the one that is produced by another cognition, then the cognition that exists prior to the womb would be established as the first cognition.

analyzed: dang po nyid ces bya ba de kho bo la yang 'gal ba med do //

original: gal te las med par gyur na pha ma mtshungs pa'i rkyen rigs mthun pas bskyed pa'i bu spun dag / tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang bden pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i mi rigs pas de'i phyir /

analyzed: glang rdzi la sogs pa ni mang po yin pas de'i phyir glang rdzi dag ni sems dang ldan du zin kyang 'gro ba ma lus pa'i byed pa po ma yin gyi /

analyzed: dbang phyug de ni rgyal po bzhin du 'jig rten thams cad rnam par gnas pa'i byed pa po yin par sems na bshad pa /

original: dngos rnams tshogs las grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos rnams tshogs las grub pa'i phyir //

original: byed po gcig pu 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: byed po gcig pu 'ga' yang med //
translated: There is no single creator.

original: de phyir ma nges nyid ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir ma nges nyid ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is not indeterminate.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir byed pa po gcig pu zhes bya ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir byed pa po gcig pu zhes bya ba mi 'thad de /
translated: This is because all things arise from the collection of causes and conditions. Therefore, it is not tenable to say that there is a single creator.

original: gal te gcig pu nyid la byed pa po nyid kyi mthu yod par gyur na rgyu dang rkyen mang por brtags pa dag gis ci bya /
analyzed: gal te gcig pu nyid la byed pa po nyid kyi mthu yod par gyur na rgyu dang rkyen mang por brtags pa dag gis ci bya /
translated: If a single creator had the power to create, then what would be the point of positing many causes and conditions?

original: 'jig rten na dngos po rnams kyi rgyu byed pa po gcig pu ni 'ga' yang mi snang bas kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten na dngos po rnams kyi rgyu byed pa po gcig pu ni 'ga' yang mi snang bas kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du ga la 'gyur //
translated: Since in the world no single creator of things is seen, how could my reason be indeterminate?

original: ci ste 'di snyam du mig la sogs pa dag ni dbang phyug dang ldan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du mig la sogs pa dag ni dbang phyug dang ldan pa kho na yin te /

analyzed: mang ba'i phyir ji ltar 'jig rten na bran g-yog mang po la /üîΩbdag po gcig yod pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sems na bshad pa /
translated: are possessed by a single master in the world,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gal te mig sogs dbang phyug bcas //
analyzed: gal te mig sogs dbang phyug bcas //
translated: If the eye and so on were the creator,üîΩ

original: mang phyir bran bzhin 'dod ce na //
analyzed: mang phyir bran bzhin 'dod ce na //
translated: If you assert that because there are many eyes, etc.,üîΩthey are like servants of God,

original: ma skyes dbang phyug gcig mi 'grub //
analyzed: ma skyes dbang phyug gcig mi 'grub //
translated: then God is not established as one, unborn,

original: dbang phyug de las bzlog par 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang phyug de las bzlog par 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rgyal po la sogs pa 'ga' zhig skyes pa ni dbang phyug gcig pu zhes bya bar yang 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rgyal po la sogs pa 'ga' zhig skyes pa ni dbang phyug gcig pu zhes bya bar yang 'gyur grang na /
translated: In this way, if someone is born as a king, etc., he is called ‚Äúone God.‚Äù

original: dbang phyug de ni ma skyes pa'i phyir gcig pu nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang phyug de ni ma skyes pa'i phyir gcig pu nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: But because that God is not born, he is not even one,

analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin pas dbang phyug de las bzlog pa dbang phyug ma yin pa nyid du rigs par 'gyur ro //

original: ci ste byed por bcas 'dod de //
analyzed: ci ste byed por bcas 'dod de //
translated: If you assert that God is an agent,

original: bkod phyir bum sogs bzhin zhe na //
analyzed: bkod phyir bum sogs bzhin zhe na //
translated: because he is the creator, like a pot, etc.,

original: gal te khyad par ma bstan pa'i //
analyzed: gal te khyad par ma bstan pa'i //
translated: if you assert that God is an agent without teaching a distinction,

original: byed po yin na grub pa sgrub //
analyzed: byed po yin na grub pa sgrub //
translated: you prove what is already established.

original: ces bya ba ni ci ste yang mig la sogs pa dag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis nye bar bkod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ci ste yang mig la sogs pa dag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis nye bar bkod pa yin gyi /
translated: If you say that eyes, etc., are created by causes and conditions,

analyzed: bdag ni sus kyang nye bar bkod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mig la sogs pa dag ni byed pa po dang bcas pa nyid yin te / nye bar @111a * //
translated: Since no one has arranged it, therefore the eyes and so on have an agent,

analyzed: bkod pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /

original: de'i lan du bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i lan du bshad pa /

analyzed: ci ste rtag gcig phra sogs kyi //

analyzed: khyad par gyis na khyod dpe med //üîΩces bya ba ni dbang phyug ni mig la sogs pa'i byed pa po yin te /
translated: then he is not an analogy for us,üîΩbecause he is not accepted by us.

analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir dang / gcig pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir ci dang 'dra zhes bya ba'i dpe khyod la med pas mig la sogs pa'i byed pa po dbang phyug yin no zhes khyad par du ston na dpe med pas ma grub bo //
translated: Since he is permanent, unitary, and non-arisen, you have no example for him. Therefore, if you claim that the creator of the eye, etc. is God, since you have no example, your claim is unproven.

analyzed: gal te dbang phyug yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i byed pa po rdza mkhan la sogs pa yin pa bzhin no zhe na bshad pa /
translated: If you say that the creator of the pot, etc. is the potter, etc. because he is God, then we reply:üîΩYour God would be impermanent,

analyzed: khyod kyi de ni mi rtag dang // gzugs can skyes nyid skyon du 'gyur //

analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs rgyu yi las // dbang phyug yin na kun rdzob tu'ang //
translated: are the cause of the karma of the container world,

original: grub pa nyid la rab tu sgrub //
analyzed: grub pa nyid la rab tu sgrub //
translated: then God is established even conventionallyüîΩas the creator of the world.

analyzed: ces bya ba ni gal te yang sems can du bgrang ba lha dang mi la sogs pa skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang / snod du bgrang ba de dag gi gnas snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang /
translated: If it is argued that God is the cause of sentient beings such as gods and humans who are born, endure and perish and of the various worlds that are their abodes,

analyzed: mi g-yo ba dag dbang phyug yin par sgrub na ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul du yang grub pa nyid la rab tu sgrub pa yin te /

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: des na khyod 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ces bya ba de ni med pa'i phyir mi rigs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the so-called ƒ™≈õvara that you assert does not exist, the error of non-Buddhist systems is illogical.üîΩYou should understand that time, puru·π£a,

analyzed: des ni dus dang skyes bu dang // gtso bo rdul phran khyab 'jug dag /'gro ba 'di @111b yi rgyu min par //üîΩdgag pa khong du chud par bya //
translated: primordial matter, atoms, and Vi·π£·πáu are not the causes of this world.

original: zhes bya ba ni de la dus rgyur 'dod pa kha cig ni sa bon la sogs pa dang / de dag gi rkyen sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa dag yod du zin kyang myu gu la sogs pa lan 'ga' 'byung bar snang ba'i phyir dus 'di 'jig rten ma lus pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar zhugs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de la dus rgyur 'dod pa kha cig ni sa bon la sogs pa dang / de dag gi rkyen sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa dag yod du zin kyang myu gu la sogs pa lan 'ga' 'byung bar snang ba'i phyir dus 'di 'jig rten ma lus pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar zhugs so //
translated: Some who assert time as a cause believe that even though the conditions of a seed, such as earth, water, fire, air, etc., exist, a sprout, etc., appears only occasionally, and therefore time is the cause of the production of the entire world.

original: de bzhin du skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa dag gi khongs na rgyu ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa dag gi khongs na rgyu ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, some who assert purusha as a cause believe that purusha itself is the cause of the entire world.

original: ba ni ba sbra rnams kyi yin //
analyzed: ba ni ba sbra rnams kyi yin //
translated: A cow is the cause of a calf,üîΩlike a water crystal is the cause of water,

original: chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
analyzed: chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
translated: and a branch is the cause of leaves.

original: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
translated: It is the cause of all embodied beings.

original: zhes bya bar mngon par zhen no //
analyzed: zhes bya bar mngon par zhen no //
translated: They believe this.

original: gtso bo rgyur smra ba dag kyang tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi bdag nyid can gyi 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu ni gtso bo zhes bya ba rang bzhin yin par sems so //
analyzed: gtso bo rgyur smra ba dag kyang tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi bdag nyid can gyi 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu ni gtso bo zhes bya ba rang bzhin yin par sems so //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, who maintain that the primal substance is the cause, think that the primal substance, which is the cause of the entire world, from BrahmƒÅ to the inanimate world, which has the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion, is the cause of the world.

original: de bzhin du rdul phran rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang sa la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyis brtsams pa dag ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul phran rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang sa la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyis brtsams pa dag ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the Vaise·π£ikas, who maintain that atoms are the cause, think that earth and so on are substantially existent because they are composed of subtle atoms.

original: rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa dag gi rgyu ni rdul phra rab rtag pa dag yin par dam 'cha'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa dag gi rgyu ni rdul phra rab rtag pa dag yin par dam 'cha'o //
translated: They maintain that the cause of the great elements and so on, which are established by the sequence of two or more atoms, is the permanent atoms.

original: yang kha cig ni khyab 'jug ces bya ba ri dang shing dang / chu dang sa dang me dang rlung la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pa skye ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig ni khyab 'jug ces bya ba ri dang shing dang / chu dang sa dang me dang rlung la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pa skye ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that Vi·π£·πáu, who is included in all things such as mountains, trees, water, earth, fire, wind, and so on, is the cause of the entire world, and that he is unborn and imperishable.

original: de dag thams cad kyang dbang phyug bzhin du dpyad cing dgag par yang bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang dbang phyug bzhin du dpyad cing dgag par yang bya ste /

original: dus ni 'jig rten byed po min //
analyzed: dus ni 'jig rten byed po min //

translated: The BhagavƒÅn, having realized that those views are mere designations, also causes others to understand that. Therefore, in order to realize that those views do not exist,

analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni kun rdzob tu byed pa po nyid du ston te /

original: phung po snga ma mar me la sogs pa bzhin du 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po snga ma mar me la sogs pa bzhin du 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the prior aggregates cease, like a lamp and so on.

original: gal te 'di snyam du re zhig lha ma yin dang lha tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du re zhig lha ma yin dang lha tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: If you think that gods and asuras are not different,

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: why?

original: lha ma yin gyi phung po'i rgyu las lha'i phung po mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi phung po'i rgyu las lha'i phung po mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates of asuras are established as the aggregates of gods.

original: gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin te //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin te //
translated: They are not identical,

original: gzugs las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are different from form.

original: 'on kyang bum pa bzhin du gcig dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bum pa bzhin du gcig dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: However, like a pot, they are not described as either identical or different.

original: dper na bum pa dang 'jim pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sems na bshad pa /
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang 'jim pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sems na bshad pa /
translated: For example, it is like a vase and the form of clay and so on, which are not to be expressed as either the same or different.‚ÄùüîΩIf you think that, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: brjod min bum pa bzhin yang //
analyzed: brjod min bum pa bzhin yang //
translated: Even if it is not to be expressed, like a vase,

original: chad pa ji ltar spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chad pa ji ltar spong bar 'gyur //
translated: how could nihilism be avoided?

original: zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be expressed as either the same or different.

original: bum pa dang 'jim pa dang gzugs la sogs pa bzhin na yang gang gi tshe bum pa rab tu zhig par 'gyur pa de'i tshe na chad pa ji ltar spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa dang 'jim pa dang gzugs la sogs pa bzhin na yang gang gi tshe bum pa rab tu zhig par 'gyur pa de'i tshe na chad pa ji ltar spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if it is like a vase and clay and form and so on, when the vase is destroyed, how could nihilism be avoided?

original: ngo bo nyid de nyid kyis yang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de nyid kyis yang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it does not arise again by its own intrinsic reality.

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du lha ma yin gyi phung po snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir dang / lhas lha'i phung po yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin par sems na ;
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du lha ma yin gyi phung po snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir dang / lhas lha'i phung po yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin par sems na ;
translated: But if you think that because the previous aggregates of the asura are the cause of the later aggregates of the asura, and because the god appropriates the aggregates of the god, it has the nature of both,

original: bshad pa / yin dang ma yin nyid yin yang //
analyzed: bshad pa / yin dang ma yin nyid yin yang //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: It is both existent and nonexistent,

original: mya ngan 'das tshe gcig 'da' med //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das tshe gcig 'da' med //
translated: But when passing into nirvƒÅ·πáa, it does not transcend one extreme.

original: ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su smrar zin kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na phung po'i rgyun chad pas chad pa'i mtha' gcig las 'da' ba med de chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su smrar zin kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na phung po'i rgyun chad pas chad pa'i mtha' gcig las 'da' ba med de chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Although you speak in terms of two aspects, when passing into nirvƒÅ·πáa, since the continuum of the aggregates is severed, you do not transcend one extreme, namely, annihilation, for you would be annihilated.

original: gzhan yang / gal te 'gags pa skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te 'gags pa skye 'gyur na //
translated: Moreover: If what has ceased were to arise,

original: des na ji ltar rtag ma yin //
analyzed: des na ji ltar rtag ma yin //
translated: then how could it not be permanent?

original: 'gags pa skye ba med gyur na //
analyzed: 'gags pa skye ba med gyur na //
translated: If what has ceased did not arise,

original: ji ltar chad smra nyid ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /üîΩlha ma yin 'gags pa gang yin pa de lha'i phung po dag tu skye ba ni ci ste skye'am 'on te mi skye /
analyzed: ji ltar chad smra nyid ma yin // zhes bya ba ni / lha ma yin 'gags pa gang yin pa de lha'i phung po dag tu skye ba ni ci ste skye'am 'on te mi skye /
translated: then how could it not be annihilation?

original: gal te skye bar gyur na ni des na ji ltar rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te skye bar gyur na ni des na ji ltar rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, if what has ceased as an asura were to arise as the aggregates of a god, then how could it not be permanent?

original: 'gags par gyur kyang yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags par gyur kyang yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because although it has ceased, it would arise again.

original: ci ste skye ba med par gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba med par gyur na ni /
translated: But if it did not arise,

original: ji ltar chad par smra ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar chad par smra ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: then how could it not be annihilation?

original: lha ma yin gyi phung po 'gags pa gtan du skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi phung po 'gags pa gtan du skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cessation of the aggregate of demigods is the complete nonarising of the demigods.

original: gal te 'di snyam du rgyun nges par gnas pa la gang gi phyir phung po snga ma 'gags pa'i @113b phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du rgyun nges par gnas pa la gang gi phyir phung po snga ma 'gags pa'i @113b phyir /
translated: If you think that the continuum definitely endures because the previous aggregates cease,

original: rtag pa nyid ma yin la gang gi phyir phung po phyi ma skye ba'i phyir ni chad pa nyid ma yin par sems na /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ma yin la gang gi phyir phung po phyi ma skye ba'i phyir ni chad pa nyid ma yin par sems na /
translated: then it is not permanent, and because the subsequent aggregates arise, it is not annihilated,

original: bshad pa / rgyun ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bshad pa / rgyun ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: rtag chad de dag ga la yod //üîΩces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtag chad de dag ga la yod // ces bya ba ni /
translated: How can permanence and annihilation Apply to a continuum that is not a thing?

original: skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma 'gags pa dang / skye bas mtshon pa'i rgyun ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma 'gags pa dang / skye bas mtshon pa'i rgyun ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the continuum that is characterized by the cessation of the previous moment and the arising of the subsequent moment does not exist as a thing.

original: kun rdzob tu yang rtag pa med pa dang / chad pa med par tha snyad gdags su rung ngo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang rtag pa med pa dang / chad pa med par tha snyad gdags su rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, even conventionally, it is suitable to designate it as neither permanent nor annihilated.

original: don dam par ni 'du byed kyi tshogs gang 'gags pa de ni skye ba dang mtshams sbyor ba med la /
analyzed: don dam par ni 'du byed kyi tshogs gang 'gags pa de ni skye ba dang mtshams sbyor ba med la /
translated: Ultimately, the collection of formations that has ceased does not arise or reconnect.

original: 'du byed kyi tshogs gang skye ba de ni 'gags pa dang mtshams sbyor ba med pas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi tshogs gang skye ba de ni 'gags pa dang mtshams sbyor ba med pas /
translated: Since the collection of formations that arises does not link to cessation,

original: de la de gnyis ma gtogs par gang la rtag pa dang / chad pa gnyis med pas rtag pa ma yin pa dang / chad pa ma yin par tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i dngos po rdzas su gyur par yod pa de lta bu yang yod /
analyzed: de la de gnyis ma gtogs par gang la rtag pa dang / chad pa gnyis med pas rtag pa ma yin pa dang / chad pa ma yin par tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i dngos po rdzas su gyur par yod pa de lta bu yang yod /
translated: apart from those two, it is not tenable to designate as a substantial entity that which is permanent or impermanent, or that which is annihilated or not annihilated.

original: de med phyir na ma skyes la //üîΩrtag med chad med rigs pa yin //
analyzed: de med phyir na ma skyes la // rtag med chad med rigs pa yin //
translated: Because it does not exist, it is not arisen.üîΩIt is logical that it is not permanent and not annihilated.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po skyes pa yun ring du nges par gnas pa'i tshul can nyid ni rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po skyes pa yun ring du nges par gnas pa'i tshul can nyid ni rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: That which has the mode of abiding for a long time after it has arisen is permanence.

original: skyes pa nyid rab tu zhig pa ni chad pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes pa nyid rab tu zhig pa ni chad pa yin la /
translated: That which has arisen and is completely destroyed is annihilation.

original: gang ma skyes pa de ni rtag pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa de ni rtag pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: That which has not arisen is not permanent.

original: chad pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: chad pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur bas /
translated: It is also not annihilated.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag 'dod pa ltar don dam par skye ba med pa nyid du grub pa la ni rtag pa med pa dang chad pa med pa nyid du rigs kyi khyed 'dod pa'i rgyun la ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag 'dod pa ltar don dam par skye ba med pa nyid du grub pa la ni rtag pa med pa dang chad pa med pa nyid du rigs kyi khyed 'dod pa'i rgyun la ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that nonproduction in the ultimate sense is established as we maintain it, and it is not reasonable in the context of your theory of continuity.

original: yang rang gi sde pa dag rnam pa gzhan gyis phyir zlog par byed pa la brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /üîΩgal te sdug bsngal mi bskyed phyir //
analyzed: yang rang gi sde pa dag rnam pa gzhan gyis phyir zlog par byed pa la brgal zhing brtag par bya ste / gal te sdug bsngal mi bskyed phyir //
translated: Now, we must examine and analyze the other way in which our counterparts attempt to defend their position.üîΩIf the Buddha taught the Dharma

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos ston pas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos ston pas //
translated: in order to eliminate suffering,

original: de phyir de yi 'bras yod phyir //
analyzed: de phyir de yi 'bras yod phyir //
translated: then since that result exists,

original: skye ba yod par 'dod ce na //
analyzed: skye ba yod par 'dod ce na //
translated: birth must exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gi bsam pa la brtags nas phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gi bsam pa la brtags nas phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
translated: This is the position of the counterparts, which we have stated after examining their thoughts.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga ni skye ba yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩde mi bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga ni skye ba yod pa kho na yin te / de mi bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: The five aggregates called ‚Äúsuffering‚Äù do indeed exist,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Buddha taught the Dharma in order to eliminate them.

original: 'di ni gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni de mi bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni de mi bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which does not exist is not generated.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ma mdzad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ma mdzad de /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn did not teach the Dharma

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: because it is like the son of a barren woman.

original: gang sdug bsngal de yod pa la ni de mi bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal de yod pa la ni de mi bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which exists as suffering is not generated.

original: bcom ldan @114a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan @114a * //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn

original: 'das kyis lam zhes bya ba'i chos bstan par yang mdzad de /
analyzed: 'das kyis lam zhes bya ba'i chos bstan par yang mdzad de /
translated: did teach the Dharma called the path.

original: de yang thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa dang / goms par byas pa'i dgra bcom pa la sogs bdag gi phung po skye ba med pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan par mthong bas de'i phyir chos bstan pa de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa dang / goms par byas pa'i dgra bcom pa la sogs bdag gi phung po skye ba med pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan par mthong bas de'i phyir chos bstan pa de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because the result of the nonarising of the aggregates of the self, such as an arhat, is seen through listening, reflection, and meditation, therefore, because the result of that teaching of the Dharma exists,

original: sdug bsngal skye ba ni yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba ni yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: the arising of suffering definitely exists.

original: de'i lan du bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i lan du bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: gal te khyed de ltar sdug bsngal skye ba yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te khyed de ltar sdug bsngal skye ba yod par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the arising of suffering exists in that way,

original: gal te de ni skye 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te de ni skye 'dod na //
translated: if you assert that it arises,

original: de ni sngar bzhin skye med phyir //
analyzed: de ni sngar bzhin skye med phyir //
translated: because it does not arise as before,

original: skye ba med pa de'i 'bras min //
analyzed: skye ba med pa de'i 'bras min //
translated: Non-arising is not the result of that.

original: de yongs shes pa de 'bras yin //
analyzed: de yongs shes pa de 'bras yin //
translated: The thorough knowledge of that is the result of that.

original: zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos nyid du kho bos sngar sdug bsngal de bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las skye ba med par bstan zin pas skye ba med pa ni chos bstan pa de'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos nyid du kho bos sngar sdug bsngal de bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las skye ba med par bstan zin pas skye ba med pa ni chos bstan pa de'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: This is the treatise itself. Since I have previously demonstrated that suffering does not arise from self, from another, from both, or without cause, non-arising is not the result of the teaching of the Dharma.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal de skye ba med par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal de skye ba med par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The thorough knowledge of suffering is the thorough knowledge of that suffering as non-arising.

original: de nyid chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu yin pas skye bar btags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de nyid chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu yin pas skye bar btags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: That is the result of the teaching of the Dharma. What is the use of designating it as arising?

original: sdug bsngal de ji ltar skye ba med par yongs su shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de ji ltar skye ba med par yongs su shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is that suffering thoroughly known as non-arising?

original: des ni bdag gis byas mi rigs //
analyzed: des ni bdag gis byas mi rigs //
translated: It is not logical that it is self-produced.

original: de nyid kyis de ma byas phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de ma byas phyir //
translated: Because it is not produced by itself.

original: gzhan gyis byas par mi 'dod de //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas par mi 'dod de //
translated: It is not asserted that it is produced by another,

original: gzhan gyis gzhan byed 'gal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan byed 'gal ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is contradictory for one thing to be produced by another.

original: zhes bya ba ni re zhig sdug bsngal de ni sdug bsngal de nyid kyis mi byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni re zhig sdug bsngal de ni sdug bsngal de nyid kyis mi byed de /
translated: First, that suffering is not produced by that suffering itself.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: dper na lam de nyid du lam de nyid mi 'gro ba dang / sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid la sor mo'i rtsa mo de nyid kyis reg par mi byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lam de nyid du lam de nyid mi 'gro ba dang / sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid la sor mo'i rtsa mo de nyid kyis reg par mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, that very path does not go on that very path, and the tip of that very finger does not touch that very fingertip.

original: sdug bsngal de yang dag par na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gzhan gyis kyang mi byed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang dag par na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gzhan gyis kyang mi byed de /
translated: That suffering is not produced by another cause of suffering in reality.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is contradictory for one thing to produce another.

original: dper na 'bras s'a lu'i sa bon gyis nas kyi myu gu mi byed pa dang / nas kyi sa bon gyis kyang 'bras snga la'i myu gu mi byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras s'a lu'i sa bon gyis nas kyi myu gu mi byed pa dang / nas kyi sa bon gyis kyang 'bras snga la'i myu gu mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a rice seed does not produce a barley sprout, and a barley seed does not produce a rice sprout.

original: gzhan yang / sdug bsngal rang rgyud skye mi 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sdug bsngal rang rgyud skye mi 'dod //
translated: Moreover, suffering is not asserted to arise from a continuum of its own.üîΩBecause sentient beings and so on do not exist,

original: sems can la sogs med phyir dang // rdzas med phyir dang dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: sems can la sogs med phyir dang // rdzas med phyir dang dbyer med phyir //
translated: because they are not substances, and because they are not divisible.

original: sdug bsngal de la rgyud kyang med //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de la rgyud kyang med //
translated: That suffering does not have a continuum.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This verse shows that

original: ci ste sdug bsngal de sus kyang @114b ma byas pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: ci ste sdug bsngal de sus kyang @114b ma byas pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: even if that suffering were not created by anyone,

original: rang gi rgyud las skyes pas sdug bsngal ni rang gi rgyud las skyes bar sems na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las skyes pas sdug bsngal ni rang gi rgyud las skyes bar sems na /
translated: if you think that suffering arises from your own continuum,

original: rgyud de la sems can la sogs pas stong ba'i phyir sdug bsngal de su'i yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyud de la sems can la sogs pas stong ba'i phyir sdug bsngal de su'i yin par 'gyur /
translated: then since that continuum is empty of sentient beings and so on, whose suffering would it be?üîΩAlso, the continuum is called a continuum because it is connected by theüîΩrelationship of cause and effect between mind and mental factors. Since the

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'brel ba'i rgyud la rgyud ces bya na rgyud de la yang skad cig ma snga ma 'gag pa na skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma skye ba'i phyir mar me'i 'od skye ba dang 'gagüîΩpa bzhin nam /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'brel ba'i rgyud la rgyud ces bya na rgyud de la yang skad cig ma snga ma 'gag pa na skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma skye ba'i phyir mar me'i 'od skye ba dang 'gag pa bzhin nam /
translated: later moments of the continuum arise when the earlier moments cease, likeüîΩthe arising and cessation of the flame of a lamp, or like the arising and

original: chu las rlabs 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa bzhin pas rdzas su nges par gnas pa med pa'i phyir dang / dbyer med pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: chu las rlabs 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa bzhin pas rdzas su nges par gnas pa med pa'i phyir dang / dbyer med pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: ceasing of waves in water, it does not endure substantially. It is also notüîΩindivisible.

original: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal can la 'di'i rgyud la sdug bsngal 'di yod do zhes tha dad pa dbyer med pa'i phyir don dam par na rgyud la yang sdug bsngal de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal can la 'di'i rgyud la sdug bsngal 'di yod do zhes tha dad pa dbyer med pa'i phyir don dam par na rgyud la yang sdug bsngal de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since the suffering and the one who suffers are not different and cannot be separated, ultimately the suffering does not exist in the continuum.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal skye ba med par yongs su shes pa ni chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu yin gyi skye ba med par ni 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal skye ba med par yongs su shes pa ni chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu yin gyi skye ba med par ni 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: The result of teaching the Dharma is the thorough understanding that suffering does not arise, not that suffering does not exist.

original: ci ste yang sde pa gzhan dag phyir zlog par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste yang sde pa gzhan dag phyir zlog par byed na /
translated: If other schools argue as follows:

original: mig la sogs pa 'du byed rnams ni skye ba dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'du byed rnams ni skye ba dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
translated: Compounded phenomena such as the eyes do have arising,

original: sems can gyi ming du brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can gyi ming du brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: because they are called sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhin no zhe na /
translated: They are like buddhas.

original: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste ;üîΩgal te mig sogs 'du byed rnams //
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste ; gal te mig sogs 'du byed rnams //
translated: We would say to them:üîΩIf you prove that compounded phenomena

original: de nyid du na skye can de //
analyzed: de nyid du na skye can de //
translated: such as the eyes have arising

original: sems can ming du brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can ming du brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: because they are called sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas bzhin du sgrub byed na //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhin du sgrub byed na //
translated: they are like buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de'i lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The reply to that is:

original: des la sangs rgyas skye chos min //
analyzed: des la sangs rgyas skye chos min //
translated: The Buddha is not born from itself,üîΩnor from another, nor from both,üîΩnor without cause.

original: de phyir de yod ma yin la //
analyzed: de phyir de yod ma yin la //
translated: Thus, he does not exist.

original: de bzhin de skye yod min te //
analyzed: de bzhin de skye yod min te //
translated: Likewise, his birth does not exist,

original: bdag bzhin sgyu ma bzhin 'byung yod //
analyzed: bdag bzhin sgyu ma bzhin 'byung yod //
translated: but he appears like an illusion, like a reflection.

original: ces bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yang ma skyes pas khyod kyi dpe med do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yang ma skyes pas khyod kyi dpe med do //
translated: In order to demonstrate that all phenomena are unborn, the TathƒÅgata is also unborn. Therefore, your example does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad ces smra par nus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad ces smra par nus te /
translated: Therefore, one can say this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not exist ultimately.

original: sku dang gcig gam tha dad par dmigs su med pa'i phyir bdag dang sems can dang gang zag la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sku dang gcig gam tha dad par dmigs su med pa'i phyir bdag dang sems can dang gang zag la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because he is not apprehended as identical to or different from his body, like a self, a sentient being, a living being, and so on.

original: 'o na gang zag gcig skye ba na skye'o zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zag gcig skye ba na skye'o zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na /
translated: But wasn‚Äôt it said that when one person is born, many people are born?

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir yang @115a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir yang @115a * //
translated: Because he arises from a collection of causes and conditions,

original: dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du snang ste /
translated: The Buddha appears in the form of a body that is not pure.

original: sangs rgyas kyang mtshan gyi bdag nyid kyis sgyu ma bzhin du 'byung ba ni yod par 'dod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang mtshan gyi bdag nyid kyis sgyu ma bzhin du 'byung ba ni yod par 'dod de /
translated: We accept that the Buddha appears like an illusion in the form of the major and minor marks.

original: kun rdzob pa yin pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas rnams zhes gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa yin pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas rnams zhes gdags par zad kyi /
translated: Since he is conventional, he is designated as a stream enterer, a once returner, a nonreturner, an arhat, a pratyekabuddha, a bodhisattva, and a buddha in the conventions of the world.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But he is not ultimately.

original: de nyid lung dang rigs pas bsgrub par bya ste /üîΩgzugs ni yang dag nyid du na //
analyzed: de nyid lung dang rigs pas bsgrub par bya ste / gzugs ni yang dag nyid du na //
translated: This will be established by scripture and logic.üîΩForm is not the Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas ma yin rtogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma yin rtogs bya'i phyir //
translated: because the Buddha is realized as suchness.üîΩConsciousness is not the Buddha,

original: 'khor los sgyur bzhin rnam shes min //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur bzhin rnam shes min //
translated: like a universal monarch.

original: rang gzhan snang phyir mig 'phrul bzhin //
analyzed: rang gzhan snang phyir mig 'phrul bzhin //
translated: Because he appears to himself and others, he is like an illusion.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos legs par brgyan pa'i gzugs sangs rgyas yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos legs par brgyan pa'i gzugs sangs rgyas yin nam /
translated: Here, is the Buddha the form that is well adorned with the major and minor marks?

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa rang dang yul gyi ngo bo nyid gnyis su snang bar grags pa sangs rgyas yin par 'dod grang na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa rang dang yul gyi ngo bo nyid gnyis su snang bar grags pa sangs rgyas yin par 'dod grang na /
translated: But if you assert that a buddha is a consciousness that is renowned to appear as the nature of itself and its object,

original: gnyi ga yang yang dag pa nyid du na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang yang dag pa nyid du na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then neither is real.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams ni 'khor los sgyur ba la yang yod pa'i phyir dang / mig 'phrul gyi shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i cha dag la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams ni 'khor los sgyur ba la yang yod pa'i phyir dang / mig 'phrul gyi shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i cha dag la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the major and minor marks exist even for a universal monarch, and a consciousness of a magical illusion exists even for those who lack conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: phung po gzugs can sangs rgyas min //
analyzed: phung po gzugs can sangs rgyas min //
translated: The aggregates that are form are not a buddha,

original: phung pos bsdus pa yin 'dod phyir //
analyzed: phung pos bsdus pa yin 'dod phyir //
translated: Because they are asserted to be included in the aggregates,

original: skye 'jig chos can yin phyir dang // shes bya yin phyir gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: skye 'jig chos can yin phyir dang // shes bya yin phyir gzugs bzhin no //
translated: Because they have the attributes of arising and disintegrating, and because they are objects of knowledge, like form.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar /
translated: This is because

original: bcom ldan 'das la yang 'khrungs pa'i tshe na skye ba yod la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la yang 'khrungs pa'i tshe na skye ba yod la /
translated: when the BhagavƒÅn was born, he arose.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe na 'jig pa yang yod cing /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe na 'jig pa yang yod cing /
translated: When he passed into nirvƒÅ·πáa, he disintegrated.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i skad cig ma dag yod pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa'i yul yin pas shes bya nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor pa dag gis bsgoms pas mthong ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i skad cig ma dag yod pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa'i yul yin pas shes bya nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor pa dag gis bsgoms pas mthong ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum of moments also has moments of origination and destruction, because it is an object of knowledge since it is the object of eyes, etc., and because it is seen by the yogis through meditation.

original: sku ni sangs rgyas yin mi rigs //
analyzed: sku ni sangs rgyas yin mi rigs //
translated: The body is not suitable as the Buddha.üîΩBecause of the error of the destruction of the Buddha,

original: de zhig 'jig pa'i skyon phyir dang // gzhan gyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de zhig 'jig pa'i skyon phyir dang // gzhan gyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir //
translated: and because of the absence of the characteristics of another.

original: bdag bzhin de ni ga la yod //
analyzed: bdag bzhin de ni ga la yod //
translated: How can it be like the self?

original: ces bya ba ni phung po dag nyid ni sangs rgyas ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni phung po dag nyid ni sangs rgyas ma yin te /
translated: The aggregates themselves are not the Buddha.

original: phung po zhig pa na sangs rgyas kyang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po zhig pa na sangs rgyas kyang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because if the aggregates were destroyed, it would follow, absurdly, that the Buddha would be destroyed.

original: mar me zhig pa na 'od kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba bzhin no //üîΩphung po rnams las gzhan la yang //
analyzed: mar me zhig pa na 'od kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba bzhin no // phung po rnams las gzhan la yang //
translated: Just as when a butter lamp is destroyed, its light is destroyed.

original: @115b sangs rgyas yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: @115b sangs rgyas yod pa ma yin te //
translated: The Buddha does not exist apart from the aggregates.

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid las logs shig na dmigs su med pa'i phyir bdag la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid las logs shig na dmigs su med pa'i phyir bdag la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is not observed to be separate from the characteristics of the aggregates, like the self, etc.

original: brjod min rdzas med mi 'dod de //
analyzed: brjod min rdzas med mi 'dod de //
translated: The Buddha is not accepted as inexpressible and substantially nonexistent,

original: snga ma bzhin du bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: because the former is refuted,

original: bum pa bzhin du brjod min na //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin du brjod min na //
translated: and because the latter is like a pot.

original: de ni ji ltar sangs rgyas 'dod //üîΩces bya ba ni phung po rnams nyid kyang sangs rgyas ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar sangs rgyas 'dod // ces bya ba ni phung po rnams nyid kyang sangs rgyas ma yin la /
translated: How can the Buddha be accepted as inexpressible?üîΩThe aggregates themselves are not the Buddha.

original: phung po rnams nyid las gzhan pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po rnams nyid las gzhan pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha is not separate from the aggregates.

original: gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na yang /
translated: The Buddha is not to be expressed as either the same as or different from the aggregates.

original: de ni dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin du sangs rgyas chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin du sangs rgyas chad par 'gyur te /
translated: The Buddha is not substantially existent because he is not a thing, and because he is not inexpressible, he is like a pot.

original: snga ma bzhin du bsal ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bsal ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Inexpressibility is not reasonable, because the former is refuted.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyang skye ba med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyang skye ba med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha is also taught to be non-arisen.

original: de'i phyir lung las //
analyzed: de'i phyir lung las //
translated: Thus, a scripture says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is always a non-arisen phenomenon.

original: chos rnams thams cad bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
translated: All phenomena are like the Sugata.

original: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams //
translated: Those with childish understanding who grasp signs

original: 'jig rten dag na chos rnams med la spyod //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa zag med dge ba yi //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na chos rnams med la spyod // de bzhin gshegs pa zag med dge ba yi //
translated: Engage with non-existent phenomena in the world.

original: chos kyi gzugs brnyan yin te 'di la ni //
analyzed: chos kyi gzugs brnyan yin te 'di la ni //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is a reflection of the uncontaminated virtueüîΩOf phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid med de bzhin gshegs med kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid med de bzhin gshegs med kyang //
translated: Here, there is no suchness, nor is there a TathƒÅgata,

original: 'jig rten kun na gzugs brnyan kun tu snang //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun na gzugs brnyan kun tu snang //
translated: Yet a reflection appears in all worlds.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang de bzhin du 'jam dpal skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dgag so zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag kyang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang de bzhin du 'jam dpal skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dgag so zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag kyang grub pa yin no //
translated: And similarly, it is established that Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´‚Äôs ‚Äúnon-arisen and unceasing‚Äù is a term for the TathƒÅgata.

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du skye mched rnams ni skye ba yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du skye mched rnams ni skye ba yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: But if you think that the sense spheres definitely do arise,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung mthong bas //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung mthong bas //
translated: Because of seeing dependent origination,

original: chos dang sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phyir //üîΩrmi lam gyi glang po che yod pa ma yin pa mthong bas ni /
analyzed: chos dang sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phyir // rmi lam gyi glang po che yod pa ma yin pa mthong bas ni /
translated: One sees the Dharma and the Buddha.

original: chos dang sangs rgyas mthong bar ma gsungs so //
analyzed: chos dang sangs rgyas mthong bar ma gsungs so //
translated: But it is not said that one sees the Dharma and the Buddha by seeing the non-existent elephant in a dream.

original: 'di skad ces sus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di skad ces sus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúWhoever sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: sus chos mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes ni gsungs pas de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi skye mched rnams ni skye ba yod pa kho nar sems na /
analyzed: sus chos mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes ni gsungs pas de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi skye mched rnams ni skye ba yod pa kho nar sems na /
translated: Whoever sees the Dharma sees the Buddha.‚Äù Therefore, if you think that the dependent origination of the sense spheres has an intrinsic reality, and that they are produced,

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung mthong bas //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung mthong bas //
translated: Because of seeing dependent origination,

original: chos dang sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phyir //üîΩskye @116a * //
analyzed: chos dang sangs rgyas mthong ba'i phyir // skye @116a * //
translated: One sees the Dharma and the Buddha.

original: mched skye yod mi 'dod de //
analyzed: mched skye yod mi 'dod de //
translated: We do not assert that the sense spheres are produced,

original: snga ma bzhin du bsal phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bsal phyir ro //
translated: Because they are refuted in the same way as before.

original: zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos 'di nyid kyi dang por bdag dang gzhan gnyis dang rgyu med pa las skye ba med par bstan pas skye ba yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang / gzhan la sogs par brtag mi bzod par bsal zin pa'i phyir ji ltar de mthong bas chos dang sangs rgyas mthong ba yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos 'di nyid kyi dang por bdag dang gzhan gnyis dang rgyu med pa las skye ba med par bstan pas skye ba yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang / gzhan la sogs par brtag mi bzod par bsal zin pa'i phyir ji ltar de mthong bas chos dang sangs rgyas mthong ba yod par 'gyur /
translated: How could seeing that lead to seeing the Dharma and the Buddha?

original: don de nyid kyang brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: don de nyid kyang brtag par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of that should be analyzed:

original: bdag dang gzhan gnyis rgyu med min //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gnyis rgyu med min //
translated: It is not from self, not from another, not from both,

original: yod med rtag dang mi rtag min //
analyzed: yod med rtag dang mi rtag min //
translated: not existent, not nonexistent, not permanent, not impermanent,

original: gzhan dang gzhan min skye med pas //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan min skye med pas //
translated: not from other, not from nonother, not from arising,

original: rtag dang chad pa rnam par spangs //üîΩskye ba yod min med pa min //
analyzed: rtag dang chad pa rnam par spangs // skye ba yod min med pa min //
translated: thus it is free of permanence and annihilation.üîΩArising does not exist, nor does nonexistence,

original: yod med ma yin de gang na //
analyzed: yod med ma yin de gang na //
translated: nor does it exist and not exist.

original: de mthong ston pa mthong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de mthong ston pa mthong 'gyur ba //
translated: Seeing that is seeing the Teacher.

original: ji lta bur ni shes par bya //
analyzed: ji lta bur ni shes par bya //
translated: How is that to be known?

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par skye ba grub na ni de mthong bas chos dang sangs rgyas mthong bar yang 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par skye ba grub na ni de mthong bas chos dang sangs rgyas mthong bar yang 'gyur grang na /
translated: If arising were established ultimately, then by seeing that, one would also see the Dharma and the Buddha.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis skye ba de nyid bstan par dka' na de nyid du de mthong ba ga la yod de mthong ba yod pa ma yin na chos dang sangs rgyas mthong bar yod re skan /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis skye ba de nyid bstan par dka' na de nyid du de mthong ba ga la yod de mthong ba yod pa ma yin na chos dang sangs rgyas mthong bar yod re skan /
translated: But if it is difficult to teach that very arising in the manner that it is taught, how could one see that very arising? If seeing does not exist, how could seeing the Dharma and the Buddha exist?üîΩTherefore, the words of the proponents of intrinsic reality

original: de phyir ngo bo nyid smra'i tshig /'dod pa rnam par nyams pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir ngo bo nyid smra'i tshig /'dod pa rnam par nyams pa yin //
translated: are undermined by their own assertions.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams mthong pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsam so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams mthong pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsam so //
translated: Since intrinsic reality does not exist, seeing things is also not established.

original: smras pa / ci rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa kho na yin zhing de ma mthong bas chos dang sangs rgyas mthong ba yang med pa kho na yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / ci rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa kho na yin zhing de ma mthong bas chos dang sangs rgyas mthong ba yang med pa kho na yin nam zhe na /
translated: Objection: Is it that dependent origination does not exist at all, and that by not seeing that, seeing the Dharma and the Buddha does not exist at all?üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gang la skye ba sgyu ma yi //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang la skye ba sgyu ma yi //
translated: For whom arising is like an illusion

original: skye ba yod pa de la rung //
analyzed: skye ba yod pa de la rung //
translated: It is suitable for one who has birth.

original: ci zhig rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig rung zhe na /
translated: What is suitable?

original: smras pa'i nyes pa'i dri bsal bas //
analyzed: smras pa'i nyes pa'i dri bsal bas //
translated: The stain of the fault of speech is removed.

original: dam chos sgron ma rab bstan phyir //
analyzed: dam chos sgron ma rab bstan phyir //
translated: The lamp of the true Dharma is well taught.

original: mdzad pas phan thogs tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: mdzad pas phan thogs tshul gyis ni //
translated: By the method of benefiting through activity,

original: kun rdzob tu ni sangs rgyas mthong //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sangs rgyas mthong //
translated: the Buddha is seen conventionally.

original: zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs par smra ba'i skyon rnams nyid dri ma ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs par smra ba'i skyon rnams nyid dri ma ste /
translated: The faults of the proponents of existence, nonexistence, and so on are stains.

original: de bsal zhing bral bar byas bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i dam pa'i chos kyi sgron ma gti mug gi mun pa 'dzoms pa ji skad bstan pa gang yin pa de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mdzad pas phan 'dogs pa'i tshul gyis kun rdzob
analyzed: de bsal zhing bral bar byas bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i dam pa'i chos kyi sgron ma gti mug gi mun pa 'dzoms pa ji skad bstan pa gang yin pa de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mdzad pas phan 'dogs pa'i tshul gyis kun rdzob
translated: By removing and separating from them, the lamp of the true Dharma called dependent origination, which illuminates the darkness of delusion, is well taught.

original: tu sangs rgyas mthong bar rung ngo //
analyzed: tu sangs rgyas mthong bar rung ngo //
translated: By the method of benefiting through activity, the Buddha is seen conventionally.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus pa'i bdag nyid ngo bo nyid med pa kun rdzob pa'i shes pas mthong na de dang tha mi dad pa'i chos mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / @116b stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i sangs rgyas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus pa'i bdag nyid ngo bo nyid med pa kun rdzob pa'i shes pas mthong na de dang tha mi dad pa'i chos mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / @116b stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i sangs rgyas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one sees dependent origination, which is the nature of the collection of things that lack entityness, with conventional consciousness, then one also sees the Buddha, which is the nature of the collection of things that lack entityness, such as the signs and excellent features, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the unique qualities of the Buddha, and so on, which are not different from that.üîΩBut isn‚Äôt that seeing reality?

original: 'on de nyid don dam par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on de nyid don dam par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩIt is said:

original: bshad pa / de ni de nyid mthong min te //
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni de nyid mthong min te //
translated: That is not seeing reality,

original: sgyu 'dra yang dag ma yin phyir //
analyzed: sgyu 'dra yang dag ma yin phyir //
translated: Because it is like an illusion, it is not real.

original: zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de nyid yang dag par rnam par dpyad na rgyu rkyen tshogs pa tha dad pa dag la dngos por dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de nyid yang dag par rnam par dpyad na rgyu rkyen tshogs pa tha dad pa dag la dngos por dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: When dependent origination is analyzed in reality, the entities that are imputed to the collection of causes and conditions are not observed.

original: sgyu ma byas pa dang 'dra bas mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba zhes tha snyad gdags pa de yang kun rdzob yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa dang 'dra bas mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba zhes tha snyad gdags pa de yang kun rdzob yin no //
translated: Since it is like a conjuring trick, the conventional expression ‚Äúseeing is non-seeing‚Äù is also a superficial reality.üîΩAnd that is also:

original: de yang / rab tu rtag min rnam shes min //
analyzed: de yang / rab tu rtag min rnam shes min //
translated: Not thoroughly imagined, not consciousness,

original: brtag bya ma yin dpe med pa //üîΩmtshan ma med cing snang ba med //
analyzed: brtag bya ma yin dpe med pa // mtshan ma med cing snang ba med //
translated: Not an object of investigation, without example,üîΩWithout signs, without appearance,

original: rnam rtog med cing yi ge med //
analyzed: rnam rtog med cing yi ge med //
translated: Without discursive thought, without syllables,

original: lta ba'i blo yis rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: lta ba'i blo yis rtogs bya ba //
translated: To be realized by the mind of vision,

original: mthong ba med pas de mthong yin //
analyzed: mthong ba med pas de mthong yin //
translated: Not seen, it is seeing.

original: zhes bya ba la rab tu brtag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don ni sngar phyag 'tshal ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa dag gi skabs su bshad pa bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rab tu brtag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don ni sngar phyag 'tshal ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa dag gi skabs su bshad pa bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: As for the meaning of the words ‚Äúnot thoroughly imagined‚Äù and so on, it should be understood as explained in the section on the verse of salutation.

original: lta ba'i blo yis rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: lta ba'i blo yis rtogs bya ba //
translated: To be realized by the mind of vision,

original: zhes bya ba ni rab tu spyod pa med pa'i tshul gyis rab tu spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blos rtogs par bya ba chos kyi de nyid so sor rang gis rig par bya ba thub pa'i yul gyi dngos por yang mi 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab tu spyod pa med pa'i tshul gyis rab tu spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blos rtogs par bya ba chos kyi de nyid so sor rang gis rig par bya ba thub pa'i yul gyi dngos por yang mi 'gyur pa ste /
translated: Thus, the reality of phenomena, which is to be realized by the intellect that has the characteristic of engagement through the mode of non-engagement, is not a thing that is the domain of the Sage, which is to be known by oneself individually.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the intrinsic reality of all phenomena is not established.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba med pa de mthong ba yin no zhes mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba'o zhes nye bar gdags te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba med pa de mthong ba yin no zhes mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba'o zhes nye bar gdags te /
translated: Therefore, that non-seeing is seeing. Thus, non-seeing itself is designated as seeing.

original: ji skad du mthong ba med pa de nyid mthong ba'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du mthong ba med pa de nyid mthong ba'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThat non-seeing is itself seeing.‚Äù

original: skye ba dgag pa ji skad bstan pa dag gi mjug sdud par byed pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dgag pa ji skad bstan pa dag gi mjug sdud par byed pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the summary of the refutation of arising as it has been presented:

original: de ni don dam nyid du na //
analyzed: de ni don dam nyid du na //
translated: That is the ultimate.

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,
